loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Peninah, who is 25 years old, married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand eastern Africa (HIH EA) in June 2014.

Peninah runs a tree nursery where she sells tree seedlings to earn a living. She is grateful to HiH EA for developing an entrepreneurship spirit in her through training and mentorship programs. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase tree seeds for propagation. She believes with a variety of trees for sale, she will attract more customers to her nursery, and hence, more income to enable her to support her young family's needs, such as food and education for her children.

Peninah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase tree seeds that will her boost tree nursery business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 18 years old and single. She is a hard working woman living in Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. For the past two years, Helen has been working hard to manage her clothing shop. 

Helen has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda for 150,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more clothes. With this loan, Helen will be able to generate greater profits and expand her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big shop. 

Helen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Turkana

texts.en:
Turkana is 22 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is repairs old and broken furniture. Turkana is works in a small shop selling daily products, such as milk, bread, butter, sugar, fruits, and vegetables, which she has been doing for two years. She earns 150 AZN monthly. 

Turkana requested a loan for 1,500 AZN, which she will use to buy new products so that she can vary her product offerings. She wants to increase her income because her family's income is very low and they cannot meet their needs. She hopes to earn enough money so she can provide her children with a good education

loans.use: to purchase new products for her food store

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is 42 years old. She is married and has a son and a daughter. Her husband is a labourer and earns little money. The members of the family are refugees, and they live in an IDP settlement. Fatma is a farmer. She keeps two cows and breeds and fattens them. Then she uses their milk to make dairy products (yoghurt, milk, cheese and butter) and sells it to neighbours. On Sundays she drives with her husband to the local bazaar and sells her products there. She has worked in this business for 20 years and is a very experienced farmer. Fatma's income is very low, and they can barely cover the family's needs. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy one cow and increase her productivity. This will help her to sell more products and earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy one cow and increase productivity

loans.name: Fortalezas De La Cascada Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZAS DE LA CASCADA” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jhoselyn es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de productos por catálogo, tienda de barrio, venta de productos de telefonía, venta de edredones y frazadas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jhoselyn es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pasankalla (pipocas de maíz); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien tenía el mismo negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide invertir sus ahorros en un negocio similar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pasankalla por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Fortalezas de la Cascada” Communal Bank will begin the eleventh cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada Regional Office. It is composed of eight members, and it is directed by a board of directors, of which Señora Jhoselyn is president. The members of the communal bank conduct various businesses, among which are: clothing sales, sales of products by catalog, a neighborhood store, sales of telephone products, and sales of quilts and blankets.

The loan that they will take will benefit the women micro-entrepreneurs of whom Señora Jhoselyn is a member.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago by invitation, through a massive promotion carried out in her area by the institution. Currently, she has a business selling pasankalla, (sweet popcorn).  She says that she learned this business from her mother, who had the same business, and that over time she decided to invest her savings in a similar business.

The loan that she is taking now is for increasing capital (the purchase of pasankalla at wholesale). She will get it from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz, and sell it later in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the health care that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase pasankalla [sweet popcorn] at wholesale.

loans.name: Nueva  Generacion - Sayllapata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION - SAYLLAPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Colquepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa ella es conviviente y tiene 28 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesania.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Nueva Generacion – Sayllapata.” This bank is located in the district of Colquepata, part of the province of Paucartambo in the area of Cusco.
The member is Jesusa, she has a partner, she is 28 years old, and she has 3 children. She works in her craftwork business, she sells fabrics, sweaters, blankets, and looms. She sells a variety of fabric. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She has had this business for 8 years, and it is going well. Her dream is to expand her business selling fabrics and looms. She asks for a loan to purchase fabrics, sweaters, and looms. 
The other members work in the sale of animals, sale of cereals, grocery store, and selling craftwork. 
The member is grateful to those who form a part of this dream through this medium, and is committed to meet the payment of her fees at the established time.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, sweaters, and looms.

loans.name: Crisbille

texts.en:
Crisbille is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, like coffee, spices, chips, sugar, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like raising pigs.

Crisbille dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like coffee, spices, chips, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rutchelle

texts.en:
Rutchelle is 41 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like coffee, eggs, milk, and sugar, etc.

Rutchelle has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like coffee, eggs, milk, and sugar, etc

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas vive con sus padres, tiene una pequeña Micro Industria Familiar de calzados en donde todos colaboran en las tareas.
El esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ser alguien en la vida y con ello poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Lucas lives with his parents and has a small family micro-business of footwear in which everyone contributes in the work. He is studying a career in accounting and through his studies he wants to be someone in life and be able to help his loved ones. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for his career and with this be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTIAGO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de busos, venta de ropa, venta de alcohol, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de busos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de amauta (ceremonias autóctonas); da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace siete años, adquiriendo el conocimiento de los rituales de amigos que conocía. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra materiales para las ceremonias) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo implementará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "SANTIAGO" is starting its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Regional Office of Collpani. The group is composed of eight members and is headed by a board of directors, of which Virginia is the president. The businesses that members of the communal bank are involved in are varied; among them they are sales of sportswear, clothing, alcohol, traditional woven blankets, and sweaters, and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they will take out will benefit this group of small microentrepreneurs, of which Virginia is a member. She reports that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago by the invitation of an advisor from this institution who visited her in her home. Currently she has a service business offering amauta (native ceremonies); she started this business seven years ago, acquiring knowledge of the rituals from friends she knew.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy materials for ceremonies, which she will buy from sellers in the city of El Alto and then implement in her business space. This business allows her to make income to support her family financially; she lives with a partner and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health care offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy materials for ceremonies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria proviene de una familia humilde y muy trabajadora, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y con ello quiere poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder ser una profesional útil, no solo a sí misma, sino también a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y con ello poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Maria comes from a humble and very hard-working family. She is studying Nursing and in doing this she wants to be able to help her family and loved-ones. She is putting everything into becoming a useful professional, not only for herself but for society too. She is requesting this loan to cover the expenses of her studies and with that she can pay this expense and be able to continue on with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her courses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school equipment.

loans.name: Analia

texts.es:
Ana proviene de una familia humilde, es una persona que con mucho sacrificio va alcanzando sus metas. 
Se encuentra en el 3er año de la carrera de Contaduría. Actualmente se desempeña en el área de atención al cliente de un banco. Una de sus metas es ser una profesional exitosa y contar con un negocio independiente.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Ana comes from a humble family. She is a person who with much sacrifice reaches her goals. She is now in her 3rd year of Accounting. She actually works in Client Services in a bank. One of her goals is to be a successful professional and have an independent business. She is requesting this loan to pay the tuition of her course so that she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her studies.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es de la ciudad de Pilar, está cursando la carrera de fisioterapia en su primer año. Desea terminar su carrera para mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de su familia.
Él es una persona que quiere salir adelante es por ello que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo, es por eso que agradece esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Oscar is from the city of Pilar and is pursuing a career in physiotherapy in his first year. He wishes to finish his studies in order to improve his income and the quality of life of his family.

He is a person who wants to succeed. It is for this that he is giving his all in order to grow and succeed. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay for the fees of his career and thus be able to continue his studies as he has been doing, and it is for this that he appreciates this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nargizahon

texts.en: Nargizahon is a gentle woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is married and has two children. At her young age she has a business in the market and earns money to feed and raise her children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Nargizahon does business buying and selling textiles and has permanent clients. She buys from one market and sells in another market. She rents a small stall in the market and sells her large assortment of textiles. She requested a loan to buy textiles for the coming season. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy textile to coming season

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru: Это Махсуда. Ей 28 лет. Она еще не замужем. Махсуда в районе Вахш живет вместе с мамой, папой, братом и племянником. Родители занимается животноводством. Брат находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Махсуда занимается земледелием. Махсуда имеет 5,5 Га земельный участок. Она выращивает хлопок. Махсуда свободное время занимается животноводством, помогает родителям в работе. Она очень трудолюбивая девушка. Махсуда более 5 лет занимается своей деятельности. В этом году Махсуда хочет, посадит хлопок. Она  вперед посадки хочет отработать землю минеральными удобрениями. Потому что минеральные удобрения помогает получить качественный и богатый урожай. По этой причине Махсуда обратилась за кредитом. За счет кредита она купить минеральные удобрения и семян хлопок.
texts.en:
This is Mahsuda. She is 28 years old. She is still not married. Mahsuda lives in the Vahsh district with her mother, father, brother, and nephew. Her parents work in animal husbandry. Her brother is in Russia looking for a job. 

Mahsuda herself works in agriculture. Mahsuda has 5.5 hectares of land. She grows cotton. In her spare time, Mahsuda works in animal husbandry, helping her parents with their work. She is a very hardworking young woman. 

Mahsuda has been working in her business for more than five years. This year, Mahsuda wants to grow cotton. Before planting, she wants to go over the land with mineral fertilisers, because mineral fertilisers help to grow high quality and rich harvests. For this reason, Mahsuda has applied for a loan. At the expense of the loan, she will buy mineral fertilisers and cotton seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilisers and cotton seeds

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is a hardworking woman. She is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. 

For the past 5 years, Angella has been working hard to manage her hairdressing salon. 

To help expand her business, Angella has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chemicals, braids and shampoos, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve her salon. 

She hopes that in the future she will be able to build a residential house. 

Angella is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, braids and shampoos

loans.name: Danivers

texts.en:
Danivers is 54 years old, and he supports eight family members. He has been a butcher for the last 20 years, and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to purchase livestock for meat so as to meet the demand of his customers in the whole region. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for meat so as to meet the demand of his customers in the whole region.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Dinah works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Dinah is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Dinah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of charcoal to sell to customers.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like noodles, coffee, soft drinks, etc. in her general store. She has been in this business for 3 years. She also earns more income from fishing.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like noodles, coffee, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribeth is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maribeth has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies to use for her business.

Maribeth has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies to use for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old; she is married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, chips, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, chips, eggs, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 23 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Shiela requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens and buy feed.

Shiela has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Shiela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens and buy feed

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda is 62 years old and married with ten children.

Luvisminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Luvisminda has borrowed and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Luvisminda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer that will improve the harvest and increase her income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Mitaboni Silkworm S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Joseph, a member of Mitaboni Silkworm S.H.G. Group. He is 67 years old, married and a father of six. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development and financial management.

He practices vegetable farming and dairy farming as his economic activities. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer and pesticides to boost his production and hence, earn more income to pay for his family's needs, e.g., food, access to better health care and school fees for his children. 

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to boost his production

loans.name: Viniranda

texts.en:
Viniranda is 55 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Viniranda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives with her parents and sister in Arevshat village of the Ararat region. She studies in a university of pedagogy to become a teacher of mathematics and physics. Anush studies hard so she will be able to become a good specialist and do the job she really likes. 

The loan will be a big support for her to pay for university tuition. She hopes for lenders' support and is ensuring responsible monthly payments of the loan.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed to help improve her productivity.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en: Adel is a special needs client from Iraq. He is a 44-year-old man who is married and has 4 children. Adel has a car repair shop. He established his workshop in 2005 after he developed his skills with previous experience in other workshops. Now he is very well known and has a good reputation in the surrounding area. Adel applied for a loan amounting to $2,400 to install a new ceiling and renovate the workshop floor. He aims to grow his business, provide better life standards for his family and meet all his children's needs.

loans.use: to install a new ceiling and renovate his workshop floor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and manure that will help boost farm output.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
La Señorita Cynthia es empleada de una firma contable, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, que le permitirá seguir creciendo en su vida personal y profesional.
Ella es una persona que está poniendo todo de si para ser útil a la sociedad, pide este préstamo para la compra de útiles Universitarios y así poder seguir su carrera profesional, y estar cada vez más cerca de sus metas.
texts.en:
Miss Cynthia is employed in an accounting firm, and is studying for a degree in accounting. This will permit her to continue growing in her personal and professional life. 

She is a person who is putting all of herself to be useful in society. She is requesting this loan to buy university tools and be able to continue with her professional career and each time be closer to her goals.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her career.

loans.name: Hawraa

texts.en:
Hawraa is 22 year old and single. She has been working in a mobile phones shop for two years to cover her needs and expenses. She is ambitious and independent and is working hard to improve her living conditions despite her low financial and social situations.

Hawraa wants to get married and start a family with her future husband. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua to pay her wedding expenses as her limited salary is not enough.

loans.use: to pay her wedding expenses

loans.name: Salamu

texts.en:
Salamu is a hard working woman. Salamu is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Salamu has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, tea leaves, bread, rice, and posho. 

To help expand her business, Salamu has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, tea leaves, bread, rice, and posho, and will help Salamu to generate greater profits and improve on the retail shop. Salamu hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the shop. 

Salamu is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more sugar, salt, tea leaves, bread, rice, and posho for her retail shop

loans.name: Fauza

texts.en:
Fauza is a hard working woman. Fauza is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Fauza has been working hard to manage her business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Fauza has requested a loan of 850,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Fauza to generate greater profits and increase her stock. Fauza hopes that in the future she will be able to improve on her business. 

Fauza is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her clothing business

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a hard working woman. Justine is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children who are currently in school. 

For the past five years, Justine has been working hard to manage her charcoal business. To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and educate her children. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her business. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy a dairy cow to enable him buy cloth to make clothes for his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to supply milk to her customers and meet their needs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking female entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Wilma dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell .

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 62 years old, married, and has seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like milk, spices, soap, noodles, etc.  Norma has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like milk, spices, soap, noodles, etc

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 34 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jean has a general store business in the Philippines. Jean requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Jean has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Las Artesanas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
Joela es una  mujer de 34 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de las edades entre 8 y 10 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Joela ( es la señora de en medio de suéter verde) con afán de obtener sus ingresos y sostener a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica desde hace  3 años,  pero  para mejorar sus ingresos también realiza artículos de mostacia.

Joela ahora se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para comprar hilos jaspeados para elaborar más ropas típicas, por tal razón a organizado a un grupo de mujeres para que juntas  logren sus objetivos.
Joela sueña con poder remodelar su casa y darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Joela is a 34-year-old woman. She is single, and she has two children between the ages of 8 and 10. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

Joela (the lady in the middle, wearing a green sweater), has been making traditional clothing for three years, in an effort to earn an income and support her family, but she also makes beaded items in order to improve her income.

Currently, Joela needs to request a loan to purchase hilos jaspeados [threads that are specially woven to produce a marbleized effect], in order to make more traditional clothing.  For reasons such as this, she has organized a group of women, so that together, they may achieve their goals. 

Joela dreams of being able to renovate her house and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase thread, and "marble threads" for making traditional clothing.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
As a maried parent of five children, Myra works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Myra is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 42 years old and he lives with his nice, big family in the frontier village of Lusadzor in the Tavush region. Andranik was born here and for 22 years already he has been engaged in farming and agriculture here. He has cows, heifers, pigs and chickens on his farm, and he also cultivates a large plot of land. 

Since Andranik has a large family, he must work hard on his farm in order to earn enough for their numerous needs. He lives with his mother, wife and three children. With the help of his mother, Andranik sells his farm produce such as milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese, butter, meat and eggs. His mother sells most of his farm produce to their neighbors, but the harvest from his land and orchard (potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, carrots and greens, as well as apples, figs, grapes and mulberries) he sells at the local wholesale market. 

Andranik is asking for this loan as he wants to buy a bull in order to increase the number of cattle on his farm and develop meat sales, and to purchase fodder for his pigs.

loans.use: to buy a bull in order to increase the number of cattle on his farm, and also fodder for his pigs

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Harrison is a 39-year-old man who has managed, with few resources but much creativity, to set up a farming business. He lives in Thika, a small remote rural town in Kenya that has bad terrain and is characterized by drought and bad weather conditions. For the past 10 years, Harrison has been actively involved in mixed farming. His primary source of income is from milk and crop farming. Harrison loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of his cows. Milking his cow is his hobby and feeding his cows makes him very proud. Dairy farming is very fulfilling for Harrison. He faces the challenge of irrigating his farm and providing water to his animals. Thika is a remote area without piped water or electricity. Since Harrison is from a marginalized community, he is forced to walk long distances to search for water. He typically walks for two hours. Therefore, Harrison is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the rain water in his area goes to waste and Harrison wants to harvest the water and store it in a water tank. The loan will save Harrison time and allow him to irrigate his farm during dry seasons and increase his productivity. The increase in productivity will translate into more income, which will provide him with financial security. Harrison will also use the stored water for home consumption. Harrison’s dream is to increase his farming activities and provide his children with a proper education. Education is the only way that his children, who are from a marginalized community, can succeed.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and water pipes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN PADRE DE FAMILIA QUE TIENE PROBLEMAS VISUALES AL IGUAL QUE SU ESPOSA, ELLA SE ENCARGA DEL CUIDADO DE SUS HIJOS PERO EN LOS ÚLTIMOS MESES SE LE HA COMPLICAOD AYUDARLES HASTA CON SUS TAREAS DE LA ESCUELA POR ESTE PROBLEMA. NECESITAN EL APOYO PARA QUE LA ESPOSA PUEDA TENER LA OPERACION Y APOYAR CON ELL TRABAJO Y EL APOYO EN LA CASA.
texts.en: This borrower is a father and suffers from the same visual problems as his wife.  She takes care of their children, but in recent months things have gotten complicated when she tries to help them with their schoolwork.  They need assistance so that the wife can have an operation and support him with his work and managing their household.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's eye surgery.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a widow and she has a 10-year-old grandson. She has her own house and, little by little, she is making repairs and finishing construction jobs on her house.

This time she needs a loan to fix up the room where her grandson sleeps. A wall needs to be finished, and it is necesary to do some painting and to repair the floor.

Rosa is a retired woman but the money she gets is not enough, and her grandson's mother is unemployed. 

She really hopes you will trust her again.

loans.use: to fix up the room where her grandson sleeps

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Progreso Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Progreso Rekavo está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas quieren luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Virginia, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y buena en lo que hace, es por ello que tiene ya mucha clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carnes, hortalizas, carne y otros, de manera a poder seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas,  con ello poder seguir luchando por dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
The "Progreso Rekavo" group is in their 3rd loan cycle with the Woman's Committee Program where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are taking the Poverty Stoplight survey where they all want to fight to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One of the members is Virginia. She sells meals that she makes herself every day from an early hour which later she goes out to sell itinerantly. She is a very demanding woman and good at what she does. So she has many clients and always gets lots of orders. She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, meats, greens and others and in this way she can continue with making her meals. And she can continue to struggle to give her family all that she could not have.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make meals like vegetables, meat, greens and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 34-year-old single lady who has been working in a clothes shop since eight years ago. She is trying desperately to cover her needs and expenses.
Marie is an ambitious and hard worker.  She is responsible for herself and is working hard to improve her living conditions.  Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate her life and help her move easily.

loans.use: to buy a car which will  facilitate her life

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tools for making sweets

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: Nigora is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1988. She is living in a rural area. She is divorced and lives with her parents. Nigora has seven years practice doing business serving people. She is a tailor and sews traditional women's dresses. She works at a tailor shop and has permanent clients every day. She is well known among tailors and clients. She is asking financial support to buy textiles and needed items for sewing. She hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy textile and needed items for sewing

loans.name: Las Tejedoras De Patabamba Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS TEJEDORAS DE PATABAMBA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Calca, distrito de Coya y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Sabina tiene 44 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al negocio de artesanía, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of "The Weavers of Patabamba" communal bank, which is located in the province of Calca, district of Coya and department of Cusco. Sabina is 44 years old and is married. She spends her days devoted to the artisan goods business. 

Sabina has spent a good deal of time with her business and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. She wishes to be able to continue working in this manner in order to help her family.

Sabina is requesting a loan to purchase sweaters and other items to sell.

All the members of the group are grateful for the loans offered and they promise to comply with their established repayment schedules.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters among other items to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de artesanía, la socia se siente agradecida con KIVA por el apoyo que le proporciona y por  ayudarla en el mantenimiento de su actividad, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aretes, collares entre otros.
texts.en:
Adelaida belongs to "The Diamonds" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

She continues to dedicate herself to the artisan business. Adelaida is grateful to Kiva for the help if offers and for its assistance in maintaining her activity. Adelaida is a responsible and enterprising person who wishes to be able to continue working so that, in this manner, she can continue to help her family.

Adelaida is requesting the loan to purchase earrings and necklaces among other items to sell.

loans.use: to purchase earrings and necklaces, among other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  more stock for her shop, e.g, sugar, new clothes, salt, beans, maize, etc.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 26 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. 

Milka has had a farming business for fiveyears and it has been profitable. She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs and hopes this will help her generate more income . 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to provide enough food for the family and to pay school fees and buy farm equipment.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 46 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them. For ten years, Rowena has run a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 8000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy items to sell such as junk foods, home care products, and groceries. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda, 58, is a married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. She has been doing this business for eight years. Rosalinda requested a 8500 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy more firewood to sell. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Milagros is 62 years old now.

Milagros has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5500 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and for the maintenance for her fishing boat.

Milagros has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other maintainance for her fishing boat

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

Jocelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like noodles, spices, sardines and other groceries.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like noodles, spices, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Ala is 41 years old and lives in the frontier village of Yenokavan of the Tavush region.   She happily lives with her big family and runs farming. Ala lives with her husband, two children and parents-in-law. Both Ala and her husband are farmers.  On the farm Ala has cows, a pig and chickens. Her land is rich with harvest such as potatoes, cabbage, carrots, garlic, tomatoes, cucumbers and greens. Her orchard is also nice and full of sweet harvests of apple, apricot, figs and nuts. She and her husband sell all her farm products at the wholesale market. Since framing is the only source of income for her family she works a lot and hard to make the monthly income a little bit more and to meet family needs. 

She will be so thankful if she manages to receive this loan in order to buy several bulls for her farm which will both enlarge her farm and the income from it as well.

loans.use: to buy several bulls for her farm which will both enlarge her farm and income

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Luzviminda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 5500 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and for the maintenance for her fishing boat.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and maintainance for her fishing boat

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Pacita is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Pacita has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5500 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Pacita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Pacita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 48 years old and widowed with three children, two of whom are in school. Corazon works very hard to provide for them. For nine years, Corazon has run a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 5000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, and groceries. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married and has one child. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.  In the future, Marilou would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a fruit picker for Serendipalm, an organic and fair trade certified oil palm mill, and she also grows organic oil palms. She lives in Akim-Asuom, in the Kwaebibirem District of Ghana’s Eastern Region. She is 58 years old, a widow with four children. All her children are attending school. 

Margaret is interested in organic oil palm farming because it is sustainable and has helped develop her community through Fair Trade projects for health, education, and infrastructure. She wishes to secure a microloan so that she can expand her organic oil palm field. This will help her fund her children’s education today while developing a property that will also yield fruit in years to come.

loans.use: to expand her organic oil palm field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his organic oil palm field

loans.name: Yasaman

texts.en:
Yasaman is 46 years old, and she is refugee. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is a master and repairs broken utensils. They live in a small old house in IDP settlement. The family's income is very small and they can hardly cover family needs. 

Yasaman is a farmer. She keeps livestock and breeds them. She has two cows and uses milk to make dairy products and sell them. She sells milk, butter, cheese, yogurt, etc.  Her monthly income is 200 AZN. She has worked in this area for 24 years and has good experience. All neighbours buy her products because they are always fresh and tasty.

Yasaman applied for 1000 AZN in order to buy one cow and increase productivity. This will help her to increase products and income for family.

loans.use: to buy one cow and increase productivity

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Higidia Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Higidia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Diamantes” .
La socia continua con su negocio de  venta de desayunos de forma ambulatoria como mates, jugo de quinua y huevo cocido, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche entre otros.
L a socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Higidia belongs to the communal bank, “Los Diamantes” [The Diamonds]. 

She continues her street vendor business, selling breakfasts such as mates, quinoa juice, and boiled eggs.  She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She wants to be able to keep working, and in this way, continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of sugar and milk, among other things. She feels grateful for the loan that she has been granted, and she is committed to making her established payments.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and milk, among other things.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia Margot pertenece al banco comunal "LOS DIAMANTES".
La socia  sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta y confección de cortinas, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de teleas,hilos entre otros.
texts.en:
Margo belongs to the communal bank, “Los Diamantes” [The Diamonds]. 

She continues dedicating herself to the business of making and selling curtains. She feels grateful for the loan that she has been granted, and she is committed to making her established payments. She is a responsible and diligent person, and she wants to be able to continue working, so that she can continue supporting her family in this way.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of fabric, thread, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and other items.

loans.name: Yessenia Monserrate

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De Crédito La Mocora
En este lugar vive la señora Yessenia, tiene 39 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 9  y 5 años de edad,  el mayor estudia en colegio y los  menores en escuela. Su esposo es cerrajero.
Doña Yessenia con la finalidad de ayudarle a su marido con la carga familiar  realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en sus actividades, él tiene un taller de cerrajería en la localidad y necesita comprar ciertas herramientas así como materiales pues actualmente tiene mucho trabajo por realizar, es gracias a los créditos que él puede solventar estos gastos, el  elabora puertas, ventanas, techos y otras estructuras con el hierro, ella está muy agradecida con la Fundación y con las personas de Kiva que hacen posible que ella reciba sus créditos ya que es así como ellos pueden salir adelante y mejorar su vida, ella está por repetir un crédito con la institución y así seguir mejorando su vida.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar herramientas, hierro, pintura y otros  materiales necesarios para su trabajo. Lleva 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos salen adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of La Mocora Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the town of La Mocora in Colón Parish in the city of Portoviejo, an area known for its hardworking people who earn a living in agriculture and ranching.

Yessenia, 39, lives there.  She's married and has three children, ages 14, 9, and 5.  The oldest one is in high school and the younger ones are in school.  Her husband's a locksmith.

Yessenia wants to help her husband with the family responsibilities, so she's getting a loan for him to use in his work.  He has a metal shop in the area and needs to buy some tools and other materials.  He has a lot of work to do at the moment.  Thanks to the loans he's able to cover these expenses.  He makes doors, windows, roofs, and other metal structures.

Yessenia's very grateful to the Fundación and to people who make it possible for her to receive her Kiva loans, because that's how she can get ahead and improve her life.  She's about to get another loan with the institution so they can continue to improve their lives.

She's going to use this loan to buy tools, metal, paint, and other materials she needs for work.

Yessenia has been in the communal bank for five years and she likes it because they get ahead thanks to the loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy tools, metal, paint, and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk to his clients

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 47 years old and married.  She has six children. With five children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like bread, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Rowena has been in this business for 20 years now.  In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 70 years old and has four children.  Gloria is married.  She is in the aquaculture business, farming oysters in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed, like bamboo, binder and other equipment for oyster culture business.

Gloria has been farming oysters for thirty years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo, binder and other equipment for oyster culture business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elsa is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Elsa has a firewood business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fire wood to sell in her business.

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell in her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old and single. Gloria works very hard to help her family.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Gloria has been in this business for 12 years now. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and married with one child who is in school. Arlene works very hard to provide for her family.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

Arlene has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a small holder farmer based in Mosonik village in the Litein area of Kenya. The 24-year-old farmer mainly practices dairy farming and milk is his main source of income. 

In a bid to grow his business, Geoffrey is seeking a KES 20,000 loan from Kiva lenders. He plans to spend this money to buy a dairy cow. The additional dairy cow will not only give him more milk to sell but also expand his asset base once he is done servicing the loan. With that dairy cow, he can secure bigger loans in the future to further grow his business and net worth. 

Geoffrey is not the only one who will benefit from this loan investment. His family, too, will have more income to meet their growing needs.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in the frontier village of Aygehoviy of the Tavush region with her big family (she lives with her daughter and her children, daughter-in-law and grandchildren, parents-in-law). Her husband and son seasonally go to the Russian Federation for work. 

So most of the year, Alvard is nearly alone in farming since her parents-in-law are pensioners and do not manage to help her a lot.  On her farm she has cows, calves, a pig and chickens. With her farm products such as milk, cheese, meat and eggs, she also sells potatoes and greens of her land. Simultaneously with farming, Alvard also works as an accountant at a private company.  

Alvard wants to develop swine breeding.  With this loan she will buy several piglets and some animal fodder.  She also she will use some of the loan amount for organization of spring sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy several piglets, some animal fodder and for organization of spring sowing activities

loans.name: Germa

texts.en:
Germa is a 39-year-old married mother of nine children, five in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Germa has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo sticks for her business.

Germa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Germa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo sticks to use for her business

loans.name: Caroline's Group

texts.en:
Caroline is the leader of her group in Matete District representing 15 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of two children. Caroline joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, and has been a farmer for four years.

Like many other farmers, Caroline decided to work with One Acre Fund to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seed and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to save more money for the future.

Caroline's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 9.5 acres of land. Her group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights. Other farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seed and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a hard working woman. Hope is 20 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Hope has been working hard to manage her charcoal business. 

To help expand her business, Hope has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and soft drinks, and will help Hope to generate greater profits and earn more income. Hope hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Hope is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more charcoal and soft drinks

loans.name: Ombati

texts.en:
Ombati is a 35-year-old man. He is married to Kerubo, and he supports six family members. He has been a dairy farmer for the last four years and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000 from this business.
 
He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to buy a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk produced per day and meet the demands of his customers. 

He will use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and expand further in the agricultural sector. His future hope and dream is to have a stable family and be a large scale farmer in the region.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk produced per day and meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hard working woman. Julie is 19 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 3 years, Julie has been working hard to manage her bakery, which sells cakes and water. 

To help expand her business, Julie has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase flour, cooking oil and baking powder, and will help Julie to generate greater profits and provide for her family. Julie hopes that in the future she will be able to become rich. 

Julie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase flour, cooking oil and baking powder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 57 years old and married. She sells dried fish in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 31 years.

Alicia requested another loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a good, happy, sharing, loving, and faithful person and a hardworking man. He has been in the farming business for eight years! He makes a living farming and selling his produce, which includes milk, eggs and crops, at the local market. He also engages in other businesses for extra income. 

David spends most of his time pasturing his cows. Currently though, he is facing a big challenge of transporting feed from the store to the animal shed. Today, David is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. Farm supplies are increasingly becoming expensive by the day. Farmers who seek cheaper sources end up buying "fake" seeds that either do not germinate or do not produce quality plants. With your loan, David is going be able to afford seeds for planting from recommended sources to ensure his crops grow healthy and productive. 

Profits made from this harvest will be reinvested into the business for growth. When asked “How will this loan benefit your family?” David replied, “I will start a cereals business which will increase my family’s cash flow.”

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Evaline's Group

texts.en:
Evaline is a 40-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and she is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Evaline has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Evaline described her harvest as excellent last year, but she believes she can have an even better harvest this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Evaline’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 47 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Alma is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Alma requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Alma has been farming vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking woman. Victoria is 21 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, Victoria has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Victoria has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more water, soda, and juice, and will help Victoria to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Victoria hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Victoria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more water, soda, and juice

loans.name: Variet

texts.en:
Variet is a hardworking woman. Variet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past four years, Variet has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Variet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy raw food items, and will help Variet to generate greater profits and expand the business. Variet hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big hotel. 

Variet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy raw food items

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is a hard working 22-year-old woman who lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 4 years, Mastula has been working hard to manage her Pharmacy shop to sell drugs. 

To help expand her business, Mastula has requested a loan of 950,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, and will help Mastula to generate greater profits and increase  the business. Mastula hopes that in the future she will be able to own a clinic. 

Mastula is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drugs.

loans.name: Ilaha

texts.en:
Ilaha is a 22-year-old married refugee. Her husband is a laborer and they have a young daughter. They live in IDP settlement and can hardly cover family needs.

Ilaha is a farmer and grows crops to sell and earn money. Every Saturday and Sunday she drives to the local bazaar and sells her harvest. She has been working in this area for 3 years and has good experience. Her monthly income is  200 AZN and it's not enough to meet the family's needs. She bought an additional small piece of land in order to expand. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new crops.

loans.use: to buy new crops.

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah is a hard working 22-year-old woman who lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children,  2 attend school. For the past 3 years, Hanifah has worked hard to manage her clothing and shoes business. 

To help expand her business, Hanifah has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and shoes, and will help Hanifah to generate greater profits and provide for her children. Hanifah hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Hanifah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is a hard working 21-year-old woman who lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who attend school. For the past 4 years, Topista has worked hard to manage her sponge business. 

To help expand her business, Topista has requested a loan of 950,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sponges and will help Topista to generate greater profits and expand the business. Topista hopes that in the future she will be able to improve on the business. 

Topista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more sponges.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a hard working 25-year-old woman who lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who attend school. For the past 2 years, Amina has worked hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and will help Amina to generate greater profits and educate her children. Amina hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children to a higher level. 

Amina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hard working 21-year-old woman who lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 3 years, Eva has worked hard to manage her food stall and sells tomatoes, onions, and fruit. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 950,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes and will help Eva to generate greater profits and improve on the business. Eva hopes to be able to open up a movie shop. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes.

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es:
La socia Yovanna pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” .
La socia sigue  dedicándose  al negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo joyería en plata como aretes, pulseras, collares entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando parta de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de anillos, collares entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Yovanna belongs to the communal bank, “Los Diamantes” [The Diamonds].

She continues working in her business, selling arts and crafts. She is a responsible and diligent person. She continues selling silver jewelry, such as earrings, bracelets, and necklaces, among other items, and she wants to be able to continue working, so that she may continue supporting her family in this way.

She requested the loan for the purchase of rings and necklaces, among other items.

She feels grateful for the loan, and she is committed to making her established payments.

loans.use: to purchase rings and necklaces, among other items.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a hard working 22-yeaer-old woman who lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Ester has worked hard to manage her clothing shop. 

To help expand her business, Ester has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Ester to generate greater profits and provide for her children. Ester hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her child. 

Ester is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so he can supply his clients with milk and earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and thus meet her clients' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk to his clients for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a widowed woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelina is 53 years old now.

Adelina has a carenderia business in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy raw products and ingredients for her business. Adelina has been in this business for 15 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

 In the future, Adelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw products and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
