Teresita is 41 years old and married, with one child who is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for her family.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, liquor, home care products and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, liquor, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 45 years old and is married.

Cherry works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase soft drinks, sardines, biscuits, noodles, and other groceries.

Cherry has taken 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 26 years, though she also earns income from selling gasoline.

Cherry aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, sardines, biscuits, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 60 years old, married, and has three children. 

Myrna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs. Myrna has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a 39-year-old married whoman who has raised pigs for 3 years.  Perlita requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

She has previously  borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Perlita would like to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy limes, mangos, apples, grapes, melons amongst other types of  seasonal fruits to have more variety in her inventory to attract new customers.

loans.name: Yennis Roxana

texts.es:
Yennis, se encuentra acompañada y tiene dos hijos, la actividad con la que genera ingresos importantes para que su familia tenga menos necesidades es la venta de pupusas, el horario en que la desarrolla es de seis de la tarde a diez de la noche.
Desea mejorar su inventario por lo que requiere de un financiamiento, así podrá comprar tomates, repollos, aceite, harina, maíz, quesillo, etc., para elaborar la venta de pupusas, espera que sus clientes sigan prefiriendo sus productos para contar con los ingresos que piensa utilizar para cancelar su deuda y cambiar el estilo de vida familiar.
Aspira con mantener su negocio con vida y con adquirir algunos electrodomésticos para el hogar.
texts.en: Yennis is in a relationship and has two children. The business that generates important income so that the family has less need is selling pupusas. She works from 6 pm to 10 at night. She wants to improve her inventory so she needs a loan so she can buy tomatoes, cabbage, oil, flour, corn, cheese, etc to make pupusas to sell. She hopes that her clients continue to prefer her products to be able to count on the income that she plans to use to pay her debt and change the family's lifestyle. She hopes to keep her business alive and acquire some appliances for her house.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, oil, flour, corn, cheese, etc to make pupusas to sell.

loans.name: Noah's Group

texts.en:
Noah is a 62-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Noah has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Noah described his harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Noah’s Group will be able to plant a total of eight acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Charles's Group

texts.en:
Charles, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Charles is representing his group of 14 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Charles has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Charles is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 10.25 acres will be planted by Charles's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Recho's Group

texts.en:
Recho, pictured above, has 5 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. She is representing her group of 8 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Recho has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as this means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits from this coming season, Recho is planning to repair her home.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Recho's Group, and, between them, they will receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Linus's Group

texts.en:
Linus is the group leader of his 6-member group in Matete District. He is married and a proud father of one child. Linus joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for 4 years.

Like many other farmers, Linus decided to work with One Acre Fund to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to save more money for the future.

Linus's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 4.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights, as, even though Linus decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Irza

texts.en: Irza is 27 years old. He is married and has a child. His wife is pregnant. They have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Khojaly city for 22 years and now live in the Abseron region. Irza is a cobbler. This is Irza's second loan. He closed the first loan in time. Now he needs a loan amount of 1000 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this loan he wants to buy new materials (shoe heels, color of shoes, animal skins, etc.). Irza is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new materials and increase business

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is a hardworking woman. She is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Milly has been working hard to manage her shoe retail business. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 950,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes and will help Milly to generate greater profits and further increase her inventory. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a big shoe shop. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Sherah

texts.en:
Sherah is a hardworking woman. Sherah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Sherah has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Sherah has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy raw food items, and will help Sherah to generate greater profits and improve on the restaurant. Sherah hopes that in the future she will be able to return to school. 

Sherah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy raw food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk to his clients for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk and meet the demands of her clients.

loans.name: Cesar Helmer

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como vacas, gallinas, patos, pollos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en su negocio, Cesar espera incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is 53 years old, married, and lives with his family in the District of Oyotún, a rural area where the residents engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding as their primary livelihoods. This community is located in Chiclayo Province, which is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Cesar raises and sells animals such as cows, hens, ducks, chicks, and other livestock. He has more than eight years of experience in this business. Cesar has received very good personal and work-related references from people in his area. His business is located at his home.

Cesar is requesting a loan in order to buy more animals, as well as balanced feed for fattening them. This investment will result in more variety and greater productivity in his business. He hopes to increase his stock of animals so that he can cater to the various likes and needs of his customers in the area. This will increase his income and allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia is a 44-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and she is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Lydia has noticed that she has gained greater profits with each harvest.

Lydia described last year's harvest as excellent, but she believes she can have an even better harvest this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Lydia’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8 acres of land and purchase a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets for her fishing business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a 50-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, is often described as a very trustworthy person, and represents her group of 14 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Josephine has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Josephine described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Josephine’s Group will be able to plant a total of 10.5 acres of land and purchase a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Joanalyn

texts.en:
Joanalyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joanalyn is 36 years old, and six of her children are in school.

Joanalyn has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments and other supplies to use for her business.

Joanalyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, Joanalyn would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy garments and other supplies to use for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old and is married with 5 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more inventory of groceries to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for 3 years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, noodles, as well as other groceries. 

In the future Victoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thomas's Group

texts.en:
Thomas is the group leader of his group in Matete District, and he is representing 13 farmers, including himself. He is married and a proud father of three children. Thomas joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but he has been a farmer for 10 years.

Like many other farmers, Thomas decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. He hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer he will get with this loan, he can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the profits he earns from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

Thomas's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 9.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of eight solar lights, and, even though Thomas decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 52-year-old married woman.  Her financial condition is not good.  She has to think a long time about starting any task. Now her son has just begun to drive a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads, and for small distances. He has been driving it over rough roads, which caused it to break down. Now the rickshaw needs to be replaced because it rattles when being driven. This is the reason to buy a new moto rickshaw.  Shamim has requested a loan for her son so he can buy a new moto rickshaw and can drive it smoothly. Shamim thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her son in purchasing a new moto rickshaw.

loans.name: Nathao Group

texts.en: Vieng’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Vieng and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Vieng and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years.  Within these 2 years, filter users, like Vieng’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Miriam has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, and salt.

To help expand her business, Miriam has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more household items and will help Miriam to generate greater profits and improve the shop. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

Miriam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more household items.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and she is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Matete District. She is 50 years old and is married with 5 children.

Alice likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. She plans to save the profits from this coming season for the future.

In total, Alice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking woman. She is 25 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. 

For the past 3 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her shoe retail business. To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes and will help Ruth to both generate greater profits and provide for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to save money for her children. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
When you hear Hillary referring to the different breeds of dairy cows on his compound, one would mistake him for an expert in the agricultural field. Hillary, from a remote town in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer of his locality. He has a lovely family, and together they live on a small piece of land.

Traditionally, his primary source of income has been milk, crops, and personal business (motorcycle business), and he has been practicing farming for the past ten years. Having farmed for such a long time, he has gained so much experience that he is always ranked the best farmer in his village. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow.

Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya, and Hillary has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants. He has planted many trees on his farm, and dairy food will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. Through the loan, Hillary will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of his farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer.

Hillary has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. Hillary chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Hillary underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season he learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions.

Through accumulated profits, Hillary plans to permanently improve his living conditions and secure the future of his school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. Kindly help him out!

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a hardworking woman. She is 25 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Stella has been working hard to manage her shoe sales business.

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes and will help Stella to generate greater profits and expand her business. Stella hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a variety of shoes.

Stella is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hard working woman. Rose is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 2 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her saloon, which deals in hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rollers, dryers, braids, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and expand the business. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big saloon. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy rollers, dryers and braids.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to begin to build a septic tank for a toilet on the small plot of land she acquired.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 20-year-old single man who started working as a photographer on his own almost two years go to cover his needs and expenses. He is an ambitious and very talented young man who has a good reputation in his region.

Today, Hussein is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a lens for his camera. This will allow him to capture pictures in the best possible quality to satisfy his customers' needs.

Hussein hopes to open his own photography shop in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a lens for his camera to capture pictures in the best possible quality.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old married father of four children. He is a Palestinian refugee who works hard to earn his family's living and develop his business at the same time. Mahmoud is the sole breadwinner of his family, since his wife doesn't work. This makes him work harder to increase his business income to cover his family's increasing needs. 

Mahmoud works hard to develop his farm. He has been raising cows and selling their milk since 1998. His family responsibilities and financial needs limit his business development.

An acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua is the best step forward toward buying the requested milking machine, which will increase his production and business income in a well-managed way. This is Mahmoud's fourth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loans helped him a lot in his business development and family's needs, and he proved to be a good-standing borrower.

Mahmoud hopes that in the future he can expand his farm and might move to a larger place.

loans.use: to buy a special milking machine, which will increase his milk production and increase his business

loans.name: Geza Group

texts.en:
Anthony, who is in his late 20s, is single and has one son, who is still in school. Anthony has been running two businesses, charcoal sales and motorcycle transportation, for six years now. He works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Anthony's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy sacks of charcoal and service his motorcycle, and he has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayments and household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to meet his customers' demand. He dreams of owning a big store for charcoal.

Anthony will share this loan with his loan group, Geza, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mirtha Miriada

texts.es:
Mirtha es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de leyes. 
Ella es inteligente, comprometida, constante, sensible, responsable y muy trabajadora. Sus estudios lo realiza en la universidad pública de la zona de Central; caracterizada por mostrar una mixtura entre lo ancestral, colonial, republicano y moderno, es donde se fusionan costumbres milenarias de los pueblos originarios con la vida moderna y actual, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados. 
Mirtha es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que casi no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza en casa de su abuelo que es jubilado y con su madre que trabaja. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de Leyes la cual ya terminó hace varios años, pero no se tituló por falta de dinero para los trámites. Actualmente trabaja como ayudante en un estudio jurídico y se desempeña con eficacia, responsabilidad y sentido humanitario con todo el equipo multidisciplinario. Ella se ocupa de; Identificar la dimensión jurídica de los problemas para aplicar técnicas de procedimiento y estrategias para obtener y analizar la información concerniente a un problema, “estudié leyes y terminé la carrera satisfactoriamente pero por falta de recursos no pude titularme…” comenta. La ventaja de su trabajo es que es su campo de estudio, la desventaja es la falta de un título profesional que avale sus conocimientos. Su sueño es salir profesional para trabajar independientemente y ayudar a muchas personas que necesiten de sus conocimientos y desea realizar el pago de título académico para obtener su certificación e independizarse. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que terminó sus estudios y trabaja como empleada. 
Es por esos motivos que Mirtha solicita un préstamo para pagar los gastos universitarios y obtener su título profesional en leyes e independizarse para ayudar a las personas.
texts.en:
Mirtha is 37 years old and single with no children. She is studying law. She's smart, committed, reliable, sensible, responsible and hardworking. She studies in a public university in the Central area, which is characterized by a mixture of ancient, colonial, republican and modern influences. It is where ancient customs of native people meet modern, contemporary life. The climate is dry and cold with a temperature varying during the day between 4-16 degrees Celsius.

Mirtha has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long black hair she wears loose. She is short of stature and medium-build physique. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she barely speaks because she studies and lives in the city. She lives in her grandfather's house with her mother who works. They live in a home built of brick and cement with a tin roof. The house has potable water, electricity, gas and sewerage.

Mirtha studied law and already finished coursework years ago, but she is not certified for lack of money required for licensing/paperwork. She is currently working as an assistant in a law firm. She works with efficiency, accountability and a humanitarian sensibility with the whole multidisciplinary team. She is concerned with identifying the legal dimensions of problems in order to apply procedural techniques and strategies for obtaining and analyzing information concerning those problems. "I studied law and successfully completed the coursework but have not been licensed for lack of resources," she comments.

The advantage of her current work is that it is in her field of study; the disadvantage is the lack of a professional degree that would validate her knowledge. Her dream is to become a professional to be able to work independently and help the many people who need her knowledge. She wants to pay for her degree certification to become licensed and independent. This is the first loan with the institution. It has been 10 years since she finished her studies and has been working as a law clerk.

Mirtha is requesting a loan to pay for college and get her degree in law in order to become independent and help others.

loans.use: to pay for college and get her degree in law in order to become independent and help others.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 40 years old, married to Gladys, and blessed with 2 children. He has practiced farming for the last 3 years, and it earns him 12,000 KES per month.

William has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and improve their living standard.

His future hope and dream is to have well-educated children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old, married and has three children. 

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years and earns more income from selling Avon products.

Rosemarie is borrowing 23000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ingredients like meat, fish, eggs, and canned goods for her restaurant.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ingredients like meat, fish, eggs, and canned goods for her restaurant.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing 22000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elisa dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 62 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, coffee, chips, bread, noodles, etc.

Carmelita has been in this business for ten years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, coffee, chips, bread, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Josephine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Josephine has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming vegetables and buying and selling rice.

Elsie dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 44 years old and married with three children who are in school. Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, shampoo, etc.

Josefina has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice, pictured above, has been a farmer for 13 years and is now proud to represent her group of 9 farmers in Matete District. She is 34 years old, is married, and has 6 children.

Alice likes to think of herself as a very reliable person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Alice plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Alice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 3.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet is 38 years old and has six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing 13 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Violet has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Violet described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Violet’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de  artesanía variada, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La  socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chompas, chalecos, polos  entre otros.
texts.en:
Hilda is a client belonging to the DIAMONTES [Diamonds] Community Bank. She continues to earn her living in the business of selling assorted merchandise. She continues to sell her products to customers who request her work and she has dedicated time to her business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. Hilda wants to continue working in the same way to continue supporting her family. 

Hilda is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her repayments. She is requesting the loan to buy sweaters, jackets, polo shirts, and others.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, jackets, polo shirts, and other clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Junelie

texts.en:
Junelie is 34 years old and has two children. She is married, and both of her children are in school.

Junelie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Junelie has been farming rice for twelve years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Junelie would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tasencia

texts.en:
Tasencia is 43 years old, married, and has two children. One of her children is in school.

Tasencia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Tasencia has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed twelve times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Tasencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 69 years old, married, and has three children. 

Margarita is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Margarita requested a 19000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Margarita has been farming rice for ten years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira rents a store in the center of Yerevan town, where she trades with souvenirs. She has been involved in this business for 14 years already. 

Naira lives with her mother, who is elderly and retired. Being the only breadwinner in the family, it is the responsibility of Naira to sustain her mother's living and at the same time to develop retail business.

Naira has applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stocks of souvenirs and Armenian national dresses (taraz) in order to increase her sales. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of souvenirs and Armenian national dresses (taraz) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Azra Bibi

texts.en:
Azra Bibi is a 29-year old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a hawker and sells fruits in a nearby hometown. He goes daily to the fruit market to buy fresh seasonal fruits such as mangoes, bananas, peaches, apples, grapes, etc. He is very famous in the community due to the freshness of the fruits.

He has been selling fruits for many years; because of it, he understands the minds of his customers and the demands of people. Therefore, Azra Bibi requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more fruits, especially seasonal fruits.

This is the first loan for Azra Bibi; she assured that she will pay all the installments at the time due because she wants to take a huge loan in the future. Azra Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits for her husband to resell.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga Província de Inhambane tem 38 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 4 filhos menores de idade, apenas 3 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus enteados.
Trabalha como caixa a mais de 9 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solícita o empréstimo para adquirir um jogo de sofás, para dar conforta a sua família. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende contrair matrimónio, garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior e adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en: Sergio was born in Massinga, Inhambane Province. He is 38 years old, and lives with his wife and four children, three of whom are in school. He is also responsible for his stepsons. He has worked as a cashier for nine years, affording him an amount that goes toward his household expenses. He is taking out this loan to buy a sofa set in order to increase the comfort of his family. This will be his second loan with Hluvuku. In the future, he plans to get married, guarantee his children's education through high school, and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a sofa set

loans.name: Cleofe Eufemia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES.
La socia Cleofe sigue ayudando  a su esposo en la carpintería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua  fabricando ataúdes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como madera entre otros.
texts.en:
Cleofe is a member of the "Los Diamantes" communal bank. She continues to help her husband in carpentry. She is a responsible and diligent person who is still making caskets. 

Cleofe hopes to continue working in this manner to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as wood and other things.

loans.use: to buy material such as wood and other things.

loans.name: Lagunas De 2014 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAGUNAS 2014” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felipa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de busos, venta de ropa, venta de alcohol, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de busos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felipa es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que me encontró en un bloqueo y me intereso la forma de trabajo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años aprendiendo la venta de estos productos de dos vecinas suyas. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra chompas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Lagunas 2014” communal bank is starting its second lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of Centro Focal de Collpani.  The communal bank is made up of nine members and overseen by a board of directors, of which señora Felipa is the president.  The communal bank members' businesses are varied and include selling tracksuits, selling clothing, alcohol sales, running a neighborhood shop, blanket sales and selling sweaters.  

The loan they are taking out will benefit small, micro-entrepreneurs, of which señora Felipa is one.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of an adviser from the institution that found her in a jam.  Señora Felipa was interested in the way the institution worked.  She currently has a business selling sweaters.  She says that she started the business several years ago by learning from two of her neighbors how to sell sweaters.

The loan señora Felipa is taking out is for increasing her capital: to purchase wholesale sweaters, which she will acquire from the vendors in El Alto and later sell from her sales stall.  This type of work allows señora Felipa to generate income to help her family financially.  She lives with her husband and has five children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, señora Felipa says that she likes the health information and the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale sweaters.

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.en:
Nozigul is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is single.

Nozigul wants to help her parents and has been doing business by herself for almost ten years. She has a business of buying and selling textiles. She likes to do business and has permanent clients every day.

The new season is coming, and Nozigul wishes to buy textiles and enlarge her assortment. She is requesting a loan to buy textiles. She awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness.

loans.use: to buy textiles and enlarge her assortment.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is a 30-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of ten farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Alice has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Alice described her harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

With this loan, Alice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 40 years old, married to Ruth, and blessed with four children. He has been practicing motorcycle transport for the last three years and earns KES 8,000 per month.

Robert has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and improve their living standard.

His future hope and dream is to have well-educated children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jewelry to increase her business's inventory

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Hellen, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 35 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of ten farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She is married and has three children.

Hellen is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to earn enough to send her children to school, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Hellen says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has gained a lot of respect in her community, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Hellen will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw wood bars and new tools for his manufacturing.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 48 years old and married with four children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, liquor, personal care products and other groceries.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 43-year-old smallholder farmer based in Litein, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Rift Valley. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and they have been blessed with a lovely family. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for five years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. 

From Kiva lenders, David is seeking a loan worth KES 30,000 to grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford David access to a loan that will aid him in growing his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, David’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Come on, lend and support him today!

loans.use: To grow his horticulture farm

loans.name: Macralene's Group

texts.en:
Macralene, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Matete District. She is 52 years old, married and has eight children.

Macralene likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Macralene plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Macralene’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate six acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Teresa is the group leader of her group in Matete District, and she is representing 10 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of three children. Teresa joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for seven years.

Like many other farmers, Teresa decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed her family. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

Teresa's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 5.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of seven solar lights, as even though Teresa decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Easther

texts.en:
Easther is 35 years old and married to Achuti and she supports eight family members.

She has been a farmer for the last five years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 9,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which she plans to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and certified seeds for food production to meet the demands of customers in the market.

Her hopes are to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and certified seeds for food production to meet the demands of customers in the market.

loans.name: Los Trabajadores De Chipop Group

texts.es:
Sebastiana es una mujer de 24 años de edad es soltera vive junto a sus padres  en una comunidad de Sololá.
Sebastiana (es la segunda del lado derecho de blusa azul)  con el afán de generar sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres  se dedica a la crianza de toro ella eligió esta labor porque le gusta convivir con la naturaleza y principalmente con los animales, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la venta de aros, flores y frijol en la plaza de su comunidad.
Sebastiana es una joven que es muy  amable y trabajadora que ahora ha tomado la decisión de seguir mejorando sus ingresos y se ha unido a un grupo de personas  para solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de otro toro para criarlo y venderlo cuando  ya lo crea conveniente.
Ella tiene  las esperanzas de  conseguir el crédito para poder mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a 24-year-old woman who is single and lives with her parents in a neighborhood in Sololá. Sebastiana (the second from the right wearing the blue shirt) is eager to generate an income to support her parents. 

She raises bulls and she chose this type of work because she likes to coexist with nature and especially with animals. To increase her income she also sells rice, flowers and beans at her neighborhood market.

Sebastiana is a young woman who is very friendly and hard-working. She has made the decision to continue increasing her income and she has joined a group of people to ask for a loan which will be used to buy another bull to raise. Then she will sell it at the proper time.

She has hopes of getting the loan to increase her income to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy a bull to raise.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 42-year-old married mother of four, who opened her own bakery in 2011. She has fifteen years of experience. She is well known for her special baked traditional Saj bread and Manakish (traditional flatbreads), and is recommended by most of her customers.

Samira works hard to develop her business. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate her business and will allow her to transport goods easily.

She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car in order to transport goods easily

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen  pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES .
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de  venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, la socia continua vendiendo productos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia Carmen solicita el préstamo para comprar aceite, leche entre otros.
La  socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Carmen belongs to the Los Diamantes community bank.  She continues to sell daily necessities in her grocery store.  She continues selling the products that her clients request.  She is a responsible and persevering person.  She wants to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.  

Carmen request the loan to buy oil, milk, and others.  She feels thankful for the loan, and promises to comply with the established payments.

loans.use: to buy oil, milk and other products.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, a micro-entrepreneur from Pasay City. For twenty years now, she has been managing her own clothing store and her total income from the business helps her survive every day’s needs and expenses.

Having faithfully repaid her previous loan amounting to PHP 18,000, she would respectfully like to request another loan worth PHP 20,000 which she will use to purchase more clothing items like pants, polo shirts, skirts and other related products. Surely, this will help her improve her profit in no time. She wishes to sincerely let you know her thanks for your deep rooted generosity and kindness.

Someday, Imelda dreams of being successful with her current inventory. By then, she will be able to earn for her sibling's education. And if God will allow, she would love to have a chance to travel the world. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products like pants, polo shirts, shorts for kids, different dresses, shirts and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rudia's Group

texts.en:
Rudia's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Matete District and is being represented by Rudia, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 44 years old, is married and has 3 children. Rudia has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Rudia isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Rudia will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Rudia's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase embroidery raw material.

loans.name: Johnkim's Group

texts.en:
Johnkim, pictured above, has 10 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Johnkim is representing her group of 11 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Johnkim has been a farmer for more than 30 years and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Johnkim is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 7.25 acres will be planted by Johnkim's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light

loans.name: Jendina's Group

texts.en:
Jendina, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Jendina is representing her group of 12 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Jendina has been a farmer for 20 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Jendina is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of six acres will be planted by Jendina's Group, and between them they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 21 years old. She lives in Lilongwe, where she is studying part time. Charity would like to start running her own business. She requires a loan from Kiva to make this happen. This loan will help Charity to pay for her set up costs. She will be able to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone to be used to serve her customers, a chair where she can sit as she serves her customers, and a cash box where she can keep her cash for safety. This loan will also provide Charity with the float needed for her to serve her customers. Zoona has done market research in the area where Charity is going to set up and has determined that the location for this Kiosk is ideal. Charity will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in Lilongwe and a large number of families will be using her service to send and receive their monies. This opportunity to run her own business means a lot to Charity. She will have some income to cater for her basic needs. She is hopeful that she will become financially stable through this business and hopes to be able to start paying for her own school fees. Currently, her school fees are paid by a group of well-wishers who have seen Charity’s potential.

loans.use: to provide the funds needed for her to set up her own business and serve customers who need to access financial services.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Laurence. He is hardworking and energetic. His dream is to one day grow his business and provide employment to young people in Malawi. He needs a Kiva loan in order to make his dream a reality. 

Laurence operates his own Zoona money transfer business as a way to earn a living. He has been running his mobile money transfer business for three months in Blantyre, Malawi, and is very happy with the way the business is going so far. Laurence is requesting a loan so that he can pay for the kiosk that he is currently using to serve his customers. 

This loan will also help him pay for the mobile phone, chair, cash box, and branding materials and will fund the float that he uses to serve his customers. Zoona advanced him the working capital to start running his business.

Laurence is grateful for the opportunity to run his own business and become financially independent.

loans.use: to pay for his trading kiosk and mobile phone and to provide the float needed to serve his customers

loans.name: Elesiba

texts.en:
Elesiba is the second born in a family of six. She is 26 years old. Elesiba is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. This means that Elesiba will be providing a service that allows people in her community to access financial services. She will earn a commission for every transaction that she makes.

Elesiba is determined to make her business a success. She explains that once she starts earning a reasonable profit, she would like to help her mother to educate her siblings.

When Elesiba gets this loan, she will be able to pay for her set-up costs such as buying a trading kiosk from which to operate her business, an internet-enabled phone, and other equipment that she needs in order to serve her customers. The loan will also be used as float: Float is money that Elesiba will use to serve customers who come to her shop to send and receive money.

Elesiba sends a big thank you to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her set-up costs such as buying a trading kiosk, a web-enabled phone, a cashbox, and funds to serve customers

loans.name: Ulemelero

texts.en:
Ulemelero is 25 years old. He is married and has a two-year-old daughter. He is the last born in a family of five. Ulemelero is requesting a loan so that he can start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Ntchisi, a district in the Central Region of Malawi.

Ulemelero completed his high school and enrolled in college to obtain a certificate in electrical engineering. He then worked as a casual worker at a construction company in Blantyre. He has been out of employment and struggles to provide for his family. He says the main challenge that he faces right now is that he does not have an income and is dependent on his father for help. He plans to grow his business quickly by handing out flyers to people in his community as soon as he opens the business. Ulemelero is happy to start running his own business. His business will provide financial services to unbanked people in his community. He will set up his kiosk at a supermarket and people will go to him to send and receive money. Ulemelero will get a profit every time a customer does a transaction from his kiosk. With the profits, he will be able to provide basic needs for his wife and daughter.

This loan will help Ulemelero set up his business by purchasing a trading kiosk, an Internet enabled phone, a cashbox and a chair. He will also use the money as float to serve his customers.

Ulemelero’s dream is to grow his business and hopefully go back to school to get a bachelors degree in electrical engineering.

loans.use: set up his business by purchasing a trading kiosk, an Internet-enabled phone, a cashbox and a chair. He will also use the money as float to serve his customers.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen's group is comprised of hard working women. Hellen is 20 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school.

For the past 2 years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells tomatoes, onions, and fruits. To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more tomatoes and onions, and will help Hellen to generate greater profits and provide for the children. Hellen hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children.

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 33-year-old married mother of two, for whom she works hard next to her beloved husband to provide them with the necessary living needs. 

Abir has prepared fishing nets for twenty-one years. She has a wide experience in this domain, which provided her with special talents and customers' trust, and she started her own business in 2004. 

Today Abir is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary for her business development and the family's needs. This is Abir's fifth loan cycle from Al Majmoua. Her previous loans helped her a lot in buying necessary business tools to make her work easier, in addition to covering necessary family living needs. 

She proved to be a good standing borrower and a well organized  person. She hopes that in the future she can open a special fishing net sales shop, and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for her business development and the family's needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pork rinds, corn, beans, cabbage, tomatoes, cheese, etc., to improve her business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE PORORY”.
La socia es la Sr. Luz Marina, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo  diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, aceite, leche entre otros.
texts.en: Luz Marina belongs to the communal bank "Tres de Mayo de Porory." She continues to work in her grocery store. She is very thankful for the loan and promises to make all of her payments. She continues to sell various kinds of products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other things, to all of the customers that request them. In this way, she provides for her family. She requests this loan to purchase soft drinks, oil, milk, and more.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, oil, milk, and more.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 52 years old. He is married to Mary, who is also a farmer, and they are blessed with 2 children of 16 and 13 years, respectively. 

He has had a farming business for 15 years, and is currently earning a monthly income of 45,000 KES. He has borrowed 60,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya as his 6th loan, after successfully paying his previous loan. 

And he will be using the loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. He hopes the anticipated profit will help him to buy food for the family, pay school fees for his children, expand the current business and repay his loan, too.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have stable farming, secure more markets for his farm products and enjoy a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is a 46 years old, married to Daniel and she supports six family members. She has been a farmer for the last 20 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, with which she plans to buy a dairy cow to enable her to meet the demands of supplying milk to her customers.

Rodah hopes to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and expand her agricultural sector. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to meet the demands of supplying milk to her customers.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 53 years old and married with seven children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

Esmeralda has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed from NWTF eight times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and married with eight children. Five of her children are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Lourdes aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Janette dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is 25 years old. He needs a loan to start running his own business. Starting his own business is very important to Gilbert as it will help him earn profits to take care of his extended family. He has seen the opportunity to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business and is very excited about this prospect. With the Zoona mobile money transfer business, Gilbert will be able to provide financial services to people in the community by providing an easy way for them to move their monies. Gilbert’s loan will be used to provide the working capital he needs to get his Zoona business off the ground and start serving his community. He is relocating to Namitete and will set up his business there. With this loan, he will pay for his setup costs. This loan will be used to buy a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters, and some uniforms. He will also buy an Internet-enabled mobile phone, a cashbox, and chair. He will also use the funds as float to serve his customers. Once he starts earning a bit more money through his mobile money business, he will use the profits to move out of the family home and get his own place. Gilbert says this is a life changing opportunity and he will work hard to make his business a success.

loans.use: To buy a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters, and some uniforms. He will also use the funds as working capital float to serve customers

loans.name: Lumbani

texts.en:
Lumbani is a hardworking 24-year-old man. He lives in Thyolo, a town located in the Southern Region of Malawi, where he is going to set up his own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. His business will provide financial services to people who need it most.
