Lumbani is requesting his first Kiva loan to start running his own business in Thyolo, Malawi. He will set up his business outside of one of the busiest and well-known supermarkets in Thyolo. His main customers will be people who are unbanked and need to move their monies safely.

Lumbani has requested a Kiva loan so that he can pay for his set up costs. This loan will be used to serve customers by providing him with float. Float is the money that Lumbani will use in his business on a daily basis to serve customers. The loan will also be used to purchase a small trading kiosk, which he will place outside of the supermarket to serve his customers. He will also purchase a mobile phone, which he will use to make the actual transactions. Lumbani will also use the loan to purchase a chair and a cashbox.

Lumbani is excited to start running his own business. He currently does not have an income and struggles to provide for his basic needs. He thanks the Kiva lenders and promises to work hard and make his business successful. Lumbani’s biggest dream is to grow his business so that he can one day provide employment to his fellow youths.

loans.use: to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone, a cashbox and chair as well as provide the funds needed for him to start running his own business in Thyolo, Malawi.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María, de 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su madre y sus 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza.- Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable con sus compromisos y servicio a los demás.

María, tiene 7 años de realizar trabajos de corte y confección, también se dedica a la venta de perfumería y cosméticos por catálogo, de esta manera puede ganar el dinero para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de su madre.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar hilos, telas, agujas, entre otros materiales para confeccionar ropa, ya que tiene muchos encargos y necesita abastecer su dispensario de insumos, para poder cumplir sus compromisos.- De esta manera tendrá un mejor ingreso, el cual le sirva para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y sus compromisos crediticios.

Las metas de María, son tener un bazar y un negocio amplio de productos de cosmetología y apoyar a sus hijos en la educación.
texts.en:
Maria, 36-years-old, is a single mother who lives with her own mother and her 3 children. She sells beauty products to make her living. She is characterized as a very responsible person in relation to her commitments and service to others.

Maria, has been working doing alterations and dressmaking for 7 years. She also sells perfumes and cosmetics by catalog. In this way she makes the money she needs to satisfy the needs of her household. Everything she knows, she learned from her mother.

The loan money will be used to buy thread, fabric, needles, and other materials to make clothing, because she has many orders and needs to stock up on materials in order to complete all her commitments. In this way she will earn a better income, that she can use to meet her family's needs and her credit commitments.

Maria's goals are to open a little store and a shop with a large selection of beauty products, and in this way support her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, needles, and other materials to make clothing.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 56-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Litein, which is a small agricultural center near the Great Rift Valley. He owns a small piece of land together with his good-looking wife. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 10 years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business to supplement the meager income they earn through farming. From Kiva lenders, 

Philip is seeking a loan worth 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to grow his horticulture business. 

Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Philip access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Philip’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To grow his horticulture business

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 29 years old. He comes from a family of six and lives with his extended family. Lawrence has successfully completed a training with Zoona to start running his own business as a mobile money transfer agent in Kasungu, Malawi. His business will provide financial services to the large unbanked population in his community. Lawrence says his life will change once he starts running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business, as he will be able to provide for his basic needs and render financial assistance to his parents and siblings. He says his community will also benefit, as they will have access to easy and safe financial transactions that will enable them to move their monies without having to wait for days to access services.

Lawrence is requesting a loan to set up his business so that he can provide financial services to people in Kasungu. With this loan, he will be able to purchase a Zoona branded kiosk, a mobile phone, a chair and a cashbox. The loan will also ensure that Lawrence has money to serve his customers. The kiosk will be used to serve customers in Kasungu, as a large number of people still do not have bank accounts. Zoona has done market research and has determined that the location for this Kiosk is ideal. Lawrence will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in town, and a large number of families will be using his service.

Lawrence is excited for this opportunity and thanks the Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: To set up his business so that he can provide financial services to people in Kasungu, Malawi

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро 39 летняя мать одиночка. Она живет вместе с мамой, которой 73 года и двумя дочками. Дочерям 3 и 11 лет. Зухро должна ухаживать за своей матерью пенсионеркой, каждый день следить за дочками школьницами и зарабатывать, чтобы обеспечить семью. Зухро на местном рынке занимается продажей салатов, маринованных овощей, соусов и консервации домашнего приготовления. Весь свой продукт она готовит сама. Зухро хочет купить больше овощей и специи, приготовить и выпустить на продажу больше товара и надеется таким образом расширить деятельность. Поддержите Зухро!
texts.en: Zuhro is a 39-year-old single mother. She lives with her 73-year-old mother and two daughters, who are 3 and 11 years old. Zuhro has to take care of her retired mother, watch her school-aged daughters and earn a living to provide for her family. Zuhro is involved in selling salads, canned vegetables, sauces and home-made canned goods at a local market. She prepares all of her products herself. Zuhro wants to buy more vegetables and spices, prepare and sell more products, and, thus, expand her business. Please support Zuhro!

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices

loans.name: Lizeth Jhenny Mayumi

texts.es:
Lizeth es una mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de contaduría pública.
Ella es inteligente, feliz, alegre, comprometida con sus estudios, responsable y muy trabajadora. Sus estudios los realiza en un instituo de educación superior situado en la zona, caracterizada; por el comercio en todas las áreas y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Lizeth es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque sus estudios lo realiza en español y estudia inglés como segunda lengua. Su vida la realiza junto a su padrastro, su madre y hermanos, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario, agua potable y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de contaduría pública y se encuentra en tercer año, se prepara para ser una profesional emprendedora, con una visión estratégica y liderazgo, capacitada para crear, gestionar y desarrollar empresas, utilizando eficientemente recursos humanos, tecnológicos y financieros. “soy la primera de mi familia que accede a estudios superiores, me gustaría obtener mi título profesional…” comenta. La ventaja de sus estudios es que los realiza por las noches, la desventaja es que trabaja todo el día y termina la jornada agotado. Su sueño es terminar su carrera profesional y abrir una empresa familiar,  ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que estudia.
Es por esos motivos que Lizeth solicita un préstamo para la compra una computadora portátil para terminar su carrera profesional y poder abrir una empresa
texts.en:
Lizeth is a 21-year-old, single woman with no children who is studying public accounting. She is intelligent, happy, cheerful, committed to her studies, responsible, and very hard-working. 

She studies in a higher education institute located in an area characterized by a large variety of businesses, that is also home to universities, public offices, and private companies, all operating side by side. The climate is cold and dry, with average temperatures that vary during the day from 2 - 14 degrees Celsius.

Lizeth has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears tied up. She is petite and rather thin. Her first language is Aymara, but she doesn't speak it anymore because her classes are in Spanish and she is studying English as a second language. She lives with her stepfather, mother, and brothers in a brick and cement house with a corrugated iron roof. The house has access to electricity, household gas, drinking water, and sewage services. 

She is studying public accounting and is currently in her third year. She is preparing to become an entrepreneurial professional with a strategic vision and leadership skills, able to create, manage, and develop companies, making efficient use of human, technological, and financial resources. 

"I am the first person in my family with access to higher education, I would like to get my professional title..." she says. The advantage of her studies is that her classes are at night, the disadvantage is that she works all day and finishes her day exhausted.  

Her dream is to complete her studies and open a family business. She wants to buy a laptop computer to continue with her studies. This is her first loan sequence with our institution in the three years she has been studying. 

For the above reasons, Lizeth is requesting a loan to buy a laptop computer that will help her to complete her studies and open a company.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer that will help her to complete her studies and open a company.

loans.name: Bahorgul

texts.ru:
Бахоргул бизнес – леди. Она честная и пунктуальная женщина. У Бахоргул есть торговая точка, где она занимается продажей напитки, мыло, хны стиральные порошки, детских и женских одежды. Бахоргул 9 лет продвигает эту деятельность. Она живет на районе Вахш. Ей 47 лет. Бахоргул развелась с мужем, и с двумя детьми.  Сын помогает маме в работе. Дочка учится в средней школе. Она после занятий, дома занимается шитьем женской одежды, и помогает маме обеспечить семью. 
Бахоргул старается зарабатывать ради своей семьи. Она хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить доход. Бахоргул просит кредит для перевоза ассортимент товаров для продажи. Она ждет Вашу доброту. Бахоргул верит в Вас и на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Bahorgul is a business lady. She is an honest and punctual woman. Bahorgul has a retail outlet, where she sells beverages, soap, henna, detergents, and women's and children's clothing. Bahorgul has been running this business for 9 years. She lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 47 years old. Bahorgul is divorced from her husband and has two children. Her son helps his mother with the work. Her daughter attends a secondary school. She is involved in sewing women's clothing at home after school work and helps her mother to provide for the family.

Bahorgul tries to earn a living for her family. She wants to expand her business and increase her income. Bahorgul is requesting a loan to bring in a selection of goods for sale. She awaits Your kindness. Bahorgul believes in You and Your help.

loans.use: to bring in a selection of goods for sale

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 33-years-old, single man from Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small house. Ten years ago, Sami started his own business, which is an auto repair workshop. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. 

Sami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new machine he needs in his workshop. This will increase his productivity and also his income.  Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new machine he needs in his workshop.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida runs an eatery. She sells home-cooked dishes like fish soup, fried chicken, stewed vegetables, pork and meat menus and many others. She is a resident of the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is 58 years old and a married woman with three grown children. She has been running an eatery for more than 10 years, but now she is out of capital to continue to operate her existing business.

Adelaida  has requested a loan  to buy supplies for the eatery like meat, rice, vegetables, soft drinks and many others. These ingredients will be used in making a variety of home-cooked dishes. With these, her earnings will slowly improve and enable her to balance her finances. Thus, she could set aside some savings and start to expand her eatery business.

Adelaida hopes that she can properly manage her existing source of income for the improvement of the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the eatery like meat, rice, vegetables, soft drinks and many others

loans.name: Gumushai

texts.ru: Гумушай, 42 года, замужем, 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 1995 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Гумушай на сегодняшний день имеется корова, лошадь, 10 овец.  На 3,0 Га арендованной и 0,42 Га собственной земли она выращивает ячмень и клевер. Ежемесячный доход Гумушай составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Она решила развивать свой бизнес и обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и разведения. Доходы от кредита Гумушай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gumushai is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1995. Thanks to her hard work, today Gumushai's farm contains a cow, a horse and 10 sheep. She also grows barley and clover on 3.0 hectares of leased and 0.42 hectares of own land. Gumushai's monthly income amounts to about 20,000 som (KGS). She decided to develop her business and requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock for fattening up and breeding. Gumushai plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening up and breeding in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Bermet

texts.ru: Бермет успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании.  Благодаря упорному труду Бермет, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется корова, 7 лошадей, 50 овец. На 1,55 Га земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бермет обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Бермет является лидером группы "Байдоолот", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита Бермет планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Bermet successfully repaid her loan and is grateful to the Kiva Fund and all of the investors, who helped her with the financing. Thanks to Bermet's hard work, currently her farm contains a cow, 7 horses and 50 sheep. She also grows beans for sale on 1.55 hectares of land. Her monthly income amounts to about 8,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Bermet requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 2 bulls. Bermet is the leader of the Baydoolot group that, besides her, consists of two more people, with 3 of them all together. Bermet plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy two bulls in order to grow her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small plot of land and plant cereals to supply, so as to earn more.

loans.name: Santos Nelson

texts.es:
Santos es un pequeño productor que vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, en una comunidad cafetalera al norte de Nicaragua. Desde su infancia se ha dedicado a la caficultura, y desde hace más de 15 años se dedica a este rubro como principal actividad económica, el cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

En los últimos tres años, Santos ha duplicado la producción de su finca, gracias al manejo semi tecnificado que le ha venido dando con el apoyo del equipo técnico de PAC, asociación a la cual está afiliado. Su meta para este año es incrementar más la productividad de su cafetal, para ello está solicitando un crédito que le permita adquirir los insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento adecuado de su cultivo.

El sueño de Santos es tener una finca modelo en su comunidad, y que sus hijos puedan llegar a tener un mejor futuro, para lo cual se esfuerza cada día enseñándoles a trabajar, apoyándolos en su educación e inculcando en ellos, valores para una mejor convivencia en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Santos is a small producer who lives with his wife and five children in a small coffee producing community in Nicaragua.  He has been raising coffee since his infancy and has been earning a living this way for more than 15 years, under the Fair Trade certification criteria.

Santos has doubled production on his farm over the past three years, thanks to the semi-technical management from PAC, association of which he is a member.  His goal is to increase his coffee production more, so he is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies for adequate maintenance of his crops.

Santos’ dreams are to have a farm that is the model for his community and for his children to have a better future.  He works hard daily for this, teaching them to work, supporting their education, and instilling values in them so that they will be able to live better in their community.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 70 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

John has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as poor, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. John also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that John's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
José, de 31 años de edad, trabaja en su comunidad como agricultor, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad, también se dedica al cuido y crianza de ganado.- ÉL compra ganado a precio económico, lo cuida y lo engorda para luego ser puesto a la venta a un mejor precio. 

José, creció con sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y la ganadería como principal fuente de ingresos, al paso del tiempo formó su propia familia, la cual ha sabido cuidar y sacar adelante, con las ganancias que le generan las ventas de ganado, de esta manera ha podido satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. 

José,  tiene 20 años de experiencia en realizar actividades de agricultura y ganadería, todo lo aprendió de su padre, quien dedicó toda su vida a realizar estos trabajos; su pareja le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos terneros y comprar alimento concentrado para engordarlos, ya que cuenta con una vaca recién parida, que necesitan ser alimentada para mejorar la producción de leche, de esta manera tendrá un nuevo ingreso económico para su hogar. 

Los sueños de José, son apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, además desea instalar una granja de gallinas ponedoras,  crear un estanque y cultivar peces, ya que cuenta con un terreno muy adecuado para realizar esa actividad.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and works in his community as a farmer. He has a partner and two children who study in the local school. He also raises livestock, which he buys at a low price, raises and fattens-up, and then sells at a better price.  

José grew up with his parents, who farmed and raised livestock as their main source of income. With the passage of time he formed his own family, and has managed to take care of and provide for them with the money he makes selling livestock. In this way, he can satisfy his family's needs. 

José has 20 years of experience doing the work of farming and raising livestock. He learned everything from his father, who spent his entire life doing these jobs. His partner helps him with the household chores.

The money from his loan will be used to buy two calves and the feed to fatten them. He already has a cow that recently gave birth and needs to be well-fed to improve milk production. With this, he will have a new source of income for his family. 

José's dreams include providing his children with an education, as well as building a chicken house for laying hens, and a pool to raise fish, since he already has a very suitable piece of land for this activity.

loans.use: to buy two calves and the feed needed to fatten them.

loans.name: Khader

texts.en:
Khader is a 33-year-old married man from Bethlehem city. He is a father of two daughters. Four years ago, Khader opened a store selling auto tires in the city. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Khader took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to resell for his auto tire store. This will increase his sales and also his income. 

Khader appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell for his auto tire store

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia pertenece al banco comunal "LOS DIAMANTES".
La socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de venta alimentos y bebidas en su restaurante, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de  platos para sus clientes que le solicitan ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the “LOS DIAMANTES” communal bank and continues to sell food and beverages in her restaurant.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.  She makes different types of dishes for her customers and supports her family in this manner.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, cooking oil, soups, and other things.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Asimah

texts.en:
Asimah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and they all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy boxes of cream relaxers, treatments, braids and weaves. Her major business challenges includes high taxes and power shortages. Her goal and aspiration is to train more people in beauty salon services. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cream relaxers, treatments, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Generating income nowadays is indeed very difficult for individuals. But praise God, Marites was able to faithfully pay back her previous loan amounting PHP 50,000. 

This time, Marites would respectfully like to avail another loan worth PHP 50,000, which she will use to purchase more clothing items and other relative products. Surely, this will help her improve her profits at the given time. Now, she sincerely wants you to know her thanksgiving for your deep-rooted generosity and kindness.
 
In the future, Marites dreams of being successful with the current inventory and to have her own family. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Dinarkan

texts.ru: Динаркан, 52 года, есть 4 детей, замужем. Образование у нее среднее, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Динаркан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 1 дойная корова, 5 овец, 2 лошади. На 2,50 Га земли выращивает фасоль.  Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динаркан обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец. Динаркан является участником группы "Байдоолот", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Dinarkan is 52 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a secondary education, and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business 17 years ago with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Dinarkan's hard work, her farm currently contains 1 dairy cow, 5 sheep and 2 horses. She also grows beans on 2.50 hectares of land. Her monthly income amounts to about 14,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Dinarkan requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 5 sheep. Dinarkan is a member of the Baydoolot group that, besides her, consists of 2 more people, with 3 of them all together. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy five sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Uulkelsin

texts.ru: Уулкелсин успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду Уулкелсин, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 дойные корова, 20 овец, лошадь. На 1,05 Га земли выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулкелсин обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для реализации экологически чистого молока. Уулкелсин является участником группы "Байдоолот", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Uulkelsin successfully repaid her loan and is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who helped her with the financing. Thanks to Uulkelsin's hard work, her farm currently contains 2 dairy cows, 20 sheep and a horse. She also grows beans on 1.05 hectares of land. Her monthly income amounts to about 18,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Uulkelsin requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a cow in order to sell ecologically clean milk. Uulkelsin is a member of the Baydoolot group that, besides her, consists of 2 more people, with 3 of them all together. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow to increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 36-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a butcher shop but earns insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy meat from the market and sell it from his butchery shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which discouraged his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop. 

This is the reason Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a bull calf for producing beef. She wants to provide higher education to her children. She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children. 

Shaheen is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to let her husband purchase a bull calf to produce beef for reselling from his butchery shop.

loans.name: Stanly's Group

texts.en:
Stanly is representing this group (Stanly's Group) formed by 13 farmers in Matete District.  He is the group leader pictured above. He is 30 years old, married, and has three children. Stanly has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Stanly isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Stanly will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Stanly's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 9.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Nour Al Sabah

texts.en:
Nour Al Sabah is a 54-year-old married mother of five children, who has been working at selling used clothes to help her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs since 2007.

Nour Al Sabah used to work as a hairdresser, but she decided to change her career to a business she believes brings in a better income.

Nour Al Sabah is working hard to develop her business and increase her income. For this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer collections. This is her fifth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan helped her  a lot in increasing her business capital in a well-managed way.   She hopes to stay capable of increasing her business capital and responding to customers' needs as much as she can.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer collections

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hair extensions

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES.
 La socia sigue  dedicándose a  la venta de artesanía, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería  sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de chalecos, chompas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the “LOS DIAMANTES” communal bank and continues to sell arts and crafts.  She is a very responsible and hardworking person and continues to sell to her customers so she can support her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy vests, sweaters, and other things.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock of merchandise like men's, women's and children's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him, after milk sales, to add more poultry to sell to his clients who have increased  their demand for that product.

loans.name: Archielita

texts.en:
Archielita is thankful that she was granted a Php 10,000 PHP loan which she used to buy sacks of sugar to sell by the kilo at a retail price. Her earnings helped support her family and met their daily basic needs. She is also happy that she now has a food stall that sells snacks.

She would like now to apply for a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy additional sacks of sugar and buy ingredients to make "goto" (Filipino version of congee made with beef tripe and glutinous rice cooked in a ginger-flavored broth) to sell at her food stall. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She thanks God, and you in advance, for the financial help that will be given her for it will surely fund their daily sustenance and cover her children's education. 

Archielita dreams of opening more outlets for her food stall. She prays that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to buy additional stock of sugar and other ingredients to make and sell snacks.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is a 48-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader who is often described as a very friendly person, and she is representing her group of 11 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Judith has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Judith described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce their consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Judith’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Patma

texts.ru: Патма, 50 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Патмы - средне-специальное образование, она швея по специальности, но никогда не работала, однако в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию, Патма на сегодняшний день имеет 4 лошади.  Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет до 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Патма обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки скота для откорма. Это непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи и позволит накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Patma is 50 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Patma has a vocational education as a seamstress, but never worked as one, however earns an additional income for her family working in animal husbandry, having started 20 years ago, thanks to her determination and hard work. Today, Patma has four horses. Her monthly joint income is up to 14,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Patma applied to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for fattening. This will certainly lead to an increase in capital for the family, and means she will be able to save for repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy repair parts for cellphones for his repair business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, beans, coffee, sugar, rice, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as personal products and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Adelaida hopes that her business will continue to become successful and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman. She has 1 child. She operates a retail business where she sells basins, cups, bags and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, cups and other items. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of basins, cups and other items

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
This is Roselle. For years now, she has been managing her own sari-sari store and her income helps her family to survive every day’s needs and expenses. 

Having faithfully paid back her previous loan amounting to PHP 18 000, she would like again to avail a new loan worth PHP 23 000 which she will use to purchase more variety items from shampoo, biscuits, condiments, personal products, to other relative products. This will help her improve her profit in no time. She sincerely gives her thanksgiving for your deep rooted generosity and kindness. 

Roselle dreams of being successful with her current inventory and if possible have another branch also. By then she will be able to earn for her children’s education and be able to make them finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Alfayo's Group

texts.en:
Alfayo is a 43-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Alfayo has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Alfayo described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Alfayo’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Matete District. She is 57 years old, is married, and has six children.

Beatrice likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Beatrice plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Beatrice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvest of maize

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 39 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. She has 2 children and is married. As a group leader, Ruth is representing her group of 13 farmers in Matete District in Kenya and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Ruth's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

Ruth and her group will receive a total of 12 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Sakina's son fix the lathe machine for manufacturing and renewing spare parts.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 14 farmers in Matete District. She is 50 years old, is married and has 9 children.

Rosemary likes to think of herself as a very friendly person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Rosemary plans to use the profits from this coming season to repair her home.

In total, Rosemary’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Moungkhai Group

texts.en: Midta understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Midta knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Midta purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  Midta is excited that the filter could be purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional equipment for well-drilling.

loans.name: Thongkha Group

texts.en: Khern’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khern and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Khern and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years. Within this 2 years, filter users, like Khern’s family, have identified a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat is a communicative woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1963. She is living in a rural area. She is married and has four children. She has 25 years experience doing business. She had a business of selling and buying carpets. Then she traded to women's clothes. For almost 13 years she has been an active client at IMON and has a good credit history. She needs to buy a new assortment of women clothes for the next season. She requested a loan to buy goods for selling. She hopes her business will be profitable and she can spend for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of women clothes for next season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomato seeds to grow a tomato crop.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en:
Nizar is a 27-year-old divorced man who has worked as a chef in a well known restaurant in his region for three years.

Nizar is looking forward to develop his living and quitting his job in the restaurant to start his own business.

This is the reason he decided to take a drilling machine his father owns and doesn't need to start his own drilling business as a first step forward towards developing his own business in the future and expanding his working zone.

That's why he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from KIva's field partner Al Majmoua - to do the necessary maintenance on the drilling machine his father owns he can do his own business and develop it widely.

He hopes that in the future he can increasing his drilling machines, and expand his working sector and region.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to the drilling machine he is getting from his father

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Mery Raquel

texts.es:
Mery, de 44 años de edad, es una persona muy dedicada a su familia y a su negocio de venta de tortillas y tamales; creció con sus padres, quienes fueron responsables de apoyar e inculcar buenos principios, que poniéndolos  en práctica le ha ayudado a salir adelante en la vida, está casada y tiene tres hijos. 

Mery, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tamales, su familia ha dedicado toda su vida a la venta de tortillas en su comunidad; una de sus hijas le ayuda todos los días por las mañanas, ya que por las tardes se dedica a estudiar.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar maíz a un precio económico y mejorar las instalaciones de donde tiene su negocio de tortillería.- Además, otra parte será destinada para comprar productos agrícolas para su esposo, ya que se acerca la temporada agrícola y requiere de insumos.

Los sueños de Mery, son establecer su negocio de manera formal, ya que planea construir instalaciones más adecuadas para trabajar mejor y brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes; también planea vender desayunos y almuerzos a fin de incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mery is 44 years old and is a person who is devoted to her family and to her business selling tortillas and tamales; she grew up with her parents who supported her and instilled good principles into her. It is putting these into practice that has helped her get ahead in life. 

She is married with three children. Mery sells tortillas and tamales, her family has spent their whole lives selling tortilla in their community; one of her daughters helps her every morning, as she studies in the afternoon. 

The money will be used to buy corn at an economic price and improve the fixtures and fittings in the place where she has her tortilla business. Part of the loan will be used to buy agricultural products for her husband as the farming season is approaching and he needs consumables. 

Mery's dreams are to establish her business on a permanent basis as she is planning to build more suitable premises to be able to work better and offer a better service to her customers; she is also planning to sell breakfasts and lunches to boost her income.

loans.use: to buy corn at an economic price and improve the fixtures and fittings where she has her tortilla business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Richard, a 38-year-old young and energetic man who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking man on this planet earth. Richard has siblings and a family who he really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. 

Richard hails from the Litein area of Kenya. He never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white-collar job, but this did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life. Richard started farming and has been doing this for the past six years. Throughout those years, he has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. Richard practices mixed farming on his farm. Through the profits, he has managed to take care of his family's needs and give them a good education because he believes that education is the only “key to success”. 

Richard is a man who is very enterprising. He is seeking a loan of KES 35,000 to start horticulture farming on his farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Richard wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like Richard to make their farming dreams become reality through training and loan financing. 

Richard hopes that through the loan, he will improve his living conditions. Richard’s dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, he will not only be selling in the local market, but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, he will be able to assure his siblings a secure future and uninterrupted learning because he will be able to pay tuition fees on time. 

Richard is not a selfish man and will also want to positively impact society. That is why he will employ people to work for him on his horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Tom. He is a youthful 48-year-old man, and a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect him as a mentor. He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Kitale, in the northern Rift Valley region of Kenya. Toms' farming experience dates back to 2000. Like many other farmers in the region, maize is a staple crop, which he has been planting for as long as he can remember. With time, the fertility of his land has started to dwindle and whenever he plants maize the yields go down with each crop season. Tom has also been affected with weeds. 

Today, Tom is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds. Through this loan he is going to increase his crop production, and this will translate to improved income level. This loan will permanently change Toms' living standards, and there is no doubt that he can find rewarding employment in farming. Lender, kindly lend to this hero who strives to provide a better future for both his family and siblings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a fifth-time borrower of UGAFODE applying for a school fees loan of UGX 650,000. Robert is a shrewd married man with three children that he takes care of with the help of his wife. He rents a single-roomed house on the outskirts of the city. He earns a living for his family with the help of income he gets from using a motorcycle in the city. This has helped him be in a position to feed his family, pay rent, and pay school fees. 

Robert is however faced with a problem of not being in a position to pay school fees and national examination registration fees needed at once. Because he has been borrowing from UGAFODE, he opted to borrow again to have the problem solved.  
  
Robert has future hope of saving money for purchasing a piece of land. Besides that, he also has hope of educating his children to at least university level. He is hard-working and honest.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his child

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Sofia will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Sofia plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Sofia’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Nicolas's Group

texts.en:
Nicolas, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very reliable person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Nicolas is representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Nicolas has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have an overall improved quality of life. 

With the profits from this coming season, Nicolas is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Nicolas's Group, and between them they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Thabor Group

texts.en: Phone is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Phone and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Phone and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years, but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Phone and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Phone and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Polly

texts.en:
Polly is borrowing a loan of ugx1,800,000=  He is aged 35 years old. He has never taken a loan from UGAFODE MFI. He is married to one wife and has five children, and out of the five children, only three are in school. The children are aged 12, 10, 8, 6, and 4 years old, respectively. 

He is active in tea growing. He works for 10 hours a day. He started this business in 1995, and his business is located in a rural area at Orubingo B in Bushenyi District. He started this business so as to raise family income and meet basic needs. 

He says he will use the loan money to buy fertilizer. He sells his harvest to the general public. His hope is to produce many bags of tea, and the main challenge he faces is price fluctuations, and this affects his tea project most. He is hardworking.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Noy Group

texts.en: Nom’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Nom and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Nom and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years. Within this 2 years, filter users like Nom’s family, have identified a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Namarkba Group

texts.en: Somphavan’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Somphavan and his group are excited that a filter is available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Somphavan and his village also understand the impact that unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years filter users, like Somphavan’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nazish

texts.en:
Nazish is a 22-years old woman, living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her hometown is very populated area and many people like to chew betel leaf. A few years ago her husband decided to open a paan shop to offer various kinds of betel leaf to the people. He offers kinds of betel leaf such as sweet pan which is a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), various spices and tobacco pan which consist of powdered tobacco.

He is an expert at preparing paan because he has been running this shop for many years and many customers like to buy betel leaf which was prepared by him. To cope with the increasing demand; he wants to keep a greater stock of ingredients so that he can maximize his income.
Therefore, Nazish requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, and tobacco to sell.

loans.use: to purchase betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, and tobacco for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Kasea Group

texts.en: Nuantha understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Nuantha knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Nuantha purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Nuantha is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years, so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Bornaeng Group

texts.en: Phet understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Phet knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Phet purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Phet is excited that the filter could be purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nalaikhok Group

texts.en:
Chon is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Chon and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. The water filter Chon and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. 

Chon and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Chon and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nanamthong Group

texts.en:
Huad’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Huad and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  

Huad and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Huad’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: A.b.k Group

texts.en:
Norma is the featured borrower for A.b.k Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Norma is 31-year-old, married mother of three children, who wants to start her own business of selling cosmetics and makeup to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is an ambitious and sacrificing mother who hopes to benefit from this loan to increase the income of her family, and thus improving her family's living conditions. 

Norma is the first lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Amal is the lady sitting in the middle, and Wafaa is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to start her own business of selling cosmetics and makeup.

loans.name: Baraa

texts.en:
Baraa is a 21-year-old, single man from a small village near Ramallah. He lives with his family in a small house. 

Baraa has a small store in the village where he provides printing services for the local students. He also sells mobile accessories. 

Baraa took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to buy printer ink and accessories for his store. This loan helps Baraa to increase his sales. By taking this loan, Baraa will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. 

Baraa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy printer ink and accessories for his store.

loans.name: Mavjudahon

texts.en:
Mavjudahon is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is living in a rural area. She is married and has five children. She has 20 years experience doing business and is a well-known client at IMON. During her activity her children were educated and married. 

She is thankful to IMON, and likes their service and support of clients. 

Recently she has been trading women's clothes and has permanent clients every day. She is asking financial support from KIVA lenders to buy a new assortment of women's clothes. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of women's clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: products derived from pigs, beef quarters, cassava, green bananas, carrots, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Rehema Grp Group

texts.en:
Robert, a businessman, is 52 years old, married and has six children who are all in school. He has had a cereals-selling business for 10 years now, working from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. each workday. He is able to make a small profit per month.  

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his first credit request to be apportioned among the 10 members of Rehema Grp Group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Robert's business generates a small return because of the limited stock he is able to purchase. This costs him in transportation since he has to pay for cargo, and also customers. He dreams that through Kiva's support, his business will improve and raise extra income for his family. He is working hard and as father, he wishes to see his family live a better life. With the loan, Robert will invest in his business to buy more cereals to resell. His dream is to be able to purchase more bags of cereals for his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for his business to resell.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is a strong woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1957. She is living in a rural area. She is divorced and lives with parents.

Muhabbat is a hardworking, responsible, and honest person. She has been doing business since 1995 and knows how to communicate and serve customers. She buys and sells textiles and likes her activity. A basic market where she sells her textiles is village stores and markets. 

The season is coming and she needs to buy a new assortment of textiles for sale. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy textiles. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of textiles to sell

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en: Proscovia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, who all attend school. She is not looking after any other family member. She has been selling fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis for the last two years. She works seven days a week. Her challenges include seasonality, transportation, and the perishability of fruits. She has requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, onions, oranges, carrots, irish potatoes, and greens. She would like to get land and start growing fruits. Her major monthly expenses include food and medication. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, oranges, and carrots

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Abu.  He is married, and has three children aged 14, 10, and 3 years. Two are school-going children.

Abu owns a stationery business. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 7,627,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. 

Abu has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional cartons of assorted stationery items. 

In the future, Abu plans to open another outlet, build a house and provide quality education to his children.  To build a house as previously planned, he bought two town plots of land.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional cartons of assorted stationery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and get more milk to sell and thereby increase his overall income.

loans.name: Ebisiba

texts.en:
Ebisiba is 42 years old and she supports 7 family members.

She has been a farmer for the last 13 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Ebisiba has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, with which she plans to buy a dairy cow to get milk so as to meet the demands of milk and generate more income to support her family and also buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

Her future hope and dream is to improve her farming methods and be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to get milk so as to meet the demands of milk and generate more income to support her family.

loans.name: Rotich

texts.en: Rotich is 40 years old. She is married with four children. She has had a retail shop business for 12 years. Rotich will be using this loan to purchase more stock of fruit and dry millet for sale and to clear school fees for her children. She hopes this will help her to educate her children to university level. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and educate her children well.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruit and dry millet

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Lenah. She is a smallholder farmer with extremely humble beginnings. She is based in Chepterit village in the Nandihills region of Kenya. Her upbringing was difficult. She never managed to finish her primary education, but she is very determined to give the best life to her children. 

Five years ago, Lenah started farming on her husband's 0.3-acre farm. She did it mostly for subsistence until recently. She keeps a dairy cow that gives her 10 liters of milk to sell every day. She also grows vegetables that she uses to prepare food, and to also sell. 

Linah is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow and increase her milk-vending business. The cow will produce additional milk to sell. This investment will not only double the income that Lenah is making from milk, but will also mitigate risks associated with having just one productive cow and one calf. The additional income will enable her to comfortably handle food and education costs, which happen to be her highest expenses. 

Consider lending a loan to Lenah to help her improve her economic activity.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and increase her milk-vending business.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris, es casada y vive con su esposo y sus hijos, su actividad económica consiste en la elaboración y venta de panes con pollo, hamburguesas, refrescos, gaseosas, etc., de esta manera puede generar los ingresos necesarios para aportar en los gastos familiares, desempeña está labor desde hacer más de 20 años y lo hace en un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.
Necesita de la ayuda de Padecomsm y los inversionistas Kiva a través de un préstamo para poder comprar bebidas, embutidos, pan, condimentos, aceite, etc., su intención es surtir el inventario del negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes y continuar trabajando para salir adelante con su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son tener los recursos económicos para darles a sus hijos estudios universitarios y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Doris is married and lives with her husband and children.  Her business consists of making and selling bread with chicken, hamburgers, beverages, sodas etc.  This is how she is able to generate the income she needs to help with the family's expenses.  She has been in this line of work for more than twenty years.  Doris works from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.
Doris needs the help of a loan from Padecomsm and the Kiva lenders so she can purchase drinks, cold-cuts, bread, condiments, cooking oil etc.  She intends to stock up her business's inventory so she can better serve her customers and continue working so she and her family can get ahead. 
Doris aspires to have the financial resources she needs to send her children to college and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, cold-cuts, bread, condiments, cooking oil etc. so she can stock up on inventory for her business and better serve her customers.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Hello, lenders! Meet Emmy, a youthful 30-year-old mother who is very kind, loving, and charming. She is based in Kachibora, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and has four lovely children who depend on her for their basic needs. For the past decade, she has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her major sources of income are egg-selling, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Emmy is a mother who truly needs help. At 30 years old, she has the enormous responsibility of raising four children. The situation is very difficult because Emmy does not have a job. Emmy passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and at the local market, and, because of the high quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound and the demand has been overwhelming. To be able to meet the demand, Emmy is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity and hence satisfy the demand that is there. The increased income level will be used in improving her living conditions, and she plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from the poultry manure, which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make Emmy's business flourish and hence provide a secure and solid education to her children. You can help this woman improve her business, provide for her children, and be able to educate them. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is only 39 years old. He lives in Chwele village in the Bungoma area of Kenya. He practices horticultural and dairy farming for a living. 

For the last two years, he has made a living selling crops and engaging in seasonal businesses. Tobias is respectfully seeking a loan to expand his farm. In order to scale up this business, he needs more land. 

With the loan, Tobias will use part of the money to rent land and the rest to pay for farm inputs and labour. This expansion will guarantee a better harvest for the young diligent farmer. 

Income from this investment will offset other farm-related expenses. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Tobias replied, "Even though I am not in the formal employment sector, the investment will put food on the table at least daily."

loans.use: To expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 54-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 16 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Grace has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Grace described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Grace’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
NAZIAis  aged 38, a responsible mother who is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
