Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have the amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for generating money.

Therefore, NAZIA has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase scrap goods for reselling to the recycling factories.

loans.name: Koki's Group

texts.en:
Koki is a 52-year-old proud father of seven children. Often described as a very experienced farmer, he is representing his group of eight farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Koki has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Koki described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, along with fertilizer and maize seed. Now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Koki’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seed and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Hezron's Group

texts.en:
Hezron, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Hezron is representing his group of 14 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Hezron has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to earn enough to feed his family, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Hezron is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 5.75 acres will be planted by Hezron's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an ultra sound machine for her maternity center.

loans.name: Monicah's Group

texts.en:
Monicah, pictured above, has 7 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Monicah is representing her group of 12 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Monicah has been a farmer for 19 years and, in order to earn enough to feed her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Monicah is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4.25 acres will be planted by Monicah's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
These members formed a group called Discipline. They are on their sixth loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group has six members. They sell pegs, banku (cooked corn and cassava dough), and vegetables kenkey (cooked corn). 

The featured borrower is Rebecca who is 31 years old, married and has two children. This loan benefits the small group of micro-entrepreneurs where Rebecca is a member. She joined through an invitation from a cousin who is a member of the institution. Currently, Rebecca has a business selling kenkey (cooked corn). She buys corn dough and firewood to prepare kenkey and sell to customers. She says that the business started with a little capital she had and that it still will need financial support. That is why she has come to ID Ghana, so that she can grow the business. The group will need a total amount of GHS 9,200 to grow their businesses, and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy corn dough, firewood to prepare kenkey and sell to customers.

loans.name: Nalaidong Group

texts.en:
Choum understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Choum knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Choum purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Choum is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Rehana's husband has been driving an auto rickshaw in Lahore for many years but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are fully damaged. He has sold his rickshaw to a scrap dealer for a very low price. He now wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but is still short of the full amount.

Rehana's husband is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without a rickshaw. Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With this loan amount, her husband can easily buy a new rickshaw. 

Rehana and her husband thank Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for her husband's business

loans.name: Garshon

texts.en: Garshon a fourth year university student studying, sociology, political science and peace. He is a calm young man who loves peace and advocates for it among his school mates. He dreams to work in the United Nations where he hopes to be involved in peace keeping mission all over the World. He will use the  KIVA loan to pay his tuition costs.

loans.use: to pay tuition costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new kitchen tools for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in beans, chicken, cabbage, pork rinds, cheese, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Juntos Al Progreso Group

texts.es: El nuevo grupo “Juntos al Progreso” está conformado por 06 socios solidarios y responsables dispuestos a trabajar. Este es el caso de margarita de 40 años de edad es separada con 03 hijos dependientes.  Ella se dedica al negocio de alquiler de toldos. El cual le va bien gracias a su esfuerzo trata de mejorar su calidad de vida. Su mayor deseo es de implementar su pequeño negocio. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de telas para los toldos. El grupo “Juntos al Progreso” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el crédito brindado y se comprometen a trabajar bien. Margarita es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo a rayas y pantalón color negro.
texts.en:
The new group "Juntos al progreso" is formed by 6 supportive and responsible members who are ready to work. This is the case with Margarita, who is 40 years old and separated with 3 dependent children. She makes her living with her business renting awnings, which is going well thanks to her effort in improving her quality of life. Her biggest desire is to improve her small business. 

The loan she asked for will be used to purchase fabrics for the awnings. The group "Juntos al Progreso" thanks Kiva investors for the loans they offer and they promise to work hard. Margarita is the third from the right that you see in a striped top and black pants.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is a 35-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He is a father to two sons and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also works in transporting goods using a rickshaw. Akram would like to improve his business by buying his own rickshaw.

Akram took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for his business. this will help him to improve his business and increase his income.
Akram appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elena; la socia continua con su negocio de venta de chicha blanca y a la venta de ropa como medias, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de medias para damas  entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Tres De Mayo De Poroy. This bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Her name is Elena, and she is still in business selling chicha blanca (a fermented corn drink) and clothing items, such as socks. She is grateful for her loan and promises to comply with her payment terms. This member is a responsible and driven person, which is what allows her to provide for her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy women's socks and other items.

loans.use: to buy women's socks and other items.

loans.name: Rebeca Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Rebeca Yolanda pertenece al banco comunal VILCANOTA, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua dedicándose a la venta de artesania, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo portavasos, mantas y telares entre otros, a la vez la socia es profesora cesante, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telares entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia es una persona un poco timida y al momento de tomar la foto la socia se agacho.
texts.en:
Rebecca Yolanda is a member of the communal bank VILCANOTA, located in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

The member sells handicrafts. Her business is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She sells cupholders, blankets and weavings among other things. She wants to continue working in this capacity to support her family while she is unemployed as a teacher.

The member is requesting a loan to buy looms and other supplies. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the terms of the loan.

The member is a little shy and ducked when this photo was taken.

loans.use: buy looms and other supplies.

loans.name: Ada Marilu

texts.es:
Ada, está trabajando para continuar progresando y tener un mejor futuro junto a su familia, solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en telas, botones, encaje, elásticos, hilos, etc., de esta manera contara con los materiales de costura que necesita para elaborar las prendas de vestir.
El crédito anterior le ha dado muchos beneficios dentro de los cuales menciona: mejor calidad en las prendas de vestir que  elabora para sus clientes, mejores ingresos y lo más importante toda la familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Ada is working in order to keep moving forward and to have a better future alongside her family. She is requesting a new loan to invest in fabric, buttons, lace, elastic bands, thread, etc. This will allow her to have the sewing supplies she needs in order to make her clothing items.

She reaped many benefits from her previous loan: She mentions that now she can make higher quality clothing items for her customers, and that her income has improved. Most importantly, she says, the whole family has a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kinds of products to sell and increase her income, and to redecorate her mini-market to attract more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell and expand her business to help her achieve her goals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Zipporah's Group

texts.en:
Zipporah, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group, because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Zipporah will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money. Zipporah plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total Zipporah’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture and building since 6 years ago. Age 25 years; He is married. It is clear that Raul works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.
Raul is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Borbon Group

texts.es:
Eulalia tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en una humilde vivienda que edificaron en San Lorenzo. Su esposo se dedica a la captura de conchas en el manglar,  3 de sus hijos van a la escuela con normalidad, los otros 2 están pequeños y no tienen edad escolar, gozan de buena salud por el momento, ya que en temporada suelen enfermarse con el paludismo o malaria.
Desde hace aproximadamente 8 años, Eulalia se dedica a la cría de pollos, actividad que realizaba de forma rudimentaria con pocos animales. por esta razón al recibir anteriormente el primer crédito, lo invirtió en la compra de bebidas refrescantes e hidratantes, ya que tienen mucha salida en el entorno.
Es clienta de VisionFund y es el 4to crédito que recibe; con el cual fortalecerá su negocio con la compra de bebidas gaseosas, refrescos, agua mineral y natural.
a demás invertirá una parte del crédito en la compra de pollos para la cría y comercialización.
tiene deseos de ponerse una tienda de abarrotes dentro de unos 3 años con los ahorros , el apoyo de VisionFund y de todas las personas que creen en el progreso de la gente pobre del Ecuador.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 32 years old and lives with her spouse and her five children in a humble house that they built in San Lorenzo. Her husband collects shells in the mangroves. Three of her children go to school as normal, the other two are really small to go to school,  they enjoy good health at the moment, but in certain seasons they are prone to becoming ill with jungle fever or malaria. 

For the past eight years Eulalia has been raising chickens, something she has been doing in a rudimentary way and with only a few animals. When she got her first loan previously, she invested it in soft drinks and hydrating beverages since there is a lot of demand for that in the area. 

She is a client of VisionFund and this is her 4th loan. She will use it to build up her business with the purchase of sodas, soft drinks, and mineral and natural waters. Additionally, she will invest some of the money in the purchase of chickens to raise and sell. She would like to open a grocery store within three years with her savings and the support of VisonFund and all the people who believe in the progress of Ecuador's poor people.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and hydrating beverages to sell, and also to invest in raising chickens.

loans.name: Santoz

texts.en:
Santos lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (Potatoes and vegetables) since 28 years ago. Age 53 years; He is married and has two children. It is clear that Santos works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying improve the living conditions.
Santos is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Francisca Adriana

texts.en: Adriana is 43 years old and single woman. When she was a teenager, she dreamed of becoming a nurse but started working very young in order to get ahead by herself. Few years ago she became an entrepreneur woman: Adriana owns a business which is responsible of repairing electronic equipment such as air conditioners and cooling equipment in general. Adriana got an important product line to repair equipment on the country. Her dream is to own an international company. That´s why she is asking for a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy repairing machines and cover operative expenses. In her spare time she likes to help people to have a better development, following her teenage dream, so she takes care of children with language disorders. She considers herself very responsible when managing credits so she is very committed to be punctual with repayment dates on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: To buy repairing machines and to cover operative expenses.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario Fatima

texts.en: María Del Rosario is a 42 years old married woman, she has two girls. She sells fruits and vegetables in her car since six years ago. She goes from town to town selling these products. In addition to her business, she has a job as a telemarketing assistant, so she only works on Sundays. Her husband is in charge midweek. She always looks how to move forward in order to cover her daughter's college expenses. She is requesting a loan of MXN 5,000 to purchase milk, cheese, eggs and others. She always fights to overcome the challenges and not stay with folded hands. Her dream is to have a grocery store which will allow her to expand her customers base and make higher incomes. She will be very grateful if lenders support her business to turn this business into a formal establishment. María Del Rosario is very committed woman when managing credits so she will make successful payments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cheese and eggs.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en: Maria is 58 years old and lives with her family. Since 2012 she owns a business of Mexican food with an improvised food cart outside her home. She would like to grow and have a well established restaurant, which will allow her to increase customers base in order to have higher incomes and gain financial stability. In addition to her business, María is a nurse. She is also a woman who has always struggled to get ahead and support her husband, who has some health problems and can no longer work. In the future she wants to run a soup kitchen for poor people. She is requesting a loan of MXN 12,000 to buy a real food truck in order to move to different parts of the city increasing sales. Thanks to her second loan with Konfío will be better established and she is very happy to find people that support her to fulfill her dreams. Maria will be very responsible on repayment dates.

loans.use: To buy a food truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: An enthusiastic and hard-working woman, Jacqueline is 28 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. In order to provide the best living conditions for her family, she has a photography studio. In the future she plans to offer her photography services through her own website in order to be recognized in the entire state. In addition to her business, she works in her mother's cafeteria to have higher incomes and support her husband with the household expenses. She often goes to other places where they can print photographs cheaper so she would like to own the equipment needed. For that reason she is requesting a loan of MXN 12,000 to buy a new camera and a better quality printer so she can offer the best service. As an active woman, “Jacqui” as her friends call her, likes challenges and she is always  looking for new opportunities. She is not afraid about the problems she can face on the way to success. Her dream is to open a professional makeup business when having  financial stability. She is very committed to make successful repayments on her second loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy a new camera and a printer.

loans.name: Jacqueline Andrea

texts.en: Jacqueline is 53 years old and lives with her husband. For several years she taught in a preschool and was the principal at a kindergarden in her town. Currently she wants to run a travel and tour business to promote national tourism (Mexico). At the moment her specific target is high school students who are about to celebrate their graduation trip. Jacqueline is a woman who has always struggled to achieve their goals and provide the best to her family. Jacqueline would like to learn other languages in order to expand her project and become an important travel agency. She is asking for a loan of MXN 10,000 to create advertising and cover initial costs. Jacqueline will be very grateful to those who support her to grow this business. She is an optimistic and committed woman so she will make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to create advertising and cover initial costs.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Esperanza  es de la ciudad de Itá, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde por medio de su trabajo en conjunto quieren salir adelante e ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Josefina, quien tiene una despensa, comenta que poco a poco se fue abriendo camino y hoy día ya tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella los productos varios que vende. Es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que está pudiendo salir adelante y ayuda a sus seres queridos con su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con todo tipo de productos, como ser verduras, carne, pollos, bebidas, frutas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza group is from the city of Itá. Its members are in the elimination of poverty program, where they want to get ahead and overcome their situation of poverty by working together.

One of the members is Josefina, who has a grocery store. She says that the path opened up little by little, and today she has a very good customer base that always buys the various products she sells. She is a woman who is very good at what she does; this is why she is managing to get ahead and to help her loved ones with her work.

She is asking for this loan to be able to stock her business with all kinds of products such as vegetables, beef, chickens, drinks, fruits, and other items in order to be able to continue with her sales as she has been. She is grateful to the opportunity she is receiving to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beef, chickens, drinks, fruits, and other items for sale.

loans.name: Oygul

texts.ru: Ойгул 38 лет. Она замужем и мать четверых детей. У нее 2 дочери и 2 сыновей. Дети ходят в школу. Ойгул вместе семьей живет в районе Вахш. Муж дома занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Ойгул в районе занимается животноводством. Она у себя во дворе выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Ойгул 8 лет назад начала продвигать деятельность отца. Ее отец тоже занимался этой сфере деятельности. Ей вработе помогает муж. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечить ее детей и семью. Ойгул хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить деятельность. Она надеется, что с расширением деятельности увеличится доход. Она запрашивает кредит для купли несколько крупнорогатого скота.  Ойгул верит, что Вы ей поможете, и доход от животноводческой деятельности увеличиться.
texts.en: Oygul is 38 years old. She is married, and the mother of four children. She has two daughters and two sons, who attend school. Oygul lives together with her family in the city of Vakhsh. Her husband works around the farm, and Oygul works in animal husbandry in the area. Oygul raises cattle on her farm. Oygul began to carry on her father's work 8 years ago. Her father also worked in this area. Her husband helps her in her work. Working with livestock is her main occupation, as income from this business provides for her children and family. Oygul wants to increase the total number of her livestock and expand her area of work. She hopes that her income will increase with the expansion of her work. She is requesting a loan to buy several livestock. Oygul believes that you will help her, and that her income from animal husbandry will increase.

loans.use: To buy several cattle and expand her business.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is a strong woman. She was born in a rural area in 1981. She is living in a southern part of the country. She is married and has three children.  She has been doing a business for almost 15 years. She is doing business of buying and selling textiles. Most Tajik women buy textiles for traditional dresses. She has permanent clients every day and likes her activity. Her husband helps her to do the business. 

She is planning to buy new season textiles and enlarge her business. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy textiles. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy new season textiles and enlarge her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, piñuela (a local fruit) sugar etc.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José es un joven emprendedor que a base de esfuerzo y dedicación junto a su compañera de vida han logrado terminar de construir su vivienda, en la que habitan con su pequeño hijo. Él siempre ha mostrado su amor por su familia, es por ello que desde hace mucho tiempo trabaja en una imprenta, cercana a su vivienda, lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar, el junto a su compañera de vida son muy unidos y siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida. José ha decidido que desea instalar energía eléctrica, pero sobre todo desea introducir el agua potable a su hogar, ya que este es un servicio tan importante con el cual no cuentan, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tubos de pvc, grifos, codos, cables, eléctricos y caja térmica para introducir agua potable e instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que siente que el agua es un servicio muy importante sin el cual no se puede habitar.
texts.en:
Jose is an enterprising young man. His effort and dedication, as well as his girlfriend's, have allowed them to finish building their house. They now live there with their little boy. He has always loved his family, which is why he has been working for a long time at a printing shop near his home. This job allows him to provide for his family. He and his girlfriend are very close and he is always looking for ways to improve their quality of life. 

Jose has decided that he wants to install electricity in his home, but above all he wants it to have potable water, since they lack such an important basic service. That is the reason why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will invest it in PVC pipes, faucets, fittings, electrical wire, and a switchboard, so that he can get water and electricity into his home as soon as possible. He believes water is a very important service that you can't live without.

loans.use: to get basic utilities.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, after many years of working as an accountant, finally has her business, which at this moment is the only source of income for her family. She lives with her husband and son in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Aida also has a daughter, but she is married and she lives abroad now. 

 Aida is in a trading business - she sells clothes and shoes at the city’s wholesale market from a rented stall. She has run this business for seven years and, thanks to her regular customers from the city, she is able to keep it going and develop it. Aida usually brings her stall’s merchandise from Yerevan city as often as she can manage, depending on each month's income. 

Now Aida needs this loan in order to buy new spring-summer shoes and clothes collections. She has great hope that this loan will bring success and more income for her business and family.

loans.use: to buy new spring-summer shoes and clothes collections

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik lives with her husband and school-aged daughter in the city of Kapan, which is in the region of Syunik. Arevik has a vocational education with a specialty in nursing. She says that over the years, although she managed to work in different places and do various types of work, she never managed to work inher specialty. She worked at a flower stall, then at a bread factory, for some time she worked as a manager at a private company, and finally she chose the work of hairdresser. Arevik attended special courses and after passing exams she started her work. 

For four years now, she has given hairdressing and hair-cutting services in her house, in a separated room where she made some changes. She likes her work and in a short period of time she has managed to have a lot of customers who visit her small salon regularly. 

Arevik is sure this loan will be very helpful. She will buy some innovative equipment for her hairdressing work and she also wants to make the interior of her small salon more comfortable and attractive.

loans.use: to buy some innovative equipment for her hairdressing work and to make the interior of her small salon more comfortable

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 28 years old and she lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. She lives here with her husband, who works at the city’s combine, and two children. Susanna graduated from the State Pedagogical Institute in the department of Armenian Language and Literature. She is happy to mention that for five years already, she has worked in her specialty at the school. Besides teaching Armenian Language and Literature at the school, she also gives private courses at her house for the pupils, who are going to pass entrance exams. Despite her young age and short period of working in this field, she is a greatly beloved and respected pedagogue.

Susanna will be very thankful if Kiva lenders support her with a loan that she wants to use to purchase a computer and some professional literature. She says that these will be useful in her profession.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and some professional literature

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy masonry equipment.

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal BENJAMIN HERMOZA, el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Yanatile, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Juvenal tiene 36 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al cultivo de frutas, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Juvenal is a member of the Communal Bank “Benjamin Hermoza”, which is located in the District of Yanatile in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. He is 36 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Juvenal divides his time between his daily activities and his business of cultivating fruit. He has been in this line of work for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort he invests into his business. Juvenal wants to keep working so that he can continue to support his family.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and compost. Juvenal is appreciative of the loan that has been issued and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional assorted food ingredients like onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
Fidencio, vive en casa de su hijo junto a su esposa, no cuentan con ayuda de familiares en el extranjero, realiza el trabajo de albañil para generar ingresos económicos, trabaja en un horario de siete de la mañana a cinco  de la tarde, el oficio lo aprendió de su padre, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el área y tiene equipo para llevar a cabo sus trabajos.
Desea modernizar parte de su equipo por lo que requiere de un préstamo para comprar martillo, pulidora, cinta de medir, etc., realizar sus labores con más calidad y precisión, espera contar con nuevos ingresos para cubrir sus compromisos económicos.
Espera cancelar la deuda con un buen record  y posteriormente tramitar un nuevo crédito para continuar mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Fidencio lives in his son's house alongside his wife. They don't get any help from relatives living abroad. He works in construction in order to make a living. His work schedule is from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm. He learned the trade from his father. He has lots of experience in the area and has his own equipment to carry out his jobs.

He wants to update some of his equipment, which is why he needs a loan to buy a new hammer, sander, measuring tape, etc. This will help him complete his work with better quality and more precision. He expects to make more income so that he can cover his financial obligations.

He hopes to pay off his debt with a good record so that he can later apply for a new loan and continue improving his business.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Nelima's Group

texts.en:
Nelima is 42 years old and has six children. She is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Nelima has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as poor, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Nelima also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Nelima's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seed and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dainah's Group

texts.en:
Dainah is 34 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Dainah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Dainah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Dainah's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en: Rosaura is 51 years old and is divorced. She is a woman who has moved forward by herself. For four years she has had a business selling cosmetics and perfumes from catalogues. Rosaura plans to own a food business when having greater financial stability. She would like to learn about computers in order to have better job opportunities and a higher pay. She is asking for a loan of MXN 6,500 to purchase products such as makeup, lipsticks and perfumes to fill orders and stock. Rosaura is a very honest and committed woman in everything she does so she will be very punctual with repayment dates on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to purchase products  such as makeup, lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Ingrid Patricia

texts.es:
Ingrid es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Sahagún desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son arepas, los tamales, empanadas, chorizos, entre otros.

Ingrid desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como para continuar realizando sus recetas como pollos, harina, queso, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia, oportunidad que le brinda la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a humble and hard-working woman who has spent a large part of her life caring for her children. She lives in the municipality of Sahagún, where she works spectacularly well in the kitchen. Her business is preparing food to order, such as arepas (corn tortillas), tamales, empanadas, and chorizo.

Ingrid wants to increase her food sales and she wants to have more comfortable working conditions. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase supplies, such as chicken, flour, and cheese, so she can continue making her recipes. 

This loan will enable her to continue with her business and obtain the necessary income for continuing to support her family. This opportunity has been offered to her by Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as chicken, flour, and cheese, so she can continue making her recipes

loans.name: Anaam

texts.en:
Anaam is a 50-year-old married woman. She is a conservative woman and asked her son to take her place in the photo. Anaam is working hard to help her husband with the household expenses. She wants to be a productive woman, and therefore she decided to start a business, which is located in her home, selling a cosmetics and clothes.

Anaam is a caring mother of five, which means that she has a big family. The day-to-day needs of her family are high. So Anaam requested a loan to expand and develop her business and also to buy more products to sell to increase her income.

loans.use: to expand and develop her business also to buy more products to sell to increase her incomes.

loans.name: Karenth Julieth

texts.es:
Karenth  es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de mercancía, no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres, inicio su negocio con la intención de ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar y pagar sus estudios universitarios, ella realiza sus ventas en su hogar donde tiene una vitrina y desde allí hace su fuerza de venta, entre sus productos están accesorios, cosméticos, tendidos, sabanas, toallas y ropa.

En busca de mejorar sus ventas, variar su mercancía, Karenth quiere acudir a la corporación Interactuar para solicitar su primer préstamo, será su primera experiencia crediticia, ya que quiere comprar surtido de tendidos, sabanas, toallas, ropa y accesorios, pensando en ofrecer otras alternativas de venta a sus clientes y crear fidelización y recomendación.

Tú puedes ayudar a esta joven quien inicio con su negocio en el año 2011 con los ánimos de ayudar a su familia y sacar adelante sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karenth is an enterprising young woman who is 21 years of age and earns her living by selling merchandise. She has no children and lives with her parents. Karenth started her business with the intention of helping her parents with the household expenses and paying for her university studies. She conducts her business from home where she has a display cabinet and utilizes her strong sales skills. The products she offers include accessories, cosmetics, quilts, bed sheets, towels, and clothes.

In order to improve her sales and vary her merchandise, Karenth approached Interactuar in order to apply for her first loan. This will be her first credit experience. She wants to buy an inventory of quilts, bed sheets, towels, clothing, and accessories. Karenth plans to offer other purchase options to her customers so that she can gain their loyalty and referrals.

Please encourage this young woman who started her business in 2011. As a result, she will be able to help her family and move forward with her studies.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of quilts, bed sheets, towels, clothing, and accessories.

loans.name: Martha Eva

texts.en: Martha is 37 years old and mother of two children. She always looks how to move forward in order to provide the best living conditions to her children. For that reason she is selling footwear for men and women from catalogues. Prior to that, Martha had a grocery store and a boutique but she moved to another city. In addition to her business, she has a job in a clothing boutique and she would like to open her own shop again. She currently does not own a local. She is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy shoes in bulk at a better price to expand her catalogue and customers' base. She does not remain with arms crossed and that's why she is loved and admired by her costumers.  Everyday she strives to give the best to her family. Her dreams will be reflected in the effort that she puts on her actions. Martha will be very grateful if lenders support her in this loan to continue growing professionally. She will earn higher profits which will allow her to make successful repayments on her fist loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and expand her catalogue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 10 bags of cement to continue building the house

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en: Guadalupe is 56 years old and three years ago began a real estate business, providing advice on buying, selling and administrating properties.  She would like a loan of MXN 12,000 to create advertising in order to be recognized by all the customers in the region and to expand to the entire country with several branches. This is Guadalupe’s second loan with Konfío, and the last loan she asked her for help to purchase furniture for her offices, and provide training to employees. She is very thankful to Kiva and lenders who support her to continue growing. With this loan she will earn higher incomes in order to be in time with the repayment dates.

loans.use: to promote her real estate business

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда 42 летняя жительница города Турсунзаде. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Дочке 16 лет. Сыну 14 лет. Дочка работает воспитательницей в садике. Сын школьник. Муж занимается мастером ремонта дома. Махсуда на районе занимается земледелием. Она выращивает пшеницу уже 10 лет. Махсуда опытный и честный земледелец. Она сейчас закончила посев и ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений у нее нет денежных средств, и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Махсуда очень важно Ваша поддержка.
texts.en: Mahsuda is a 42 year-old resident of the city of Tursun-zoda. She is married, and the mother of two children. Her daughter is 16, and her son is 14. Her daughter works as a kindergarten teacher, and her son attends school. Her husband works as a specialist in home renovation. Mahsuda works in arable farming in the region. She has been growing wheat for 10 years. Mahsuda is an experienced and honest farmer. Now she has finished sowing, and she needs to till the ground with mineral fertilizers in order to get a good-quality bumper harvest. She does not have enough means to buy a sufficient quantity of mineral fertilizers, and for this reason she applied for a loan. Your support is very important to Mahsuda.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and till them.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman. She has three children. 

She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

Patricia will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
Musa is 51 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. He has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Musa is representing his group of 14 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Musa's desire to earn enough to feed his family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Musa and his group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en: Visionary and hardworking woman, Maria Teresa is 43 years old, divorced and lives with her son. Five years ago she opened her own dental office and previously worked in a private institution. She would like to take a Master in maxillo-facial surgery in order to provide a better service. She does everything she can to help her patients and family. She is requesting a loan of MXN 8,000 to cover operating expenses and purchase dental material in bulk at a better price. This way she can help patients who do not have sufficient resources to cover the treatment. In addition, it will increase her customers base making higher profits. As a dentist, there is nothing more important than the value of a sincere smile of a customer. This is Maria Teresa’s first loan with Konfío and with the profits she will make successful repayments.

loans.use: to cover operating expenses and purchase dental material in bulk

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.en: Hard-working and passionate in business, Ana Laura is 51 years old and married. For two years she has ran a homemade bread business at her home. Since she finished her degree she started a marketing company and currently, in addition she has an advertising business. The enthusiasm she puts in everything she does is what has made her a successful entrepreneur. She also would like to combine her passion to photography and her business to make a profit. For that reason she plans to run a photography studio in the near future. Customers' feedback is the most important thing Ana Laura can receive, because that way can improve the recipes. This business has been successful and she would like to turn into a formal setting. Ana Laura would like a loan of MXN 10,000 to purchase a bakery oven, blender and ingredients in order to prepare bread. With this loan she will be able to speed production and make higher profits, with which will allow her to make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to purchase a bakery oven, blender and ingredients.

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.en: Alma is 31 years and married. She has six children. In addition to her job in sales at a delivery company, about eight months ago she started a business selling american clothes. She would like to own a boutique and expand her catalogue and customers' base in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan of MXN 5,000 to buy more clothes in bulk at a better price.  She is a woman who knows how to organize her day so she can work, sell, take care about her children, read and relax. She wants her children to be proud of all she has done for them. Alma is a very empathetic woman and transmits confidence, which has helped her to increase customers and sales. For that reason she is very committed to be in time with the payment dates on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy american clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Karla Angelica

texts.en: Karla is 29 years old and married. In addition to her business as an administrative assistant in a gubernamental institution of her community, she is a kindergarten teacher and six months ago she started selling jewelry and clothes at home. Currently she is not having higher incomes, because she invest all earnings in new products. For that reason she is asking for a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy more products in large quantities such as rings, earrings, bracelets, skirts and dresses to resell, which will allow her to have higher incomes and open a boutique. She never stops at any problem she can face on the way to success. Karla considers herself as very responsible when managing credits and is very committed to be in time with the payment dates on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy more products such as rings, earrings and bracelets.

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es: Bladimir tiene la edad de 56 años, esta viudo y vive actual vive con una compañera sentimental. El con el crédito a comprar los insumos para la asistencia de sus siembras, el va comprar abonos, fungicidas, y todo tipo de dosis requerida. El se dedica al proyecto desde ya varios años atrás, le ido muy bien por lo cual opto por mejorar las condiciones de producción. El tiene como meta aumentar su producción y así generar mayores ingresos para su bienestar familiar. Es la primera vez que trabaja con FUDECOSUR y nunca antes había trabajado en otros Bancos.
texts.en:
Bladimir is 56 years old. He is a widower and is currently living with a new partner. He will use this loan to buy the farm supplies that he needs for his crops. He will purchase fertilizer, fungicide, and everything he needs. He has been working on this project for several years now, and things have gone very well for him, which is why he decided to improve his production conditions. 

His goal is to increase production so that he can generate more income for his family's well-being. This is his first time working with FUDECOSUR and he has never worked with other banks either.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anna Lorena

texts.en: Anna Lorena is 29 years old, divorced and lives with her daughter. In addition to her work as a receptionist in an office, two years ago she started making fashion accessories like necklaces, bracelets, earrings and others to sell. In the future she would like to run a business making crafts in order to gain financial stability. To continue growing professionally Anna Lorena would like to learn French for better job opportunities. Her dream is to own a home and leave a legacy to her daughter. She is requesting a loan of MXN 3,500 to buy materials in large quantities such as stones, chains, clamps and clasps to make accessories and sell to friends, family and acquaintances. Her dreams will be reflected in the effort that she puts forth. She is very committed to make successful payments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy materials such as stones, chains, clamps and clasps to make accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase plastic footwear

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 34 years old and unmarried. She is very enthusiastic and creative woman. In order to make a profit, she opened a beauty salon eight years ago. She wants to employ people who helps her. Georgina's dream is to be a recognized company in the region. She is asking for a loan of MXN 11,000 to buy furnitures and shampoo, hair conditioner, special hair treatments and other hair product suppliers. Georgina believes that hair is a reflection of the soul of each person. She is very happy to help people to feel good. In the future she would like to run a craft store to gain financial stability. With this loan Georgina will earn higher profits and is very committed to be in time with repayment dates on her second loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair conditioner, special hair treatments and other hair product suppliers.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is 26 years old and lives in Jerash. She is on her third year in university educational science.

Heba is an example of the ambitious woman who is working hard to achieve her goals. She believes that tomorrow will be more beautiful on all levels. 

She is seeking to complete her education and move to a good job which will let her help her family in the household expenses. Perhaps she will improve the standards of living for her family. 

To be able to complete her studies at the university, Heba applied for a loan to pay for tuition fees and to reach the goals that she has always dreamed of.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 57 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo varón de 14 años y una hija mujer de 20 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva, emprendedora, contante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Fatravi’ un área industrial dónde amplios terrenos son utilizados como; fábricas de papel, de plásticos, embotelladoras de gaseosas, depósitos de materiales de construcción etc., de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados y a una altura aproximada de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Paulina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera) su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como electricista, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Plato paceño (papa, habas, choclo y queso frito), Fricasé (sopa de cerdo con maíz molido y ají), Chairo (sopa de chuño con carne de cordero), y otros., actividad que realiza de lunes a domingo, repartiendo las actividades; por la noches deja todo listo para cocina a primeras horas de la mañana, una vez que ha preparado todos los alimentos, los acomoda en ollas y recipientes dentro de su carro de 2 ruedas con el que camina un par de kilómetros hasta llegar a su puesto de venta en la calle y al aire libre. Una vez que llega, descarga unos bancos para sentarse y abre un par de sombrillas, una para ella y otra para sus clientes. Sus clientes son transportistas, obreros, areneros, personas muy trabajadoras que trabajan por el lugar, “inicié mi negocio ayudando a mi madre, luego me independicé, alguna veces me ayuda mi hija y otras veces una señora que sabe cocinar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia por el lugar, la desventaja son las distancias que debe recorrer hasta llegar a su puesto de venta. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor como; arroz, aceite, fideo, papa, carne, verduras, huevos, etc., para poder cocinar en mayor cantidad u atender a más clientes. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paulina solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor para vender más comida a más clientes y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Paulina is 57 years old and married. She has a fourteen-year-old son and a twenty-year-old daughter. Her business is selling traditional food.

She is a good mother and an understanding, enterprising, persevering, responsible, and hardworking woman. She runs her business in Fatravi, which is an industrial area. There is a lot of space there, which is used by different factories that produce paper and plastic, a soda bottling company, warehouses storing construction material, etc. The weather is cold and dry, with temperatures ranging from 0 to 12 degrees Celsius at an altitude of approximately 4,000 meters above sea level.

Paulina has dark skin, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears braided. She is short and stout and likes to wear traditional hats, skirts, and wraps. Her first language is Aymará, which she speaks among her family, but she also speaks Spanish, which she uses in general and for her business. She shares her life with her husband, who works as an electrician. They live in their own house, which is built out of brick and cement with a sheet-metal roof. They have all the basic utilities: water, sewer, gas, and electricity. 

She works selling traditional food like plato paceño (potatoes, fava beans, corn, and fried cheese), fricasé (pork, corn, and chile stew), chairo (potato and lamb stew), and other dishes. She does this Monday through Sunday, dividing her work load: She leaves everything ready in the kitchen at night, and in the morning, once she has prepared all of the food, she places it in pots and containers in her two-wheel cart. She walks with it for a couple of kilometers until she arrives at her food stall, which is outdoors, on the street. When she arrives she unloads some benches to sit down and opens a couple of umbrellas, one for herself and one for her customers. Her customers are drivers, construction workers, sand suppliers, and other hardworking local people. "I started my business helping my mother and then started out on my own. Sometimes my daughter helps me and other times I get help from a lady who knows how to cook..." she says. The advantage of her business is that there isn't any competition in the area. The disadvantage is the distance she has to travel in order to get to her stall. Her dream is to be able to open a restaurant. 

She wants to expand her business by buying wholesale cooking supplies like rice, oil, pasta, potatoes, meat, vegetables, eggs, etc. so that she can cook larger quantities and serve more customers. She has been in business for twenty years but this is her first loan through our organization.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cooking supplies.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is 34 years old and he works as a driver. 

Miguel is married and his wife is a chef. He needs a loan to help his wife with her catering business. Miguel's wife has a restaurant and it is important that the walls get fixed. Miguel also wants to finish the construction of the restaurant because he would like to help her out full time.

Miguel is the father of 3 young children.

loans.use: to assist his wife with her cattering business

loans.name: Raul Guido

texts.es:
Raul es un hombre de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijas de 6 y 3 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de muebles.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, activo, independiente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ sitio dónde el comercio ha crecido en los últimos años, anteriormente el comercio se reducía a bares, quioscos  y farmacias; pero en este momento incluye bancos, institutos, paradas de taxis, baños públicos, tiendas, ferreterías, y otros. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Raul es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultural general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijas; la mayor estudia en la escuela y la menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina, que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no tiene agua ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de muebles; el proceso que realiza inicia con el diseño del mueble a fabricar para realizar la compra de madera, telas, tapices, barniz, pegamento, y otros materiales necesarios. “inicié mi negocio porque la familia de mi pareja maneja esta actividad, nos transmitieron sus conocimientos y contamos con una cartera de clientes propia  nueva…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una cartera de clientes nuevos que le realizan pedidos continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de trabajo para cumplir con esos pedidos. Su sueño es vender muebles a otras ciudades, él desea realizar la compra de madera para fabricar muebles de todo tipo para vender en otras ciudades. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Raul solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera para la fabricación de muebles para la venta en otras ciudades.
texts.en:
He is a good father, entrepreneurial, active, independent, responsible and hardworking.  His business is located in a zone called “cruce villa Adela” where commerce has grown in the last few years.  In the past, commerce there was limited to bars, kiosks and pharmacies, but now there are banks, institutions, taxi stops, public restrooms, shops, hardware stores and others. The weather is cold and dry with a temperature that averages during the day between 0-12 degrees Celsius. 
Raul has dark skin, brown eyes, black short hair, short height, is thin and speaks Aymara (his mother tongue) with his family.  He also speaks Spanish due to common knowledge and to the work he does.  His life partner also works in the same business and they share this with their daughters; the oldest is in school and the youngest is not yet of school age.  They live in a house they own built with adobe materials and a roof made of metal sheets.  They have power services but not water or sewage.   He makes furniture and the process begins with the design of the piece, then to buy wood, fabric, coating, glue and other materials needed.  “I started my business because my partner’s family was in this business, they transferred their knowledge to us and we now have our own clientele…” he commented.  The advantage of his business is that he has new clients that request furniture continuously and the disadvantage is the need for working capital to fill these furniture requests.  His dream is to sell furniture in other cities, he wants to buy wood to make all types of furniture.  This is the first cycle of loans with the institution in 7 years that he has been working in this business.  This is why Raul requests a loan to buy wood to make furniture to sell in other cities.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture to sell in other cities.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. María; la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de frutas, la socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, la socia continua vendiendo lo que son naranjas, manzanas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solcitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de plátanos entre otros.
texts.en:
This member, Maria, belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Asunta". The communal bank is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Maria continues making a living with her fruit sale business. The member gives thanks for the support that she is being given, and she promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner according to the established terms. Maria continues selling oranges and apples, among others, to customers who request them. In this way, she moves her family forward. The member is requesting a loan to buy bananas, among other fruit.

loans.use: to buy bananas, among other fruit.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Rancho Grande Group

texts.es:
Matea es una señora de 37 años de edad es casada, tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 2 y 12 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Matea (es  la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía)  es una mujer  que para generar  sus ingresos se dedica a la venta de frutas congeladas, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 10 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos  también se dedica a la venta de elotes asados y cosidos.
Matea ahora ha pensado en mejorar su negocio de venta de frutas, pero para poder hacerlo necesita de un capital, por tal razón organizo a un grupo de personas para juntas solicitar un crédito  que lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas y también la compra de  un congelador.
El gran anhelo de esta humilde señora es poder mejorar su negocio y con ello sus ingresos para construir una casa más grande para su familia.
texts.en:
Matea is a 37-year-old woman who is married.  She has a lovely family of 5 children ranging from ages 2 to 12.  This family lives in a community of Sololá.

Matea (first on the left in the photograph) is a woman who, to generate income, makes a living selling frozen fruit.  She has done this work for 10 years but in order to improve her income she also works selling roasted corn and doing sewing.  

Matea has been thinking now of improving her business of selling fruit but in order to be able to do it she needs capital.  For that reason she organized a group of people to request a loan together that she will invest in the purchase of more fruit and also in the purchase of a freezer. 

This humble woman’s great desire is to be able to improve her business and with that, her income, in order to build a larger house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit and a freezer.

loans.name: Amitié 1 Group

texts.fr: Safiatou, responsable du groupe remercie kiva pour le prêt que son groupe vient de solder. Ce prêt lui a été utile car elle a pu renforcer son commerce et maintenant, elle a la possibilité d'acheter sur place les arachides pour faire la pâte. Avec le bénéfice que ses ventes ont engendré, elle a pu augmenter le volume de son commerce. Safiatou a besoin d'un nouveau prêt pour acheter 10 sacs d'arachide de 100 kg chacun pour faire la pâte pour vendre.Elle utilisera une partie de son argent pour acheter les autres choses nécessaires pour sa transformation. Après ses ventes, cette brave dame aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire ses propres dépenses et d'aider son époux dans la gestion de leur famille.
texts.en:
Safiatou, the official of the group, thanks Kiva for the loan that her group just repaid. This loan was useful for her, since she was able to bolster her business. And now, she may purchase peanuts locally to make peanut butter. With the profits from her sales, she was able increase her sales volume. 

Safiatou has need of a new loan to purchase ten 100-kg sacks of peanuts to make peanut butter to sell. She will use part of her money to buy other things necessary for her process. After her sales, this good and honest woman will have a profit enabling her to cover her own expenses and to help out her husband in managing their family.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts for making peanut butter to sell

loans.name: Ana Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
Ana, vive con sus dos hijos, se dedica a cuidar de su linda familia y también atiende su negocio sola, ella es propietaria de una tienda de productos de  primera necesidad, como granos básicos, verduras, bebidas, etc., y también práctica la crianza de cerdos, su negocio inicio con crianza de pollos y cerdos, con las ganancias instaló una pequeña tienda de productos varios que con el paso del tiempo ha ido surtiendo con  nueva mercadería, no tiene un horario definido, la foto fue tomada en la tienda).
Con el capital comprara golosinas, bebidas, azúcar, condimentos, verduras, aceite, huevos,verduras etc., para surtir la tienda y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, pretende mejorar su negocio para estabilizar su situación financiera, cancelar la deuda adquirida, reactivar la granja de pollos y la crianza de cerdos.
Las aspiraciones que tiene Ana son lograr que su negocio sea más rentable y ofrecerles a sus hijos apoyo para que puedan superarse en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her two children. She dedicates herself to taking care of her beautiful family and also to running her business by herself. Ana is the owner of a store that sells basic necessities such as grains, vegetables, beverages. She also raises pigs. Her business started with raising chickens and pigs, and with her earnings she opened a small store, which sells a variety of products. With time, she has been stocking up with new merchandise. She has no fixed hours of operation.

With the capital provided by the loan, Ana will purchase sweets, beverages, sugar, condiments, cooking oil, eggs, vegetables etc. to stock up her store and satisfy her customers' needs. Ana plans to improve her business so she can have a more stable financial situation, pay off her acquired debt, restart her chicken farm and raise pigs once again.

Ana's aspires to make her business more profitable and to support her children so they can get ahead in society. The picture was taken in her store.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, beverages, sugar, condiments, cooking oil, eggs etc. to stock up her store and meet her customers' needs

loans.name: America Belem

texts.en: America is 48 years old and lives with her husband and their two beautiful children. Eight years ago her son had some health problems and had to be medically intervened so besides  her job as an architect, she decided to become an entrepreneur woman to combine her design skills in home decor to make a profit. They had to leave their business by an economic crisis they went through. America wants to be an example for her children. For that reason, she wants to run again the business in order to make higher incomes and provide the best living conditions for her children. America is requesting a loan of MXN 8,500 to fill orders and turn her business into a formal setting. With this loan she will be able to expand her inventory in order to increase sales and earnings which will allow her to make successful payments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to fill orders and turn her business into a formal setting

loans.name: Renata Irene

texts.en: Renata is 37 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. From a young age she started a business of auto parts. Customers are mainly men and they are always surprised when they see her as responsible. Renata would like to learn haute couture and she would like to run a business which create and design tailor-made clothing. Her dream is to be financially stable and expand her business with several branches to the entire state to have some extra incomes in order to offer the best education to her children. For that reason she would like a loan of MXN 10,000 to buy specific auto parts to fill orders and to keep in stock, which will allow her to increase the sales. She is very committed to be on time with the payment dates on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy auto parts in order to stock

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is a 39 years old single woman. She is an entrepreneurial woman who several years ago started working at an office as an archivist but over the time she became an assistant. Due to a crisis the company closed down so she started her own business protecting trademarks and copyrights. That's why she is requesting a loan of MXN $ 10,000 to buy equipment needed to turn into a formal establishment. Her dream is to be a recognized company throughout the country in order to have financial stability so she can fulfill another goal such as run a business of typical Mexican dishes or a spa. She is a hardworking woman who never gives up and is always looking for new clients. With this loan she will be able to increase earnings which will make successful repayments with on her first loan with Konfío. Georgina will be very grateful if lenders support her business to keep growing.

loans.use: to turn her business into a formal establishment.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.en: An enthusiastic and hard-worker woman, Maria Sofia is 50 years old, divorced and supports her three sons. In addition to her job as an accountant, from about 15 years ago she started a business selling shoes and cosmetics from catalogues. Maria Sofia would like to open a boutique in which could provide more and better products. Due to her other job can not put in much time to her business but plans to take a sales course online to be more successful. Her dream is to have financial stability in order to have peace with her family. She is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to purchase products such as makeup, lipsticks and shoes. This way she can has more incomes to meet her obligations in her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to purchase products such as makeup, lipsticks and shoes.

loans.name: Martha Imelda

texts.en: Martha Imelda is a 60 years old and divorced woman. For more than 20 years she has been running a business which promotes regional handcrafts and natural products such as coffee, flavored pastas, vinegars and other kind of products. She plans to run another business of typical mexican clothes made out of linen. Currently she wants to move to another branch of the business in order to get certification by different regulatory institutions. Martha Imelda is in charge of the Craft Center in her region and her mission is to promote the artisans so they can be recognized throughout the country. Martha Imelda likes to read about technological advances so she can make innovative ideas for her business. This year she is competing for National Innovation Award, which has been her dream since she started her business. She would like a loan of MXN 6,000 to purchase ingredients in order to make natural and organic products. With this loan she will increase her profits which will allow her to be in time with the repayments of her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients in order to make natural and organic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to earn more income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martín tiene la edad de 48 años, esta en unión libre, y tiene 9 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su Chile y su frijol. El va comprar el abonos, fungicidas, herbicidas y todo tipo de insumos necesarios para el buen desempeño del cultivo. El se dedica hace ya varios años a este tipo de proyecto por lo cual a decidido invertir en mas producción. El tiene como meta aumentar su producción, para así vender su cosecha y obtener mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su Familia. Es el primer crédito que recibe de FUDECOSUR, nunca antes había trabajado en otros bancos.
texts.en:
Martín, 48, is in a common-law relationship.  He has nine children, who are his biggest priority.

With the loan he's going to buy some agricultural inputs to take care of his chili peppers and beans.  He's going to buy soil amendments, fungicide, herbicide, and everything he needs to produce a good crop.

Martín has earned a living doing this type of work for several years now, so he decided to invest in more production.  His goal is to increase his production so he can sell his harvest and earn more income for his family's well-being.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR; he had never worked with other banks before.

loans.use: to take care of his chili pepper and bean crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maternity clothing such as skirts, blouses, and underwear

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás se siente agradecido con la microfinanciera MiCrédito por haberle facilitado un financiamiento, con el cual pudo reparar unas cercas que tenía dañadas en su finca. Él tiene más de 37 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz, frijoles, trigo y a la producción de leche.
En esta ocasión solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar un quintal de semillas de frijoles y demás insumos agrícolas, además de la compra de alambre y grapas. Esto le será de gran ayuda porque podrá cultivar y reparar un cerco que tiene dañado. Entre los planes de Nicolás esta aumentar su ganado y mejorar un pozo que le sirve de principal afluente.
texts.en: Nicolas is grateful to Micredito for helping him with a loan, with it he was able to make repairs to damaged fences in his property.
