He has more than 37 years of experience in farming growing corn, beans, wheat and producing milk.  He is now requesting a new loan to buy bean seeds and other agri-products, he will also buy wire and ties.  This will be very helpful because he will be able to seed and fix another damaged fence.  In his plans is to have more cattle and improve a well that is his main water source.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and other agri-products, he will also buy wire and ties.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia works hard to support her family. Amalia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Amalia requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Los Agricultores  De Pajomel Group

texts.es:
Andres (es el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de camisa blanca) es un hombre de 51 años de edad, un agricultor perseverante y trabajador que trabaja día con día para ganarse el pan de cada día, el está muy agradecido por el crédito al que tuvo acceso pues gracias a ello logro cultivar sus parcelas de café y logro muy buena cosecha, el ahora junto a su grupo están solicitando un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá para la compra abono químico para poder darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café.
Ellos tienen las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas así también obtener buenas ganancias para construir sus casas.
texts.en: Andres (first one from the left wearing a white shirt in the picture) is a 51-year-old man, a persevering and hardworking farmer that works day to day to earn a living.  He is very grateful for the loan that he had access to because thanks to it he was able to seed his coffee plantation and had a good harvest.  With his group they are now requesting a new loan to invest in buying fertilizer to maintain their plantation.  The have hopes to get the loan to improve the quality of their harvest as well as better profit, to build their homes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain their coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, soup sets, dinner sets, platters, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase green bananas

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a single man. He describes himself to be a risk-taker. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power outages. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy barber shop equipment to enable him open another barber shop. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be prosperous. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy barber shop equipment

loans.name: Michel Silvana

texts.es:
Michel es propietaria de una pulpería y se siente agradecida con la microfinanciera MiCrédito por haberle facilitado un crédito con el que ha podido invertir en su negocio y en consiguiente ha logrado incrementar sus ventas y los artículos que ofrece. Ella inicio su pulpería con ayuda de su papá y ahora cuenta con capital propio. 
Sin embargo, solicita un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, productos de higiene personal, sodas, golosinas, pan, cebollas, etc. Este préstamo le ayudará porque podrá reabastecer su pulpería, y así logrará incrementar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Michel is the owner of a small store. She feels grateful to MiCrédito micro-finance for having awarded her a loan which she was able to invest in her business and consequently managed to increase her sales and the items she offers. She started her store with the help of her father and now she has her own capital.

Nonetheless she is requested a new loan to invest in buying basic grains, personal hygiene products, sodas, sweets, bread, onions, etc. This loan will help her as she will be able to restock her store and thus mange to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, personal hygiene products, sodas, sweets, bread, onions, etc.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 49-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of five children and her husband is a plumber by profession. Her husband is only responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Sajida has also been doing her business of clothes selling for past five years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Sajida needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her clothes business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene la edad de 44 años, esta casado, tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad y actualmente vive con ellos. El con el crédito va comprar herramientas para la jardinería, como palas, tijeras y chapiadoras. El se dedica a esto en sus tarde y días libre pues se desempeña como guarde. El tiene ya varios años de realizar este trabajo como jardinero y le ha ido muy bien , por lo cual opto por mejorar sus maquinas o cambiarlas. La meta que se propone es tener mas ingresos adicionales para el bienestar de su familia y así poder lograr una mejor estabilidad para el futuro. el ya ha tenidos créditos con FUDECOSUR, y nunca antes había tenido créditos en otros Bancos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 44 years old. He is married, and he has 2 children. His children are his top priority, and he currently lives with them. With this loan, he will buy gardening tools such as shovels, scissors, and lawn mowers.

Since he makes a living as a guard, he performs gardening work in the afternoons and during his days off. He has been working as a gardener for several years, and he has done very well. For this reason, he has decided to upgrade or change his machines. His goal is to earn additional income in order to improve the well-being of his family and, that way, achieve greater stability for the future. He has previously obtained loans from FUDECOSUR; he has never received loans from other institutions.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools.

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.en:
Donia is the featured borrower for Luna Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Donia is a 31-year-old married mother of one child who sells cosmetics and makeup from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new collection of cosmetics and makeup to satisfy her customers' needs. Donia is the first lady on the left of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Maya is the lady standing in the middle, and Diala is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and makeup

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is a 55-year-old married woman.  Five years ago she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Currently, Khursheed has availed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR). She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan. She is shown in the photo with her nephew.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business.

loans.name: Zain

texts.en:
Zain, a single woman, lives with her family in Irbid. She is 23 years old and in her third year at the university, majoring in sociology.
.
Zain believes that nothing in this world is better than education. She thinks that the person with no bachelor degree is worth nothing. 

She wants to work on her certificate to help her family with the household expenses and to live comfortably with them.

Zain's father cannot cover the semester fees for her as well as all the household expenses, so Zain asked for an education loan to pay her semester fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to cover her university fees and graduate as soon as possible.

loans.name: Maravillosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARAVILLOSAS” iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yolanda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de material de construcción, venta de polleras, tienda de ferretería, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de zapatos.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yolanda es integrante, ella indica que es hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de ferretería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su al observar el mercado, donde identificó que pocas vendían estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de picotas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
“La Maravillosas” Communal Bank is in its eighteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional center.  The group is comprised of eight members and managed by a board of directors where Yolanda is president.  The members of the communal bank are engaged in various businesses including the sale of construction materials, chickens, baby clothing, and shoes and one member owns a hardware store.

The loan they are taking out will benefit a small group of micro-entrepreneurs where Yolanda is a member.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago at the invitation of a friend who is one of the institution’s clients.  Currently, she has a hardware store business, and says that she learned it after observing the market where she noted that few were selling these products.  

She will use the loan she is taking out now to increase capital through the purchase of wholesale shovels.  She will buy them from wholesalers in La Paz, and will sell them later at her store.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family as she lives in a common-law relationship and has four children.  

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked the health plan the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale  shovels.

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en: Hudson is a single man. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Laarni works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Laarni is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Laarni has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Salustiano

texts.es:
Salustiano es un hombre trabajador, es productor agropecuario; él se dedica al  cultivo de maíz, trigo y crianza de ganado  ordeño desde hace 45 años. Don Salustiano agradece a Kiva y MiCrédito ya que gracias al a los créditos obtenidos ha logrado beneficios obteniendo mejores ganancias ya que compro dos terneros los cuales  repasto y los vendió a mejor precio. 
Ahora Salustiano solicita el crédito ya que desea comprar “gallinaza” un alimento para las vacas, las cuales, son las que le dan la leche para así lograr mejores ganancia y evitar las ventas de terneras. Sus planes son  obtener un nuevo crédito para comprar  dos terneras más.
texts.en:
Salustiano is a hardworking man who is an agricultural and livestock producer.  He has made a living cultivating corn, wheat and raising milking cows for 45 years.  Salustiano is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito since thanks to previous loans received he has obtained benefits gaining better earnings since he purchased two calves which he pastured and sold at a better price.

Now Salustiano is requesting a loan as he wants to purchase “gallinaza,” a type of feed for cows, the kind for milking, to obtain greater earnings and avoid selling the calves.  His plans are to then obtain a new loan to purchase two more calves.

loans.use: to buy “gallinaza,” a feed for cows.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 39-year-old married woman with six children. She is shown in the photo with her husband who has been running a chicken-selling shop for about eight years. By this time he has become famous for providing good quality chicken in his community. For the improvement of her husband’s business, Khalida has availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more hens along with the stock of feed for them. Her husband expects a boost in his earnings and wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more hens along with the stock of feed for them.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: At the age of 27, Razia is actively supporting her family through her livestock business along with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She works on a daily basis and earns a good amount of income. She has years of experience in this field. After raising small animals for a year or two she sells them in her locality. For the improvement of her business she has availed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. It allowed her to purchase more baby goats to inflate her sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats to inflate her sales and profits alongside.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen works hard to support her family. Ellen is married and has a business selling personal care products in the Philippines.

Ellen requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more personal collection products like detergent soap, deodorant, body spray, body soap, etc. to sell. Ellen has been in this business for 5 years now.

Ellen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products like detergent soap, deodorant, body spray, body soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for surgery.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia, age 45, is a married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She deals in the business of livestock with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo to increase her earnings to better support the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her earnings to better support the needs of the family.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De El Alto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE EL ALTO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sabina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de velas, venta de colchones, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sabina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de colchones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al apoyar a su hermana, quien tiene el mismo negocio, con el pasar del tiempo y con unos ahorros decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en el departamento de Potosí. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE EL ALTO” will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Office in Achacachi. This group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Sabina is the president. The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: candle sales, mattress sales; food sales; clothing sales, and cosmetics sales. 

The loan that they are applying for will benefit micro-entrepreneurs and Sabina will be one of the beneficiaries. She states that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a massive membership campaign that the organization ran in her area. 

She currently has a business selling mattresses. She learned this business while helping her sister who has the same type of business, and over time she was able to save some money and decided to start her own business. The loan is to increase her capital so she can buy fabric at wholesale from vendors in La Paz, and after making the mattresses she will sell them in Potosi. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, as she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the training the organization provides.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale.

loans.name: Ugiloy

texts.ru: Угилой 35 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Детям 17, 14 и 12 лет. Угилой вместе семьей живет в городе Турсунзаде. Она активная и целеустремленная женщина с большими планами на жизнь. 5 лет назад Угилой решила начала торговую деятельность. Угилой начала заниматься продажей детских одежды и по сей день, она продвигает данную деятельность. В работе ей нравится общаться с новыми людьми и помогать делать им правильный выбор в покупке одежды. Угилой решила расширить свою деятельность, и хочет привезти новый товар на продажу. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она просит кредит. Угилой надеется на Вашу поддержке. Не откажитесь ей на поддержку. Поддержите Угилой.
texts.en: Ugiloy is 35, married and mother to three children, ages 12, 14 and 17. Ugiloy and her family live in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is an active and determined woman with big plans for her life. Five years ago she decided to start a retail business. She started to sell children’s clothing and is still doing so to this day. She likes meeting new people at work and helping them make the right decisions when buying clothes. Ugiloy decided to expand her business and wants to bring in new inventory to sell. Because she does not have enough money, she requested a loan. Ugiloy hopes for your support.

loans.use: to bring in new inventory to sell and expand her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, at 43 years of age, due to the lack of opportunities for employment and economic need, is motivated to become independent and earn an income on his own. For this reason, he started farming. John is a passionate smallholder farmer based in Rogoma village in the Kisii area of Kenya. For the last 18 years he has been practicing mixed farming to support his family and siblings. John makes money selling milk and a variety of food crops, such as maize, from his farm. 

John is seeking a loan because he wants to get into the poultry business. This is a diversification from dairy and crop farming. He enjoys dairy farming as much as he does crop farming. However, the region usually experiences long dry spells, which inevitably affects crop harvests negatively. For this reason, John is seeking a loan to buy poultry. Poultry will serve both subsistence and commercial purposes. There is a high demand for poultry products in the developing town of Kisii, which is the nearest town to John's village. Proceeds from the sale of eggs will help John cope with the rising farm expenses that is putting many farmers in the region out of business. His long-term plan is to free his family from the chains of poverty. For John, this support will be very important, since it will be the first loan that he has gotten in his 43 years. The years are heavy, but he will continue working hard to give his family and siblings a good inheritance.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another chicken breeding machine

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en: Karisa is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be God-fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a highly populated area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the dry season. He will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy another dairy cow. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre trabajador y perseverante. Él confiesa que todos los esfuerzos valen la pena cuando se trata de su familia. Por ello, trabaja día a día como pescador artesanal, y se siente agradecido con MiCrédito por haberle facilitado un  financiamiento que utilizó para invertirlo en su trabajo. 
Sin embargo, solicita un nuevo crédito para darle mantenimiento a sus herramientas de trabajo y también para comprar redes nuevas. El desea continuar trabajando para aumentar su economía y ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carlos has always been known as a hardworking and persevering man. He acknowledges that all his efforts are worth it when it comes to his family. Therefore, he works everyday as an artisanal fisherman and feels grateful to MiCrédito for facilitating financing he used for investing in his work.

Now, he is requesting a new loan to do maintenance on his work equipment and also to buy new nets. He wants to continue working to improve his finances and offer a better future for his children.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his work equipment and also to buy new nets.

loans.name: Mesadilla Group

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 53 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijas mujeres de 33 y 11 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, comprensiva, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Panamericana’ área central donde lado a lado conviven empresas públicas y privadas, como; restaurantes, galerías comerciales, cines, heladerías, edificios de departamentos familiares, universidades y todo tipo de comercio, de clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-26 grados centígrados.
 Martha es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada la primera de la derecha, viste blusa negra con puntos blancos y pantalón negro). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como chofer asalariado y con sus hijas; la mayor es independiente y la menor estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe y ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica. La necesidad por mejorar su calidad de vida la llevó a buscar microempresarios con la misma necesidad y formar una banca de personas con negocios como;
Panadería, venta de jugos naturales, venta de pollo, venta de bisutería, servicio de transporte público, venta de carne de cerdo y venta de pañales, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional y esta se cocina según el día, como; Lunes: Ají de flores de chilijchi (Flores de ceibo con cebolla, tomate, locoto, y papas), Martes: Conejo (Cuy frito, con chorrillana,  chuño y papa ), Miércoles: Chajchu (carne de res, cebolla, habas, chuño, huevo duro, salsa de cebolla, tomate, locoto y ají), Jueves: Chanka de conejo (Cuy tierno cocido con hierbabuena, cebolla, haba, papa y locoto, Viernes: Chicharrón de cerdo (cerdo frito con maíz blanco y locoto), Sábado: Fidius uchú (Ají de tallarines), Domingo: Phampaku (carnes de; pato, lechón, cordero, condimentadas), “la cocina demora bastante tiempo, cada comida sólo se puede cocinar un día a la semana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los clientes conocen el menú según en día, la desventaja es que existe competencia con el mismo menú. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante con varias comidas según el día y la hora, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un horno industrial para elaborar pizzas y venderlas por la noche. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial para hornear pizzas y venderlas por la noche para abrir un restaurante todo el día.
texts.en:
Martha is a married 53 year old lady, who has two daughters, ages 33 and 11. She makes a living selling traditional food. She is a good mother, independent, constant, understanding, generous, responsible and hardworking. She conducts her food sales in the “Panamericana” zone, a central area where public and private enterprises coexist side by side, such as restaurants, commercial galleries, movie theaters, ice cream parlors, family unit apartment buildings, universities, and all sorts of commerce types. Of mild weather and with a temperature that varies from 18º to 26º centigrade throughout the day. Martha is of dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair, usually tied back; short in stature and of robust physique. Her mother tongue is Quechua, which she speaks around family; she speaks Spanish for general culture and for the business she manages (she is the first on the right, sitting and wearing a black blouse with white polka dots and black trousers). She shares her life with her husband, who works as a salaried driver, and their daughters; the oldest is independent and the youngest attends school. They own the home they live in, which is made of adobe and brick with a tin roof; it has electricity, water from a well extracted through an electric pump.

The need to improve their quality of life, led her to search for other micro-entrepreneurs with the same need, to form a partnership of people with businesses selling: baked goods, fresh juice, chickens, costume jewelry, public transport services, pork meat and baby diapers, to request a loan to improve their shops. Hers is a food stall serving traditional food, which she cooks according to the day of the week: Monday: Chilijchi flower sauce (flowers of the ceibo tree with onion, tomato, green pepper and potatoes). Tuesday: Rabbit (fried guinea pig on top of French fries and beef and with garnishes of freeze-dried potatoes and white potatoes). Wednesday: Chajchu (filets of beef, green onion, tender broad beans, chopped freeze-dried potatoes, hard boiled eggs, onion sauce, tomatoes and locoto peppers, and covered in red chili). Thursdays: Chanka de conejo (tender guinea pig cooked and flavored with mint, green onion, lima beans, locoto pepper and white potatoes). Friday: Pork rinds (fried pork with white corn and locoto pepper). Saturday: Fidius uchú (noodle in hot chili sauce). And Sunday: Phampaku (duck, piglet, lamb meats with condiments).

“The cooking process takes a long time, each dish can only be cooked once a week…” she says. Her advantage is that her clientele knows the menu in accordance to the day of the week. The disadvantage is that there is a large competition with the same menu. Her dream is to open up a restaurant with several meals depending on the day of the week and the time of day. She’d like to expand her business through the purchase of an industrial oven to bake pizzas and sell them at night. This is the 3rd loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years she’s been working in this business. For these reasons Martha requests a loan to purchase an industrial oven to bake pizzas to sell at night, to open up a restaurant that stays open all day.

loans.use: purchase an industrial oven to bake pizzas to sell at night, to open up a restaurant that stays open all day

loans.name: El Salvador Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EL SALVADOR” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de juguetes, servicio de construcción. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, al  apoyar a su madre en su negocio, con el ahorro de un pequeño capital inicio un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The Communal bank “EL SALVADOR” will start its second loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Regional Hub of Alto Lima. It is formed by eight members and directed by a board where Julia is the Secretary. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied. They include: sale of clothes, sale of blankets, sale of food, sale of toys, building services. The loan they will get will benefit the small businesswomen, Julia being one of its members. She states that she has been in Pro Mujer for a year. She entered after she was invited by a friend, who is a client in the institution. Currently, she has a food sale business. She says that she started this business many years ago in order to support her mother in her business. After saving a small capital, she started an independent business. She will get the loan to add capital (to buy groceries wholesale), that she will purchase from the saleswomen of the city of La Paz, and after preparing the food, she will sell it in her sales space. This way of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is married and has two children. When they ask her what she likes from Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the areas of savings and health offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su dos hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y frijoles desde hace 14 años, comercializa su productos cerca de su casa y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. para continuar con sus cosechas y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Andrés is 49 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and his two children. He works in agriculture. He has grown corn and beans for 14 years. He sells his products close to his house, and what he gets from his sales, he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, etc., in order to continue with his harvests, and in this way to have better financial income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Emmy's Group

texts.en:
Emmy, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Emmy will not only purchase maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvest, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Emmy plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Emmy’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 50-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for twenty years.  He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Shazia's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories including pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to buy these items for his business. Therefore, Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to buy the above tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income.

Shazia is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: and her husband buy tailoring accessories including cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories.

loans.name: Nyamagembe Daraja Grp Group

texts.en:
Paulina, who is aged in her early 40's, has got one boy and a girl who are still schooling. She is single and has been supporting her family with a tailoring business. She has been in this business for two years now starts working from 07 am to 08 pm per working day and is able to make a very small profit each month. 

Nowadays, most tailors use electronic machines and modern working equipment to run their service, according to Paulina. To her side, she still use a leg-rolling machine which takes time and use more energy. She believe, if she gets extra capital, her business will make more extra income because she has more customers. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second credit request to be apportioned among Nyamagembe Daraja, a five members group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Paulina used her previous credit from Kiva, since paid back in full, to buy clothes materials as her business demanded. She is really thankful to everyone who supported and keep supporting Kiva's borrowers. 

Paulina earned extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, she would like to build a nice house for her family.  She will invest part of her new credit requesting to buy clothes-making materials to make clothes and to buy fabrics to resell.

loans.use: to buy clothes-making materials to make clothes and to buy fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Marvin Eduardo

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara pro tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y también a la compra de ganado, se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 6 años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. así como muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus siembras y así tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young man has his face blurred out, because he is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area. He works in agriculture. He grows corn, and he also buys cattle. He has worked in this activity for six years. He sells his products in the surroundings of his home. With what he earns from his sales he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. The young man lives in his own house with his wife. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, etc., as is it shown on the photograph, in order to continue with his crops, and in this way to have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him meet the demands of his customers in milk supply.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. 

She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP micro-finance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a married man. He has five children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, bread and other items. 

He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, flour, bread, and other items. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP micro-finance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, salt, flour, bread, and other items

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Emma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 15 years. Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Khatoon

texts.en:
Khatoon is a 60-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son. 

For meeting the needs of her family members she started a business of goats’ sales and purchase.  Her son also assists her in her work.  Currently she has a few goats. 

Now, Khatoon has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of PKR 20,000, which she used to purchase more goats to sell in the market, to earn good profits and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell in the market, to earn good profits and improve their standard of living.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 58, is a married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. 

She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. Naseem needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and availed a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more animals to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Saleem Akhter

texts.en:
Saleem Akhter is a 45-years-old lady and a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own catering business for past 20 years. 

Saleem Akhter's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise, e.g crockery, wood tables, chairs. and tents, etc., for his business purposes. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise. 

To fulfill the need of her husband, Saleem Akhter has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for business purposes. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Saleem Akhter is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his catering business

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en:
Vigen rents an animal shop in Vanadzor town. He has been running this shop for already five years and over those years of hard work, he was able to make it profitable. 

Vigen trades with different animals (fishes, birds, guinea pigs) and special type of forages. He has now applied for this loan to purchase a car, which he needs for transporting animals (when buying new animals, or transporting to customers). 

That's the reason Vigen has applied for this loan. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drilling tools to enable him to drill more soap stones to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  buy shampoo and hair oils to use while she is at her job.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for more milk production.

loans.name: Evilla

texts.en:
Evilla is 59 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Evilla works very hard to provide for them.

Evilla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like cooking oil, noodles, toothpaste, sanitary pads, detergent soap, etc., to sell.

Evilla has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, noodles, toothpaste, sanitary pads, detergent soap, etc. 

Evilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like cooking oil, noodles, toothpaste, sanitary pads, detergent soap, etc,. to sell

loans.name: Naheeda

texts.en:
Naheeda is a 32-year-old married woman doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband who is also shown in the photo. 

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

Currently she has accessed a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR. It allowed her to purchase more livestock to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
At the age of 34, Fozia is a married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband.  She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her business, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 53 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Tita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Tita has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Tita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rabeccar's Group

texts.en:
Rabeccar, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Matete District. She is 56 years old, is married, and has eight children.

Rabeccar likes to think of herself as a very resourceful person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Rabeccar plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Rabeccar’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida  is 37 years old, a married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 27-year-old Palestinian refugee, a married father of one child. He was born in a Palestinian camp, just like most Palestinians living in Lebanon. He decided to start his own business in 2008.

Mohamad's shop is located in the camp where he is living. This is an issue, because he cannot expand his customer base outside the people living in the camp. Mohamad is sure that, if he could develop his shop properly, he could attract customers from his competitors. 

That's why he is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, so he can increase his business capital with special offer products and new released accessories. 

In this way, Mohamad can respond faster to his customer's needs, and improve his family's socioeconomic situation.

Mohamad hopes to continue to provide his family with the best living standards possible, and he is looking forward to expanding his business in the future and to start wholesale trading if possible.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special offer products and new released accessories

loans.name: Khamida

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Хамида. Ей 36 лет. Она проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Хамида замужем и имеет троих детей. Детям 14, 10 и 6 лет. Хамида на районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности вместе мужем. Она выращивает картофель. Каждый сезон она выращивает зелень. В этом году она хочет, посадит картофель, и ей необходимо отработать землю минеральными удобрениями вперед посадки урожай, чтобы получить качественный и богатый урожай. По этой причине Хамида обратилась за кредитом. У нее нет другого варианта кроме кредит. Она ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en: Meet Khamida, a 36-year-old resident of the city of Tursunzoda.  Khamida is married and she has three children who are 14, 10 and 6 years old.  She and her husband work in agriculture, locally, in their district.  Khamida grows potatoes and also herbs, at each season.  This year she wants to cultivate potatoes and she needs to prepare her land in advance with mineral fertilizers, in order to get an abundant and good quality harvest.  For this reason, she is taking a loan, as she has no other option. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seed potatoes.

loans.name: Majorine

texts.en:
Majorine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She operates a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of sugar, beans, peas, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and jerrycans of cooking oil. 

Majorine generates additional income from rental rooms. Her major business challenges include transportation and power shortages. 

She aspires to buy a bigger fridge so as to stock more drinks. 

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and does not haves access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, beans, peas and cooking oil

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 50 años, casado, tiene un hijo varón de 17 años, y su negocio es la cerrajería.
Él es buen padre, independiente, paciente, constante, activo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la laguna ‘Alalay’ que actúa como pulmón y se sitúa en el centro de la ciudad, tiene una variedad de fauna silvestre, así como aves y peces de diferentes tipos.  De clima templado durante todo el año.
Miguel es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela y de vez en cuando le ayuda en el trabajo. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba eléctrica. Su negocio es la cerrajería, él se ocupa de fabricar puertas, ventanas, portones, rejas, cercas, etc. y también realiza el techado de construcciones con calamina. “comenzamos la cerrajería gracias a la ayuda de mi primo, luego nos independizamos y ambos manejamos pedidos constantes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuando necesita ayuda su hijo le colabora, la desventaja es que viven en zona comercial donde existe mucha competencia. Su sueño es tener un taller de cerrajería amplio para firmar contratos más grandes, él desea realizar la compra de planchas de metal para la fabricación de portones para garaje de autos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Miguel solicita un préstamo para la compra de planchas de metal para fabricar portones de garaje y puertas de casa.
texts.en:
Miguel is a man of 50 years of age. He is married with a 17-year-old son and his business is a locksmith's shop. He is a good father, independent, patient, constant, active, responsible, and hardworking. He conducts his business at the Alalay Lake which is at the heart of the city center. It has a variety of wildlife, birds, and fish of different kinds. The climate is temperate throughout the year.

Miguel is of dark complexion with brown eyes, short black hair, a short stature, and robust physique. His native language is Quechua, which he speaks with his family. He speaks Spanish with the general population and for conducting his business.

He shares his life with his wife who works. His son is studying in school and occasionally helps his father work. They live in a home built of brick and cement with a tin roof. It has electricity and well water drawn by an electric pimp.

His business is a locksmith. He also manufactures door, windows, gates, railings, fences, and more. He also constructs roofs with corrugated metal. “We started the locksmith with the help of my cousin, then we became independent and we both handle constant requests,” says Miguel. The advantage of his business is that he has his son to help him. The disadvantage is that they live in a commercial area with a lot of competition. His dream is to have a comprehensive workshop to sign larger locksmithing contracts. He wants to purchase sheet metal to manufacture car garage gates. This is his first loan in the five years that he has run this business independently.. 

It is for these reasons that Miguel is requesting a loan to purchase sheet metal for manufacturing garage and house doors.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting to manufacture house and garage doors

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.ru: Зульхумор, 45 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Зульхумор средне образование, раньше работала парикмахером. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2006 года занимается продажей и прокатом свадебных платьев. Сейсас в обороте есть платьев на общую сумму 200,000 сом (KGS). Ассортимент широкий, наработаны клиенты. Деятельность приносит хорошую прибыль в размере около 40,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку новых свадебных платьев и заменить мебель в салоне. Доходы от кредита Зульхумор планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность достроить дом и женить младшего сына.
texts.en: Zulhumor is 45 years old, married, and she has two children.  She has a secondary education and she used to work as a hairdresser.  Since 2006, she has been selling and renting out wedding dresses, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  She currently has a large inventory of dresses worth 200,000 som (KGS) and many customers.  This activity brings her a good income of about 40,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, Zulhumor has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy new wedding dresses and to replace the furniture in her shop.  Zulhumor is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her business, which will give her the opportunity to finish the construction of her house and to pay for her youngest son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses and to replace the furniture in her shop.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is 52 years old, a widow woman. She has two children. 

Shagufta is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR. This loan will enable her  to purchase more beads, thread, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit. 

This monetary help can take Shagufta closer to her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, thread, and frames to meet  the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is 38 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Celeste works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Celeste has been in this business for 20 years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, coffee, juice, shampoo, etc. 

Celeste would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 32 years old; she is married with two children.

Genalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Genalyn has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from dried fish and charcoal vending.

Genalyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 42 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Matete District, Kenya. 

Eunice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Eunice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Eunice's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs, and she earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. 

Zubaida is a motivated mother of four children. She is liable to provide them with good quality food, health and clothing. 

For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. The amount will be used  to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, thread and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. 

She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, thread and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru: Мукадас 53 летняя жительница города Турсунзаде. Она на районе живет вместе сыном, дочкой, невесткой и внукам. У нее не большая и дружная семья. Сын занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Невестка и дочка дома занимаются шитьем. Мукадас добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она занимается земледелием у себя во дворе. Мукадас выращивает огурцы и помидоры. Она планирует получить качественный и богатый  урожай, поэтому она хочет купить качественные проверенные удобрения. Но на такое количества удобрений ей не хватает не большая сумма денег. Мукадас запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mukadas is a 53-year-old resident of the city of Tursunzoda.  She lives in this district with her son, daughter, daughter-in-law and grandchildren.  She has a small but friendly family.  Her son works in agriculture.  Her daughter and daughter-in-law work as seamstresses from home.  Mukadas is a kind and hardworking woman.  She grows produce (cucumbers and tomatoes) at home.  She is  counting on an abundant and good-quality harvest, so for this reason she wants to buy fertilizers of a proven, good quality.  However, she is still missing a small amount of money to buy a large quantity of fertilizers, which is the reason why she is taking this loan. She confidently relies on you and on your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and use them to prepare her land.

loans.name: Sara De Jesus

texts.es: Sara de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz desde hace 17 años, cuando esta lista su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, luego la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc.  y asi poder tener una mejor cosecha para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Sara, 48, lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She has earned her living growing corn for 17 years. When the harvest is ready, she stores it in the barn in this photograph. She then sells it in the markets in the surrounding towns. With her earnings she covers some household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest control, and more so she can have a better crop and better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to grown corn

loans.name: Flor De Viento Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE VIENTO” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Noemi es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de dulces, venta de refrescos, venta de comida y venta de chamarras.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Noemi es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia ya que conocía la forma de venta de su vecina, es por ello que decide iniciar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  


Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  la capacitación que ofrece la institución y compartir con su banca comunal.
texts.en:
The loan group "Flor de Viento" will begin its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional center. The group is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Noemi is the president. The businesses that the members of the group run are varied. Among them are selling clothing, selling fruit, selling sweets, selling soft drinks, selling food, and selling jackets.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these microentrepreneurs, of whom Señora Noemi is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago, entering at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She now has a business of selling fruit. She lets it be known that she learned this business on her own initiative, since she knew the form of sales of her neighbor. It is for this reason that she decided to begin an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy fruit wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz, and later she will sell it in the markets in the city of El Alto. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she lives with her partner and has a son.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers and sharing with her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es: Jose de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra maíz y frijoles, tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en la agricultura, comercializa su productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, insecticidas, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas,  etc. así poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
42-year-old Jose lives in his own home with his life partner and their two daughters. His partner works in agriculture, growing corn and beans. She has more than 20 years of experience in agriculture and sells her products in different markets near their home. With her income, she is able to cover some of the family's expenses. 

Jose is requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, pesticides, etc., so that the family can have a higher income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Hugo Antonio

texts.es: Hugo de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, el se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, ganado y al cultivo de maíz y frijoles desde hace 20 años la cual inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cerdos para continuar con la crianza y así podre tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hugo is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and his two daughters. For 20 years, he has made a living raising pigs, livestock, and growing corn and beans, which he started with his own capital. He sells his products in the neighboring towns. With the sales he makes, he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. 

He is asking for a loan to buy more pigs to continue raising them, and that way he will be able to have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Kennedy's Group

texts.en:
Kennedy, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years. He is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Matete District. He is 51 years old, married, and has seven children.

Kennedy likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013, and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Kennedy plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Kennedy’s Group will receive enough inputs to cultivate nine acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es un pequeño  productor café que vive en una comunidad rural en Nicaragua. Junto a su esposa e hijo mayor, se dedica a la producción de este rubro, como principal actividad económica, desde hace más de 10 años. 

Este pequeño caficultor, está consciente de que el precio del café puede variar por diversos factores, por lo que para él su prioridad es aumentar los rendimientos de su cultivo, para poder hacer frente a cualquier baja que se presente en el precio. Para ello, ha diseñado un plan de mejoramiento nutricional de sus plantaciones, y para implementarlo está solicitando un financiamiento para asegurar la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le ayudarán a cumplir con sus metas a corto plazo.

El sueño de Nelson es mejorar sus ingresos para darle mejores condiciones a su familia, la cual cuenta con lo básico para vivir, pero afirma que con su pequeña finca puede llegar a tener mejor calidad de vida, optimizando los recursos con los que cuenta.
texts.en:
Nelson is a small coffee producer who lives in a rural Nicaraguan community.  He, his wife, and oldest son have been working in this field for more than 10 years.

This small coffee farmer knows that the price of coffee can vary due to different factors and his priority is to increase production so he can frontload any price reductions.  He has developed a nutritional improvement plan for his crops and is asking for a loan to implement it and buy fertilizer and compost that will help achieve his short term goals.

Nelson’s dream is to improve his income so he can provide better conditions for his family.  They have their basic needs met, but he says that he can achieve a better quality of life through his small farm, by optimizing his resources.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and certified seeds.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
The person who appears in this photo is Francisca. She is 37 years old and married with six children. Francisca joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to benefit from training in enterprise development and financial management. 

She operates a kiosk, selling vegetables such as tomatoes, carrots and cabbages. She is borrowing from Kiva to pay for the construction of a more permanent, modern and spacious kiosk. She hopes this will enable her to have enough space to add more stock, hence increasing her income.
 
Francisca is grateful to Kiva and her lenders, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a more permanent, modern and spacious kiosk.

loans.name: Maisha Bora Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Maisha Bora Women's Group in Nakuru, Kenya. She is 47 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in January 2013.

Mary practices tomato farming. She has gone through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, which has enabled her to acquire skills on enterprise and value chain management. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to improve her tomato farming through the purchase of additional farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide. This will increase her income, which she will use to educate her children, provide medical care, and other family needs.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide to help boost her farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy goats that will help him improve on milk production.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Hello lenders, meet Paul. Paul is a seasoned farmer from the Kibichoi area in Central Kenya. Paul does the hard work of fetching water from the river and pouring it in a tank for storage. This water is used both for domestic use and for irrigating his plants. In a bid to simplify his work and improve efficiency, Paul is planning to buy a water pump. Unfortunately, all his income is committed to family needs so he is unable to buy a water pump without leveraging his assets to secure external financing. Lucky for him, he is a member of Juhudi Kilimo, Kiva's field partner. Help Paul find a simple and effective solution to bring water to his home and farm by lending a $25 loan. Your investment will save him the time and energy spent on fetching water which he could then apply to his other income-generating activities, for example, his “side hustle” business.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre de 34 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 9 y 13 años de edad, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Antonio para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica desde hace cinco años a la agricultura gracias a esta actividad a logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Antonio ahora se ve la necesidad de solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de abono químico pues lamentablemente él no cuenta con el capital para poder comprarlo.
Antonio guarda las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder comprar su abono y darle mantenimiento a su cultivo, para luego obtener buenos ingresos y comprar un vehículo
texts.en:
Antonio is a man of 34 years of age. He is married and has a lovely family of three children, with ages between 9 and 13. This lovely family lives in a community of Sololá.

To generate his income and raise his family, Antonio has worked in agriculture for five years. Thanks to this work, he has managed to raise his family.

Antonio now sees the need to apply for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizer, since unfortunately he doesn't have the capital to be able to buy it.

Antonio maintains hopes of obtaining the loan in order to be able to buy his fertilizer and maintain his crop so that he can then obtain good income and buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his crop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock of fish to resell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of her children go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells cow ghee at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She gets additional income from poultry farming. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy tins of cow ghee and plastic tins for packing ghee. Her major business challenges are perishability of ghee and seasonality. Her goals are to buy a better fridge to keep her ghee fresh. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy tins of cow ghee and plastic tins for packing ghee.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta's second loan from Kiva. She used her first loan to purchase clothing and sell it to her clients. Thanks to the income earned, Julieta was able to purchase home supplies and cover basic costs for that time. 

Julieta is now the mother of two children, as her second son was born in 2014. After successfully paying her first loan back, Julieta asks for this second loan to purchase new stock of clothing (spring-summer collection) to cover customers' orders. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

As a responsible borrower, Julieta hopes for lenders' support one more time. She dreams of developing her retail business and providing her customers with fashionable and quality clothing.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing (spring-summer collection)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy dairy feeds that will help boost milk productivity.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 41-year-old married woman. A year ago she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Currently, Robina has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR). She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to add more rental houses for his clients after he sells milk.

loans.name: Mitini W.g Group

texts.en:
Esther is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photograph. She is a member of Mitini W.G. She is 63 years old, married and a mother of six. She has greatly benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) training on enterprise development, which equipped her with skills to effectively manage her business.

She operates a general retail shop selling commodities like sugar, salt, tea leaves, cooking fat and other household items. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more foodstuffs and hence earn more income. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as sugar, salt, tea leaves and cooking fat to add stock to her general retail shop and hence earn more income.

loans.name: Zebedayo's Group

texts.en:
Zebedayo, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Matete District. He is 56 years old, is married and has seven children.
