Zebedayo likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent his group because he likes being a leader. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Zebedayo plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Zebedayo’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 10 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is 48 years old and he lives with his family in the village of Shahumyan in the Lori region. Yurik has higher education and 15 years of pedagogical education. He works at the State University in the department of Armenian History; here he is a lecturer and Assistant Professor greatly respected and beloved by his students. 

Yurik’s wife is also a pedagogue and she works at the school. They have two pretty daughters and a son. Yurik’s daughters are students; in the future, the elder daughter will be a linguist and the younger will be a specialist of modern technologies. Both of them study at the paid division. Yurik mentions that despite great financial hardships, he is sure that through higher education, his daughters will have a lot of achievements in their life. Yurik asks for this loan to pay for his daughters’ tuition fee for the second semester (225,000 Armenian drams for elder daughter’s education and 155,000 for his younger daughter’s education).

loans.use: to pay for his daughters’ tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 39 years old and married to Doricas. He supports four family members. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years, and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which he plans to buy a dairy cow to enable him to buy improved farm tools and inputs so as to get a better harvest to sell in the market.

He hope to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him to buy improved farm tools and inputs so as to get a better harvest to sell in the market.

loans.name: Khariton

texts.en:
Khariton, a very prosperous and successful businessman from Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region, hopes that he will have his fourth deal with Kiva lenders. 

Khariton has a business of a wholesale grocery trade from his warehouse to other grocery stores. Since being in this business since 2011, now he is greatly famous. He is still having a lot of big and profitable orders from his city since the assortment of his products is really very great and in demand.

Khariton is sure that if he receive this Kiva loan, his success is again granted. This loan he will use for the development of his business; particularly, he wants to buy a new assortment of candies, juices and also pasta.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of candies, juices and  pasta

loans.name: Josephs's Group

texts.en:
Josephs is a 66-year-old proud father of 11 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Josephs has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Josephs described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Josephs’ Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Rose is representing her group of 10 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Rose has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Rose is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 5.25 acres will be planted by Rose's Group, and between them they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 50-year-old married mother of two children. She has been preparing and selling "Mouneh" for ten years to help her husband cover the increasing needs and expenses of their family.

Dalal is a sacrificing mother, and hard worker who is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions.  Therefore, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a motorcycle in order to facilitate her family's way of life. 

Dalal's family is her priority and she hopes to be able to provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to facilitate her family's life.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 49-year-old, hardworking woman running a business of selling milk. She has buffaloes for milking purpose and sells the milk in her area. 

Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 4 children and is a dedicated mother who wants the best for them. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation in the past, and now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales to earn more income. This will help her to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Abahizi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Léonidas fait partie du groupe  Abahizi II et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 27ans et est marié à Marie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 2 mois à 6ans, dont  1 étudie.

Il a sous sa charge 1enfant membre de sa famille élargie qui étudie. 

Il fait le commerce de   manioc sec  depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son  troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   du manioc sec  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  être un commerçant importateur, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Léonidas is a member of the Abahizi II Group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 27 years old and married to Marie, a retailer.  Together they have three children aged between two months and six years.  One of their children attends school.  He is also responsible for another child from within his extended family who is studying.

Léonidas has been selling dried cassava for ten years.  This will be his third loan with the field partner, Turame, it will increase his working capital and allow him to buy more stocks of dried cassava for resale.

In the coming years, Léonidas would like to become an importer and support his children while they study.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy dried cassava for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy root vegetables (yams) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy root vegetables (yams) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy root vegetables (potatoes) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy high quality traditional cloth

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, Micro finance institutions (M.F.Is) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. Meet John, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest father who is 34 years of age. He hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya. He is the proud father of four lovely children. He loves and treasures his children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. John's primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures, he has been able to earn a decent income. He is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for seven years, and throughout, he has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble dad has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses". He faces financial challenges, and because the Nyamira area has proven a ready market for cereals, he is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve his income. John's upbringing was challenging, and he has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling dad has been making great improvements, and he believes that through your loan, he will be able to realize his goal of improving his living conditions and transforming his life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, John has received training and he has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. He intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from his business. John is quite visionary and - with his accumulated profits - hopes he will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost his income and turn his life around.

Kindly help him out!

loans.use: To buy cereals for re-sale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all of them go to school. She takes of additional family members. She lives in her own house with access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for two years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to buy land and start farming. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is the 43-year-old married mother of five children. After working for six years as a sales agent, she decided to start her own home-based business, so she started selling Brazilian gold accessories from her home. She is a hard worker and has a wide client base. 

Today, Hanaa is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of Brazilian gold, in addition to make-up. 

In the future, Hanaa seeks to enlarge her client outreach by establishing a small store.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of Brazilian gold and make-up

loans.name: Hrachya

texts.en: Hrachya is 21 years old and, as he likes to say, being born in a family that has such a big farm he could not choose any other occupation than farming. With all his family members (he lives with his parents and brother), Hrachya takes care of his farm cattle, which he is great at; he has 40 cows, 27 calves and 13 pigs. It is vivid that in his farm, meat selling makes up the main part of the family income. Hrachya sells it mainly to city butchers, who usually give big orders to him, since his farm’s meat is clean, fresh and very tasty. His mother also sells their farm milk and cheese made by her. This will be Hrachya’s first deal with Kiva and he hopes that with this first partnership, he will find a good partner in his farming; with this loan amount he will buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for milk production

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима, 32 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Фотимы - среднее образование, 9 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть корова, 10 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 ГА арендованной земли, она выращивает арбузы для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Фотима обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) для покупки семян, удобрений и клеенки для парника, чтобы выращивать экологически-чистые арбузы. Фотима является участником группы "Айгул", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в развитие ее бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Fotima is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children. Fotima has a secondary education, and has practiced field and animal husbandry for 9 years. She now has a cow and 10 sheep on her farm. She grows watermelons for on-farm use on a rented plot of land measuring 1.0 hectares. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farm, Fotima has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds, fertilizer, and plastic for a greenhouse so that she can grow organic watermelons. Fotima is a member of the group "Aygul," which has another 2 people in it, for a total of 3 people. Fotima wants to use the proceeds from her loan to develop her business and build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and plastic for her greenhouse in order to grow organic watermelons.

loans.name: Nuraiym

texts.ru: Нурайым, 27 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее - среднее образование, 8 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день у Нурайым в хозяйстве есть корова, 15 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 ГА арендованной земли, она выращивает арбузы для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурайым обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для покупки семян, удобрений и клеенки для парника, чтобы выращивать экологически-чистые арбузы. Нурайым является участником группы "Айгул", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в развитие ее бизнеса и покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Nuraiym is 27 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She has a secondary education, and has been practicing field and animal husbandry for 8 years. Nuraiym's farm now has a cow and 15 sheep on it. She grows watermelons for on-farm consumption on a rented plot of land measuring 1.0 hectares. Her monthly income is 25,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her farm, Nuraiym has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds, fertilizer, and plastic for a greenhouse so that she can grow organic watermelons. Nuraiym is a member of the group "Aygul," which has another 2 people in it, for a total of 3 people. She wants to use the proceeds from the loan to develop her business and buy an automobile for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and plastic for her greenhouse in order to grow organic watermelons

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азиза, 26 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Азизы- среднее образование, уже 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день у Азизы в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 20 овец, она продает экологически-чистое молоко. На участке мерою 1,0 ГА выращивает арбузы для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Азиза обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки семян, удобрений и клеенки для парника, чтобы выращивать экологически-чистые арбузы. Азиза является лидером группы "Айгул", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в развитие ее бизнеса и приобретение дополнительного скота.
texts.en:
Aziza is 26 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Aziza has a secondary education, and has been practicing field and animal husbandry for 5 years. Aziza now has 2 cows and 20 sheep on her farm, and she sells organic milk. She grows watermelons for on-farm use, on a plot of land measuring 1.0 hectares. Her monthly income is 25,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farm, Aziza has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds, fertilizer, and plastic for a greenhouse so that she can grow organic watermelons. Aziza is the leader of the group "Aygul," which has another 2 people in it, for a total of 3 people. She wants to use the proceeds from the loan to develop her business and purchase more livestock.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and plastic for her greenhouse in order to grow organic watermelons.

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
Wilson, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Wilson is representing his group of 11 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Wilson has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting, as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Wilson is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 6.75 acres will be planted by Wilson's Group, and between them, they will receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Sharapat

texts.ru: Шарапат, 59 лет, мать 3 детей. У Шарапат среднее образование, на протяжении 5 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, у нее развитое хозяйство. Шарапат на пенсии, у нее есть корова, 20 овец. На 1,11 Га земли Шарапат выращивает рис. Она занимается куплей-продажей риса, то есть, она покупает рис у населения и выращенный ею самой, и продает на рынке. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 200 долларов (USD). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шарапат обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 3,000 долларов (USD) на покупку риса для перепродажи. Доходы Шарапат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса и обучение младшего сына в университете.
texts.en: Sharapat is 59 years old and a mother of three children. She has a high school degree and has been farming and raising livestock for the last five years. Her farming business is doing well. Sharapat is now retired and owns a cow, 20 sheep as well as grows rice on 1.11 hectares of land. She also re-sells rice on the market: she purchases rice from other farmers and takes it with her own rice to sell at the market. Her monthly income is 200 dollars (USD). In order to further expand her farming business, Sharapat has turned to "Bai Tushum" for a loan of 3,300 dollars (USD). She will use the loan to purchase more rice for re-sale at the market. The profits from this loan she plans to invest into her farm and pay for her youngest son's college education.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale in market

loans.name: Gylbyvi

texts.ru: Гулбуви женщина в возрасте 49 лет, замужем и  имеет  двоих  детей. Она живет в сельской местности. Гулбуви с юных лет занимается животноводством.  У нее нету образования, поэтому  всю свою жизнь занимается выращиванием скота. Муж у нее  подрабатывает шафером,  но его деньги уходят только на семейные нужды иногда даже и не хватает, а дети помогают своей маме по хозяйству, поэтому выращивание скота это их основной доход. Гулбуви ухаживает за баранами, а ее муж занимается купле продажей баранов. Они трудятся день и ночь, чтобы дать своим детям образование, чтобы они как свои родители не знали нужд. Гулбуви берет кредит, чтобы  расширить свое стадо. Для этого у нее мало средств и она решила обратиться за помощью в  «АРВАНД».   Она очень благодарна таким организациям, что с их помощью люди со средним и низким уровнем жизни могут улучшить свои условия проживания.
texts.en: Gylbyvi is a 40 year old woman, married and has two children. She lives in a rural area. Gylbyvi has been take care of livestock since her youth. She has no education, so she has raised animals all her life. Gylbyvi's husband works as a diver, but his income is not sufficient to support the family. Gylbyvi's children help their mother around the house, so livestock has become the family's main source of income. Gylbyvi takes care of the sheep, while her husband sells the animals on the market. They work day and night to that they can give their children an education, and prepare them for a better life. Gylbyvi is taking out this loan in order to expand her herd. She doesn't have sufficient savings, so she has chosen to turn to Arvand. She is very grateful to this organization , as with their help people with middle and low income can try and improve their lot in life.

loans.use: to fatten and breed cattle

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Фарогат женщина в возрасте 33 лет,  имеет двоих   детей. Она живет в сельской местности. Фарогат с юных лет занимается животноводством.  Так как   у нее родители занимались  животноводством . Поэтому  всю свою жизнь Фарогат занимается выращиванием скота.  Фарогат является  матерью одиночкой и своих детей   она обеспечивает сама . Папа у нее работает в России в частной фирме   и каждый месяц отправляет дочери деньги. Фарогат ухаживает за скотом, а ее дети помогают по хозяйству.  Она трудится день и ночь, чтобы дать своим детям образование, чтобы они  не знали нужд.  Фарогат  берет кредит, чтобы  расширить свое стадо. Для этого у нее мало  средств и она решила обратиться за помощью в  "АРВАНД".   Она очень благодарна , что с помощью "Арванд" люди со средним и низким уровнем жизни могут улучшить свои условия проживания и добиться своей мечты.
texts.en: Farogat is a 33 year old woman with two children. She live in a rural area. She has been raising livestock since youth, just like her parents. She is a single mother and has to provide for her children on her own. Her father works in Russia in a private company, and sends his daugher money every month. Farogat takes care of the livestock and her children help her around the house. She works day and night to give her children an education so that they will have a better life. Farogat is taking out this loan to expand her herd. She has few savings of her own and decided to turn to "Arvand" for help. She is grateful that with Arvand's help people with low and middle income can improve their living conditions and achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to fatten and sell cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of farm supplies in order  to earn more income.

loans.name: Nurzait

texts.ru: Нурзаит, 42 года, замужем. У Нурзаит среднее образование, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью. Поэтому уже много лет, Нурзаит занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 30 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 ГА она выращивает арбузы для реализации.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота племенных пород. Доходы от кредита Нурзаит планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и накопить на постройку сарая.
texts.en: Nurzait is 42 years old and married. She has a high school degree. It is hard to find work in her village, but she has to support her family. She supports her family by farming and raising livestock. Nurzait has been farming for many years and now owns 4 cows, 30 sheep and grows watermelons on 1 hectares of land. In order to expand her business, she has turned to "Bai Tushum" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS). She will use the money to buy pure-bred livestock. She will use the profits to further expand her herd and build a new barn.

loans.use: to buy additional purebred livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru: Бурмакан успешно погасила свой кредит, она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бурмакан есть корова, 10 овец. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает арбузы для реализации. Ее совокупная ежемесячная прибыль составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). Бурмакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и клеенки для ее теплицы, чтобы выращивать экологически чистые арбузы. Доходы от кредита позволят развить бизнес и увеличить ее прибыль.
texts.en: Burmakan has successfully repaid her loan and she is grateful to Kiva and to everyone who supported her. Currently Burmakan owns a cow, 10 sheep and grows watermelons on 1 hectares of land. Her monthly farm income is 25,000 som (KGS). Burmakan has turned to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 50, 000 som (KGS) to to buy fertilizers, seeds and plastic for her greenhouse in order to grow organic watermelons. She will use the profits to expand her business and her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and plastic for her greenhouse in order to grow organic watermelons

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Irina is from Novaya Kahovka. She is 46 and married with adult daughters. Irina works at a local market renting property from the administration of the marketplace. Irina sells denim clothing items. She has been in this business for 21 years. She is an experienced market vendor with quality merchandise at affordable price that is always in demand. 
Irina is seeking to receive 37 000 Grivnyas to buy seasonal denim clothing: jackets, pants, tunics, capris and shorts. Irina is planning to buy inventory wholesale in a batch and later resale it at retail price at home.
texts.en:
Irina is from Novaya Kahovka. She is 46 and married with adult daughters.

Irina works at a local market selling denim clothing items. She rents property from the administration of the marketplace and she has been in this business for 21 years. She is an experienced market vendor with quality merchandise at affordable prices that is always in demand. 

Irina is seeking to receive 37,000 UAH to buy seasonal denim clothing like jackets, pants, tunics, capris and shorts. She is planning to buy inventory wholesale in a batch, and then resell it retail at home.

loans.use: to buy seasonal denim clothing like jackets, pants, tunics, capris and shorts

loans.name: Suyumkan

texts.ru: Суюмкан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению, она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 3 дойные коровы, 2 теленка. На ежедневной основе она продает экологически-чистое молоко. На 1,80 Га земли выращивает картофель и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Суюмкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров, часть средств направит на покупку семян и минеральных удобрений. Суюмкан является лидером группы "Алга Чонкапка", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от ведения бизнеса позволят улучшить благосостояние семьи и развить ее бизнес и накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Suyumkan successfully repaid her previous loan, after using for its intended purpose.  She is very thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her obtain this financing.  She currently has three dairy cows and two calves on her farm, and she sells organic milk on a daily basis.  She also grows potatoes and clover for resale on 1.8 hectares of land.  She makes a total monthly income of up to 25,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, Suyumkan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two dairy cows.  With the extra money, she will also purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.  Suyumkan is the leader of the "Alga Chonkapka" group, which comprises another two members, so a total of three people.  The earnings from her activity will allow her to improve her family's well-being, develop her business and save some money toward her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows, as well as seeds and fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow organic produce.

loans.name: Ben's Group

texts.en:
Ben, pictured above, has 10 children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. He is representing his group of 12 farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Ben has been a farmer for more than 40 years and, in order to earn enough to send his children to school, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Ben is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 6 acres will be planted by Ben's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Rozakhan

texts.ru: Розахан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению, она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 2 дойные коровы. На ежедневной основе она продает экологически-чистое домашнее молоко. На 2,0 Га арендованной и 0,40 Га собственной земли выращивает картофель, перец и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Розахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Розахан является участником группы "Алга Чонкапка", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от ведения бизнеса позволят улучшить благосостояние семьи, развить ее бизнес и накопить на покупку бытовой техники для дома.
texts.en:
Rozakhan successfully repaid her previous loan, after using it for its intended purpose.  She is very thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her obtain this financing.  She currently has two cows on her farm and she sells home-produced organic milk on a daily basis.  In addition, she grows potatoes, pepper and clover for resale on two hectares of rented land and 0.4 hectares of her own land.  She makes a total monthly income of about 12,000 som (KGS).  

In order to further develop her business, Rozakhan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock and increase the size of her herd.  Rozakhan is a member of the "Alga Chonkapka" group which comprises another two people, so a total of three.  The earnings from her activity will allow her to improve her family's well-being, to develop her business and to save enough money to buy home appliances.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru: Алмакан успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению, она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем кто, помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 6 дойных коров и 5 телят. На ежедневной основе она продает экологически-чистое домашнее молоко. На 3,2 Га земли выращивает фасоль, перец и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет до 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алмакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Алмакан является участником группы "Алга Чонкапка", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы от ведения бизнеса позволят улучшить благосостояние семьи, развить ее бизнес и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Almakan successfully repaid her previous loan, after using it for its intended purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her obtain this financing. She currently has six cows and five calves on her farm, and she sells home-produced organic milk on a daily basis. In addition, she grows beans, pepper and clover for resale on 3.2 hectares of land. She makes a total monthly income of up to 20,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Almakan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock and increase the size of her herd. Almakan is a member of the "Alga Chonkapka" group which comprises another two people, so a total of three. The earnings from her activity will allow her to improve her family's well-being, to develop her business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анара, 29 лет, замужем. У Анары среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве Анары есть 4 коровы и 30 овец. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает арбузы для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку клеенки для парника, семян и удобрений для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита позволят Анаре развить ее бизнес и построить большой сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Anara is 29 years old, married, and she has a secondary education.  For the past five years, she has been involved in agriculture, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  Anara has four cows and 30 sheep on her farm.  She also grows watermelons for resale on one hectare of land.

In order to further grow her business, Anara has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy plastic sheeting for her greenhouse, as well as seeds and fertilizers to prepare her land.  The earnings from her loan will allow her to develop her business and to build a larger barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and plastic sheeting for her greenhouse in order to grow organic watermelons.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia is 43 years old and she is mother of 2 children Celia is a cheff and she makes pastries Celia makes her pastries at her house she goes to the street and sell her products there many times she goes to catholic churches to offer her pastries Celia needs a loan to build up  a couple of rooms at her house (As you can see in the picture the place is tiny and old) because she needs to be more comfortable to cook and also she wants that her children live in a better place. Celia needs your help she is getting divorced
texts.en:
Celia, 43, is the mother of two children.  She is a chef and makes pastries at home which she sells as a street vendor.  Often she goes to the catholic churches to off her pastries.

Celia needs a loan to build additional rooms at her house (as you can see in the picture the place is tiny and old).  She needs a more comfortable place to cook and also wants her children to live in better surroundings.  Celia needs your help because she is in the process of a divorce.

loans.use: To add on rooms to her house.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es: Silvio is 33 years old he lives at La Paz and he is a mason Silvio is married and her wife has a women clothes stand Silvio needs a loan to fix a room at his house As you can see in the picture the recent rains deteriorated the walls so a repairment is needed besides Silvio wants to rent the room Silvio would like to complete the construction of his house in a not distant future He hopes you can help him Silvio is father of  3 children he also wants to help them and to give them a better place to live
texts.en:
Silvio is 33 years old and lives in La Paz.  He is a mason and his wife has a women clothes stand. Silvio needs a loan to fix a room at his house (as you can see in the picture the recent rains deteriorated the walls so a repair is needed).  Silvio wants to rent the room and would like to complete the construction of his house in the not-too-distant future.

He hopes you can help him.  Silvio is the father of three children who he wants to help and offer a better place to live.

loans.use: to fix a room at his house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tubers (potatoes).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments (fresh gombo)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow for milk production and to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his clients.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with four children and all of them go to school. She has additional family members. 

She sells vegetables and fruits at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 13 years. 

Teo has requested a loan of 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy greens, oranges, mangos,oranges, pineapples and tomatoes. 

She gets additional income from making mats. Her major challenges include seasonality and perishability. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land to start growing vegetables. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy greens, oranges, mangos, oranges and pineapples

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en una escuela.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en una escuela de la zona ‘16 de julio’ área comercial de producción de pequeñas y medianas empresas, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre  0-14 grados centígrados y se encuentra a una altitud aproximada de 4070 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Ana es de tez morena, ojos obscuros, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja y con su hijo que está comenzando la escuela, viven en la casa de su abuelo construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas natural y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad en una escuela. Diariamente la venta se centra en dulces, galletas, refrescos, jugos, golosinas, etc. Actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes en el horario de la mañana y de la tarde. “inicié mi negocio con un capital mínimo, como ayudante de cocina ayudando a mi hermana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que atiende en 2 horarios dejando el resto del tiempo para cuidar a su hijo, la desventaja son las vacaciones escolares cuando el colegio sierra. Su sueño es abrir un snack para la venta de comida, ella desea ampliar la oferta de productos mediante la compra de una congeladora para guardar helados y conservas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera para ofertar helados y abrir un snack para la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 25-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has a 5-year-old son. She sells food and other basic products at a school.

She is a good mother, and an entrepreneurial, independent, persistent, responsible and hardworking woman. Her store is located at a school in an area called “16 de julio,” which is a commercial area with small and medium-sized companies. It is cold and dry there, and the temperature ranges between 0 and 14 °C [32-57 °F]. This place is located 4,070 m [13,350 ft.] above sea level.

Ana has a dark complexion and dark eyes. She is short and has long, black braided hair. She wears traditional clothes (hat, shawl and long skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará. She speaks Aymará with her family, but she speaks Spanish when doing business and for cultural reasons. She shares her life with her partner, who works, and with her son, who has just started school. They live with her grandfather in a house made of brick and cement and with a metal roof, which is served with water, electricity, natural gas and sewage.

Ana sells different products at a school. Every day, she sells candies, cookies, sodas, juices, sweets, etc. She works from Monday to Friday in the morning and the afternoon. “I started my business with very little money when I worked with my sister as a kitchen assistant,” she says. The advantage of having this type of business is that she has time left to spend with her son. The disadvantage is that she has to close the store during the vacations period. She dreams of opening a stall to sell food.

Ana wants to offer a wider variety of products. For this, she wants to buy a freezer where she can store ice cream and other types of food. This is her first loan from the institution, although she has had this business for three years. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a freezer. She will start selling ice cream and different types of food.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to sell ice cream and other types of food.

loans.name: Alvie

texts.en:
Alvie engages in raising hogs.  She hails from Mayorga, Leyte. She is a 27-year-old woman with a 4-year-old dependent. She has been raising hogs for three years now. She needs capital to support her existing source of income.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and restore the pig pen. This will improve the quality of hogs Alvie raises, and it will also give comfort and safety as well. Thus, she could slowly increase her earnings and be able to settle her obligation. She could now provide her child with nutritious meals and better living conditions.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and restore the pig pen

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 26 years old, married, and supports a family of three members. He has been operating in retail for the last 10 years, and earns KES12,000 per month. 

Geoffrey has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to add more stock in his business for more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hope and dream is to have educated children.

loans.use: To add more stock in his business for more income.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jasmin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, coffee, canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, eggs, etc. to sell.

Jasmin has been in this business for years, and sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, eggs, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, coffee, canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Luna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and dried fish vending.  Ma. Luna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Ma. Luna has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 25 years now.

Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 42 years old; she is married with four children.

Irene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Irene has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Irene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Paul is 35 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. He has four children and is married. As a group leader, Paul is representing his group of 10 farmers in Matete District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Paul's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

Paul and his group will receive a total of 9 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Wandika's Group

texts.en:
Wandika, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. He is 47 years old and a married father of five children, often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Wandika has been a farmer for 10 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though he is new to the program, Wandika wanted to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Wandika hopes to be able to save more money for the future.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of six acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights, as, even though Wandika decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Augustine's Group

texts.en:
Augustine, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Matete District. He is 69 years old, is married, and has nine children.

Augustine likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Augustine plans to use the profits from this coming season to repair his home.

In total, Augustine’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 9.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: St. Charles Lwanga School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Nobert. He is the head teacher of St. Charles Lwanga School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kitabi in Bushenyi with 500 students. 

St. Charles Lwanga School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. 

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Charles Lwanga School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Nobert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey (in a white shirt) has been a farmer for a long time and knows what it takes to succeed. He is a hard worker who always says, “I eat from my sweat.” He lives in Kapletundo, a rural village in the rich highlands of Litein. He is happily married and has been blessed with angelic looking children. 

He has farmed for five years, and has never regretted it. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crops. Most of the small-holder farmers in Kapletundo village own approximately ¼ acre of land per household, and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. He has been able to earn a decent and honest living by selling milk and eggs. These ventures have enabled him to send his children to school and feed his family. Geoffrey has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow. This enhances his milk-selling profits. 

Because of increased demand, Geoffrey requests a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Geoffrey is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Geoffrey is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family. 

Geoffrey, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Geoffrey save more effectively. 

He plans to add value to his milk through packaging. He also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yogurt and cream. Geoffrey will be able to continue farming and succeed with your help!

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow
